column7: Associate Project EngineerOTTO – designed, manufactured and precision tested, right here in the USA.Recent college graduates will be considered!OTTO's opportunity:Our Associate Project Engineer will develop products through design layout and analysis, prototyping, testing and documentation that meet or exceed customer marketing specifications with regards to performance, appearance, cost and quality. Manage the activities of a product development effort from initial conception to release to production. Provide production support and coordinate activities between engineering, other internal departments, vendors and customers to successfully achieve goals set for the project. Degree of supervision required to perform job duties should not exceed 30%.Specifically, the Associate Project Engineer will:Establish the design concepts and develop performance specifications for products which meet or exceed customer and marketing goals in all respects Provide product and tooling cost estimates for quotations to customers Determine and maintain project schedules and milestones which meet or exceed desired customer and marketing goals Perform mathematical calculations pertaining to performance modeling, stress analysis, tolerance studies, and statistical properties of engineering data both manually and utilizing CAE tools Layout complete designs of product assemblies, subassemblies, and detailed piece parts both manually and utilizing CAD tools Prepare drawings, BOM's ECN's, and all other documents as required Proactively inform management of changes in circumstances, provide alternative corrective actions to maintain progress, and recover original schedules if possible Coordinate activities affecting internal departments, vendors, and customers required to achieve project schedules, milestones and goals Support production and quality control in solving design and process related problems on existing products Maintain a thorough understanding of engineering and scientific principles which can be utilized to develop products which provide predictable and reliable performance Provide technical guidance to support staff such as drafters, designers and technicians Participate in the Material Review Board (MRB) as needed – including developing and processing Discrepant Material Reports (DMRs) and performing part analysis as directed by MRB members Assist with other related duties as required or assignedWhat you'll need to bring to the table:Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent is strongly preferred Minimum of 2 full time years of courses in an engineering curriculum 0-2 years of experience in the engineering field of practice including use of mechanical CAD (preferably Pro-E) Strong oral and written communication skills Must be able to work in a quick paced environment Good follow-up skillsOTTO's Benefits:Medical Insurance Dental Insurance Vision Insurance 401(k) with a company match Tuition Assistance Life Insurance Benefits Competitive Pay Profit Sharing Bonus Paid Vacation and Holidays Company Picnic Holiday Party AND numerous OTTO celebrations throughout the year!To review all of OTTO's available opportunities, please visit our career page by clicking on the link What to Expect     As an Analysis Engineer, you will play a critical role in the development and manufacturing of next generation Tesla products. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and optimizing the performance of revolutionary vehicle battery cell, battery pack designs. You will be brilliant both technically as an individual, and as an active member in a diverse and challenging cross-functional team environment. You will work with vehicle engineering teams, battery cell team, battery module and battery pack team to analyze the performance of future cell and pack designs and with Test Engineering teams to develop tests, correlate simulation models and improve the predictive capability of Analysis Engineering at Tesla. As a member of CAE team, you will work on multi-scale problems that starts from modeling battery electrode active coating particles to assembled cell and to assembled pack and eventually to full vehicle, with a full integration that helps to evaluate a small change in cell on its impacts on full vehicle performance, such as underside abuse when vehicle run over road debris.   What You’ll Do  Develop of state of art finite element (FE) models of cell, pack, and vehicle sub-systems to the finest detail Characterization of battery related materials and development of advanced material models for CAE simulations Perform advanced CAE simulations to evaluate and enhance understanding the behavior of the cell, pack, and vehicle sub-systems around battery pack under both static and dynamic events Supporting design progression and evolution with multi-disciplinary engineering teams based on your analyses Develop and apply advanced methodologies with smart analysis techniques to drive innovation into Tesla products Perform post-test reviews and corroborate the CAE predictions to test results Perform analyses for feasibility of manufacturing, assembly, and service processes What You’ll Bring  5 + years of relevant experience Detailed and applied knowledge of Finite Element Analysis, Applied Solid Mechanics Material Science and Numerical Methods in a product development environment Detailed and applied software experience in CAE pre-processors, solvers, and post- processors in a product development environment. ANSA, PRIMER, LS-DYNA, Abaqus, HyperWorks and META preferred. Additional experience in ANSYS-FLUENT, STAR CCM+ is beneficial Preferred experience in stand-alone or coupled analysis of battery system for structural, thermal, fluid mechanics and electro-magnetism Demonstrated ability to work independently and with teams on problems that are challenging to solve and requiring innovative solutions Demonstrated ability to deconstruct complex test scenarios with good logic and analysis, root-causing and resolving correlation issues Demonstrated ability in iterative and collaborative engineering environments – success in roles requiring high levels of technical communication and interpretation of analytical results to design engineers and technical leadership

At YETI, we believe that time spent outdoors matters more than ever and our gear can make that time extraordinary. When you work here, you'll have the opportunity to create exceptional, meaningful work and problem solve with innovative team members by your side. Together, you'll help our customers get the high-quality gear they need to make the most of their adventures. We are BUILT FOR THE WILD™. You are a highly motivated self-starting Design Engineer II with a proven track record of bringing consumer products to market. You thrive in fast-paced environments with entrepreneurial DNA and are comfortable charting new territory. Your strong organizational skills allow you to stay on top of multiple projects at the same time. Your product design engineering chops allow you to research, create, review, support, and manage. You have a natural curiosity and repeatedly ask the question, "Is there a better way?" You can trouble-shoot and problem-solve every different kind of product, manufacturing, or material challenge thrown your way. In fact, you love solving problems – the bigger the challenge, the more satisfying the resolution. The Design Engineer II is a core member of the NPD team acting as the bridge from product ideation to production, designing with manufacturing in mind while pushing the envelope of what is possible for the best product performance and user experience. Position Type (See Workplace Approach Below): Hybrid Responsibilities:Manage multiple projects from ideation to productionTranslate marketing requirements to technical performance requirementsEstablish product architecture including part breakout and material selectionCreate proof of principle prototypesOwn all aspects of 3D and 2D CADUtilize CAE analysis tools to raise confidence in designEstablish product manufacturing specifications and critical to quality metricsCollaborate closely with Industrial Design team and vendors to balance intent with manufacturability and performanceCreate and lead design validation testing based on DFMEADrive IP clearance and filingsTechnical documentation of key project decisions and design changesRegular reporting to cross-functional and leadership teams on key project indicators – schedule, budget, and quality Qualifications and Attributes:B.S. or higher in Mechanical, Manufacturing, or Plastics Engineering, or equivalent work experienceAt least 4 years of Design Engineering experienceDomestic and international travel is required (up to 20%)Proficient in 2D, 3D CAD software (Solidworks preferred)Experience with plastics manufacturing (injection molding preferred)Experience with multi-component assemblies (mechanisms a plus)Strong communication and presentation skillsExperience using DFMEA as a tool to guide your designEnd-to-End product development experienceExperience and knowledge of metal component fabrication preferredFEA analysis experience (ANSYS, Moldflow preferred)Experience working directly with Marketing and Industrial Design teams preferredThis position is based at YETI's HQ in Austin, Texas, and relocation support will be offered to selected candidate. US Workplace Approach:Onsite: Role requires you to be onsite full-time.Hybrid: Role requires you to be located in Austin, Texas and is a mixture of onsite and remote.Remote: Role is full-time remote.Approach may vary based on role. YETI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. #LI-AR1 #LI-HybridYETI Global Workforce Data Privacy Notice If you require accommodation in order to apply for a job, please contact us at accommodationrequest@yeti.com.

Put a LIFT in Your Career! Hyster-Yale Group, Inc. (HYG), a world-class manufacturer of industrial lift trucks, has an outstanding opportunity for an exceptional and talented Electrical Engineer at our facility located in Greenville, NC.As an Electrical Engineer, you will work on the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, provide product design documentation through the creation of detail drawings, engineering lists and Engineering Change Notices (ECN) and integrate manufacturing input into the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, and may participate in the support of manufacturing activities such as Pilot or 1st Production.As an Electrical Engineer you will also create product design documentation – such as CAE (computer aided engineering), 3-d models, detail drawings, engineering lists, reports, test plans and software coding – to support release of Change Orders describing component design revisions. You will translate truck-level and system-level requirements to component requirements and plan and support development testing to ensure design robustness to requirements. The Engineer IV will interface with component suppliers and internal customers (Platform, Manufacturing, Marketing, Service, etc.) to understand detailed product requirements and develop concepts for system design as well as supervise other engineers/technicians.Key AccountabilitiesDesign and develop components as required for lift truck vehiclesDesign and develop assemblies as required for lift truck vehicles and order prototype partsDesign and develop wire harnessThe Engineer IV will also, evaluate component design and assembly, build prototype vehicles, design and evaluate systems and plan and execute prototype test activitiesProvide design specification documentation as required to manufacture the product such as detail drawings, engineering list structure and ECN writingProvide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productProvide product/process specification documents, detailed drawings/software development, test engineering reports, sales and product information data and test plansDevelop product around the most efficient and cost-effective manufacturing processes, and provide on-site Engineering support during critical Manufacturing activities such as Pilot and 1st Production; integrate Manufacturing/Purchasing input basic designThe Engineer IV will also provide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productThe Engineer IV will also provide leadership and guidance to individuals and project teams to ensure project deliverables are metHR administration and local project supervisionThe Engineer IV will also provide design/test input to project proposals, research for future product projects and develop design and evaluation concepts which enable program and project decisionsAdditionally, the Engineer IV will devise plans for component strategy creation that take advantage of unapparent opportunities given technology advances aligned with corporate visionMinimum Qualifications:B.S., Engineering discipline, requiredOne-Five years industry experience. All skill levels will be considered.Beginner-Master level knowledge/skill in drawing practices, CAD, design layouts, engineering analysisBasic specialized knowledge/skill in vehicle/automotive technology, manufacturing technology, design/test experience, test practices and proceduresBasic specialized knowledge/skill in industry regulationsBasic knowledge in scheduling and supervisionProficient demonstration of the core competenciesPreferred Skills:NX and Zuken experienceWho we are: HYG designs, engineers, manufactures, sells and services a comprehensive line of lift trucks and aftermarket parts marketed globally under the Hyster and Yale brand names. We are one of the global leaders in the Material Handling industry and have been building relationships and partnering with our customers, suppliers, dealers and employees for over 90 years.What we offer: Hyster-Yale Group offers competitive pay, tuition reimbursement, supportive work environment, hybrid work option, and opportunities for growth and development. A full benefits package: paid time off; medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, employer-sponsored profit sharing and 401(k).#LI-OP#LI-ONSITEJob Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Dental insuranceLife insuranceTuition reimbursementVision insuranceWork Location: In person

CAE Engineer - Finite Elemental Analysis: Advanced Vehicle and Powertrain CAE Engineer
column7: Requisition Summary This position is located within the Advanced Technologies organization at the PACCAR Technical Center with focus on modeling heavy duty and medium duty electric trucks and powertrains. The person is required to perform computational analyses, primarily with 1-D software and MATLAB/Simulink. Responsibilities include model development, validation and application, leading & guiding discussions with suppliers concerning requirements and design details to meet performance target. The person will engage with other divisions (Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF) as well as external organizations in collaborative activities. Company Information PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium- and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates. PACCAR designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines and also provides customized financial services, information technology and truck parts related to its principal business.  Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services — you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started! Job Functions / Responsibilities Use CAE tools to develop / improve energy management solutions for HD and MD trucks with electrified powertrains Lead and guide requirement development, component selection as well as design details for vehicle electrification with use case and driving cycle analyses Develop plant models for Model In the loop (MIL) to Hardware In the loop (HIL) and support controls development Validation and improvement of model fidelity as well as analysis process by managing correlations with suppliers’ data and on-site tests Execute design optimizations using computational tools Report and communicate results to team and stakeholders Qualifications Required 2+ years of experience with 1-D system modeling (e.g., GT-Suite), particularly for powertrain and vehicle systems Solid thermodynamics background, particularly on energy storage, exchange and recovery Fundamentals in e-powertrain technologies Good understanding of design optimization, edge case identification Excellent documentation, presentation and interpersonal skills Self-motivated for challenges and innovation Preferred Proficiency with MATLAB coding and/or other programming languages Solid background on battery technologies Experience with co-simulations including controls Education B.S. or graduate degree (preferred) in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or similar fields Paccar Benefits As a U.S. PACCAR employee, you have a full range of benefit options including: Competitive salary and 401k with up to a 5% company match Fully funded pension plan that provides monthly benefits after retirement Comprehensive paid time off – Minimum of 10 paid vacation days (additional days are provided with additional seniority/years of service), 12 paid holidays, and sick leave Tuition reimbursement for continued education Medical, dental, and vision plans for you and your family Flexible spending accounts (FSA) and health savings account (HSA) Paid short-and long-term disability program Life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance EAP services including wellness plans, estate planning, financial counseling and more Additional Job Board Information PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability. At PACCAR, we value talent and promote growth and development. We carefully consider numerous compensation factors, including your education, training, or experience. The salary range for Advanced Vehicle and Powertrain CAE Engineer is $93,000 - $145,500 annually. Additionally, this role is eligible for a full range of benefit options listed above. This role is also eligible for a holiday gift.

Quest Defense is an organization at the forefront of innovation and one of the world's fastest growing engineering services firms with deep domain knowledge and recognized expertise in the top OEMs across seven industries. We are part of a twenty-five-year-old company on a journey to becoming a centenary one, driven by aspiration, hunger and humility. We are looking for humble geniuses, who believe that engineering has the potential to make the impossible, possible; innovators, who are not only inspired by technology and innovation, but also perpetually driven to design, develop, and test as a trusted partner for Fortune 500 customers. As a team of remarkably diverse engineers, we recognize that what we are really engineering is a brighter future for us all. If you want to contribute to meaningful work and be part of an organization that truly believes when you win, we all win, and when you fail, we all learn, then we're eager to hear from you. The achievers and courageous challenge-crushers we seek have the following characteristics and skills: Position Roles & Responsibilities: As a key member of our team, you will collaborate with a prominent aerospace Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) specializing in aircraft engines. Your primary focus will be taking ownership of component design and structural analysis. Your responsibilities encompass:Technical Substantiation: Utilize Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and hand calculations where relevant, to provide technical substantiation for design decisions.Technical Contribution: Actively participate in technical and program reviews, contributing valuable insights, expertise, and communication with the customer.CAE Tool Proficiency: Demonstrate proficiency in utilizing Computer-Aided Engineering (CAE) tools including: ANSYS Classic, ANSYS Workbench, Siemens Simcenter, Nastran/Patran, and ABAQUS for analysis tasks. Some Siemens NX CAD experience for model modifications would be advantageous.Interdisciplinary Collaboration: Collaborate directly with internal and external engineering teams, fostering effective communication and synergy.Engineering Problem Solving: Formulate and apply advanced technical principles, theories, and concepts to address complex engineering challenges.Document and Reporting: Thoroughly document all work, including analysis plans, in compliance with customer requirements and prepare and deliver comprehensive reports on your findings.Please note that this position may involve additional tasks as assigned beyond the listed responsibilities. Required Skills:Educational Background: Possess a Bachelor's of Science degree in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering, or related engineering field from an accredited university.Experience: Have a minimum of 2 years of experience in aerospace structural analysis, or alternatively hold a Master's Degree in engineering from an accredited university.Aerospace Expertise: Demonstrate expertise in aerospace structures, gas turbines, or turbomachinery and a strong understanding of low cycle fatigue (LCF) and fatigue and fracture mechanics theory and applicationsCommunication Skills: Exhibit strong oral and written communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with employees and managers at all organizational levels.Security Clearance: Currently have or be willing to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret Clearance (U.S. Citizenship is a requirement).Desired Skills:Geometry and Mesh Preparation: Proficiency in geometry and mesh preparation using tools such as: ANSYS Classic/Workbench, Siemens Simcenter, Abaqus, Nastran/Patran.Model Setup and Analysis: Experience in model setup and analysis with tools like: ANSYS Classic/Workbench, Siemens Simcenter, Abaqus, Nastran/Patran.Post-processing and Presentation: Ability to post-process data and create high-quality presentations of results.Material and Strength Knowledge: Familiarity with strength, fatigue, and durability properties, as well as materials, processes, and part standards.Time Management: Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, work efficiently under time constraints, and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.Team Collaboration: Thrive in a collaborative and dynamic team environment, appreciating diverse experiences and contributing positively.Security Clearance: Possess an active DoD Secret clearance (or higher) that is in-scope, granted, or renewed within the last 6 years.Physical Requirements & Work Environment:Work Environment: Primarily office-based, requiring on-site presence at the customer facility for 40 hours per week.Task Allocation: Extensive telephone and computer work in alignment with industry regulations and procedures.Schedule Flexibility: Flexibility to accommodate business deadlines, including occasional early or late hours.Workweek: Typically follows a 40-hour workweek, with core (required) hours from 9 AM to 4 PM.Transportation: Capability to use personal transportation to work at customer locations.Citizenship Requirement: Due to the nature of the work, all candidates must be U.S. Citizens.Travel: Occasional business travel to customer sites will be required .The physical demands described herein represent those necessary to perform the essential functions of this role successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these functions. Quest Defense provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

StartPlease wait...Product Application Engineer Hungry for challenges? Join a group with innovation at its heart and contribute to the automotive revolution!With 30,000 team members located in 25 countries and with a 2021 revenue of €8 billion, Plastic Omnium is world leader in intelligent exterior systems, clean energy systems and customized complex modules.At the heart of the automotive industry’s transformation, Plastic Omnium helps automotive manufacturers to develop technologies for all engine types: gasoline, diesel, hybrid and plug-in hybrid. Leading the way in clean technology, the Group is designing innovative hydrogen solutions for zero-emission electric mobility.Our ambition? Provide automakers with cutting-edge equipment and solutions to develop tomorrow’s clean and connected car. MISSIONThe Product Application Engineer (PAE) is responsible to coordinate the design and development for assigned programs and ensure that the system performance meets technical requirementsWork is performed in a fast paced environment within tight time constraints RESPONSIBILITIESResponsible for DFMEA, DVP&R, BOM, and engineering timeline including action plans for issue resolution and product validationDirect CAD designers in the development of details and assembly math data / drawings to ensure the design meets the program requirementsDirect Test Engineers/Technicians in the development of the Design and Process Validation PlansDirect the manufacture, assembly and validation of prototype parts ACTIVITIESCommunicate design changes to the program teamRelease drawings / math data to suppliers for the manufacture of tooling, prototypes, components and assembly aids associated with the programRelease drawings / math data to the customer that meets the individual customer’s standardsMake recommendations for improvement to the program team and the customer to continuously drive towards lower cost and increased quality within the required timingInterface with other Development groups (Components, Materials, Process and Systems) to ensure the provision of the technologies required to support the programLead technical contact for assigned programsOther duties as assigned PROFILE REQUIREDPersonal BackgroundBachelor of Science in Engineering required Minimum of 3 years experience requiredExperience in Automotive /Manufacturing, preferredExperience in GD&T, DVP&R, DFMEA, and BOM Experienced in Safety Components or Fuel Systems components, preferredMust be authorized to work in the United States without the requirement for sponsorship or transfer of Visa now or at any time in the future Skills and AbilitiesBasic understanding of the capabilities of common CAE systems (Unigraphics, SDRC I-DEAS, CATIA, ABAQUS, etc.).          No Design experience necessary At ease and effective in a matrix, multicultural and fast evolving environmentTravel required – less than 10% (Domestic and International)As a responsible company, Plastic Omnium pays particular attention to diversity and equality within its teams and the Group commits to treat all job applications equally.       Date: 25 Nov 2023              Location: Troy-Michigan, MI, US              Job Requisition ID: 374770

Company / Location Information We are one of the world’s leading manufacturers of water heating and water treatment technologies in the world. We are a $3.5 billion company with 140+ years history and we employ more than 12,000 individuals globally who pride themselves on providing the world with innovative water technology. We are committed to Continuous Improvement, not just in our factories or processes, but in our people. Primary Function The Project Engineer is responsible for assignments related to the design, development, and optimization of water heating products. The Project Engineer leads the design team in the planning, organization, implementation, and completion of engineering project assignments within area of responsibility by performing the following duties personally or through other project team members. Responsibilities Oversees all aspects of a significant heat pump development project, from start to finish, so that it is completed on time and within budget. Develops an action plan and estimates requirements for resources—management, labor, materials, and time required to complete project. Prepares monthly reports, detailing progress and costs for top management. Analyzes and identifies causes of component failures. Capable of providing technical solutions to help solve manufacturing issues or address customer field issues; has some familiarity with multiple operations. Responsible for engineering assignments related to the development of heat pump products for water heating applications. Provide detailed test programs and guidance to assigned lab and CAD personnel in the conductance and documentation of product specific test standards. Evaluate data and make recommendations. Review product design for compliance with engineering principles, company standards, and customer contract requirements, and related specifications. Coordinate activities to efficiently resolve technical developments, rescheduling issues, and engineering design and test problems as they arise. Evaluate and approve design changes, specifications, and drawing releases. Interact with other Engineering Staff to provide input regarding areas of individual expertise. Prepare project expense estimates and control expenditures within the limitations of the project budget. Travel as needed to complete agency certification, review field installations, attend meetings, provide technical support to sales, etc. Analyze production methods to ensure time and cost goals are reached. Support engineering functions for a product or a product family from design through production. Use CAE tools such as Solidworks, MATLAB, LabView, Minitab, EES, CFD, FEA. Enters and modifies product data in ERP system. Initiates, reviews, and approves PCP in ERP system. Provide occasional support to manufacturing and acquire comfortable familiarity with manufacturing operation. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Mechanical engineering or related field OR Master's Degree in Engineering or related field 3+ years of related work experience, product development experience dealing with refrigeration and electronic applications Excellent written and oral communication skills. Communicates well with other engineering functions including design, process, production, quality, and reliability. Excellent analytical and organizational skills; solves complex problems. Experience with Microsoft Office; Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, etc Experience with 6-sigma and FMEA preferred. We Offer Competitive compensation package and comprehensive benefits plans which include medical and dental insurance, company-sponsored life insurance, retirement security savings plan, short- and long-term disability programs and tuition assistance.

We are the movers of the world and the makers of the future. We get up every day, roll up our sleeves and build a better world - together. At Ford, we’re all a part of something bigger than ourselves. Are you ready to change the way the world moves? Product Development uses design thinking & user experience methods to deliver breakthrough products and services that delight our customers. We bring innovative, exciting, and sustainable ideas to life. We have opportunities around the world for you to contribute to advancements in autonomy, electrification, smart mobility technologies, and more! In this position... Utilize emerging optimization software to more efficiently design chassis components and systems. Work with all sections of Chassis (suspension and steering) and interface with program management teams, suppliers, testing activities, manufacturing, and vehicle teams to automate current methods and employ optimization software to deliver optimized results by using design of experiments (DOEs), optimization algorithms, response surface models (RSMs) and neural networks. Run topology optimization, topography optimization, gage optimization, and shape optimization on a variety of different Chassis components to reduce cost and weight. Drive efficient product and system designs through institutionalizing Optimization within Chassis. Support the parametric CAD to CAE template start part automation strategy for Chassis Engineering. Help create CAD parametric template models that are fully connected to CAE templates for analysis (strength and fatigue) and then loop them with optimization software to either populate an entire trade space, run an optimization, or create analytical engines. Research, identify and develop the leading software tools and methods available to improve Ford designs and bring them to Ford. Participate in optimization tool implementation for Chassis Engineering. Develop new CAE techniques, analysis procedures, and tools to improve process robustness, fidelity, and simulation execution speed.You'll have... Master’s degree in mechanical engineering, automotive engineering or a related field. Expertise in Programming Languages: Python, Java, Visual Basic .NET, C#, MATLAB, Excel VBA, Maple, R, XSLT, Latex, Basics of PHP, HTML and XML 5 years of experience performing structural and fatigue CAE simulations on automotive components using NASTRAN, ABAQUS, nCode or ANSYS with high performance computing (HPC). 3 years of experience conducting topology, topography, and shape optimization using Optistruct, Tosca, Inspire and/or ANSYS. 2 years of experience conducting parametric optimization studies using HEEDs and modeFRONTIER. Experienced in creating templatized CAE models that couple with parametric CAD models Familiarity in performing parametric template modeling in CATIA V5 utilizing the following workbenches: Part Design, Generative Shape Design, Drafting, Assembly Design, DMU Kinematics, Knowledge Expert (KEW), Knowledge Advisor (KWA) and Product Knowledge Template (PKT), Advanced Meshing Tools, Nonlinear Structure Analysis and Thermal Analysis. Even better, you may have... Experience in dealing with the following Databases: MongoDB, SQLite, OracleSQL and PL/SQL Developer databases Designed, analyzed, tested, and released structural components or systems for automotive vehicles Performed detailed engineering analysis on structural components and systems using CAD and CAE programs Written detailed test plans and/or worked closely with test engineers to ensure component and system-level testing is performed to ensure the safe and efficient function of the design Worked closely with manufacturing engineers to understand manufacturing capabilities and limitations to ensure designs can be efficiently produced and assembled Collaborated successfully in a team environment to ensure cross-functional requirements are met while achieving design targets Strong communication (verbal and written) and organization skills required You may not check every box, or your experience may look a little different from what we've outlined, but if you think you can bring value to Ford Motor Company, we encourage you to apply! As an established global company, we offer the benefit of choice. You can choose what your Ford future will look like: will your story span the globe, or keep you close to home? Will your career be a deep dive into what you love, or a series of new teams and new skills? Will you be a leader, a changemaker, a technical expert, a culture builder…or all of the above? No matter what you choose, we offer a work life that works for you, including: Immediate medical, dental, and prescription drug coverage Flexible family care, parental leave, new parent ramp-up programs, subsidized back-up child care and more Vehicle discount program for employees and family members, and management leases Tuition assistance Established and active employee resource groups Paid time off for individual and team community service A generous schedule of paid holidays, including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day Paid time off and the option to purchase additional vacation time. For a detailed look at our benefits, click here: https://clicktime.symantec.com/15tStcKbNEUVLwnMuLA9G?h=N_xqFKkOfltp2cViSIIEtjYN31NNB8zZ7hsYmXAmh8A=&u=https://fordcareers.co/GSRnon-HTHD Visa sponsorship is available for this position. Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status. In the United States, if you need a reasonable accommodation for the online application process due to a disability, please call 1-888-336-0660.What you'll do... Create CAE Automation application tools which will cater to the entire Underbody Systems Engineering Organization. Design and analyze vehicle structures using hand calculations, topology optimization, and CAD/CAE tools Create, refine, and execute new technical solutions for automotive applications Develop updated structural designs for and perform engineering analysis on existing programs Execute engineering design release of structural components and subsystems Work collaboratively in a team environment within the Structures team and cross-functionally with other disciplines to efficiently design and release structures that are optimized for mass, efficient production and assembly Work cross-functionally to implement cost reduction, methods and product improvements, and support prototype and production build activities

Position Overview:     Navistar has an exciting new opportunity for an   Engineer – Frames and Assemblies at our headquarters in Lisle, IL. The Engineer will work in Navistar’s Chassis Engineering product development group which is accountable for all design development and system ownership of frame systems across all our commercial vehicles. The systems include frame ladder (long members, cross-members, front end castings, and sheet metal structures, etc.), cab and chassis access steps and step mounting structures, after treatment device covers, battery boxes, fifth wheels, high voltage battery mounting, and fuel tank protective structures for buses.    Duties include design release, CAD modeling, BOM structure, development of engineering requirements and verification plans for new product development. Also, includes sustaining projects including current product manufacturing issue problem solving. Duties include assignments on multiple programs to deliver to cost and quality goals utilizing engineering analysis and experience in metal fabrications, castings, and extrusions.    The Engineer – Frames and Assemblies will be required to perform engineering judgment and provide recommendations in a design review environment.  Responsibilities:  Research and Design new products and systems for customer needs Modify existing products or processes to improve vehicle performance using computer-aided design (CAD) and computer-assisted engineering (CAE) Integrate suppliers into design development to create prototypes for Design Validation Develop new options and combinations of features to meet customer needs Provide technical support and information to production plant team to ensure product integrity Maintain production orders by performing containments (interim corrective actions) and releases (permanent corrective actions) Mentor junior engineers in the accomplishment of the tasks listed Participate in the budgeting process by estimating program effort and preparing project plans for assigned work Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 2 years of experience in product design/development and/or computer science experience   OR  Master’s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science Additional Requirements:      Qualified candidates, excluding current Navistar employees, must be legally authorized on an unrestricted basis (US Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident, Refugee or Asylee) to be employed in the United States. Navistar does not anticipate providing employment related work sponsorship for this position (e.g., H-1B status)    Desired Skills:  Experience in truck and/or automotive design and development process Experience in design release process Experience in Unigraphics/NX 3D modeling software is a plus Understanding of manufacturing processes such as metal forming, stamping, and casting Structural design experience is a plus MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Project Company Overview:     Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t.  Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts.  With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. JOB SUMMARY Conducts analytical structural and forming studies through FEA techniques on automotive components and systems. QUALIFICATIONS Education Required: Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or related field of study Education Preferred: master's degree in mechanical engineering or related field of study Years of Experience: Minimum three to five (3-5) years of related experience required; five to seven (5-7) years of related experience preferred. Other Skills/Experience -Required: Knowledge of FE software such as Ansa/Hypermesh, Nastran, Abaqus, Optistruct, Heeds, LS Dyna, nCode, FEMFAT, optimization tools, and post-processing tools Able to perform linear, non-linear, and dynamic simulations. Knowledge of structural requirements for durability, NVH, and crashworthiness Strong theory knowledge in solid mechanics, strength of materials, and dynamics Other Skills/Experience -Preferred: Process and manufacturing knowledge covering forming, joining, and assembly. Experience in developing BIW, closures, and chassis components Experience working with TeamCenter PLM ESSENTIAL DUTIES: Interpret and follow project guidelines with minimal follow-up or additional resources needed to complete tasks. Run multiple simulation projects correctly and efficiently to meet all program timelines. Actively work on developing new processes, procedures, and methods for analysis. Provide further development of calculation methods, in particular the definition of substitute load cases or replacement models. Use computer FEA software and equipment (i.e. Ansa/Hypermesh, Nastran, LS-Dyna, Abaqus, nCode, FEMFAT, and optimization-DOE/post-processing tools) to perform engineering simulations. Ensure model and post-processing are completed in accordance with quality requirements, customer specifications, and Company standards. Work with cross-functional teams to support the design, test, and structural development of components and systems by applying root-cause analysis and countermeasure proposals for issues identified during product development and testing phases. Correlate experimental data to simulation data. Analyze FEA results and proposed product changes to determine feasibility or potential improvement of components and systems to initiate optimization within the project. Write technical reports to explain the FE results and provide recommendations to improve overall design. Perform additional duties as assigned. HEALTH, SAFETY AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSIBILITIES Required to follow health, safety and environmental regulations specified in the Employee Handbook as well as any rules or standards otherwise specified by government regulations and/or government agencies. Expected to exercise safe work practices in all work activities and report any unsafe conditions or actions, injuries, or near misses involving yourself or other team members to the appropriate supervisor. PHYSICAL DEMANDS While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to speak, hear, and use hands to keyboard, handle, grasp, and touch. The employee is required to reach with hands and arms and have adequate mobility to stand, walk, sit, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to twenty-five (25) pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. WORK ENVIRONMENT The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate but may occasionally approach very high levels when moving around a factory floor.

Gamma Technologies, LLC (GT) is looking for a Product Engineer – User Experience with a solid work ethic, excellent judgment, and a desire to build a long-term career with us. Position Summary As a Product Engineer in the User Experience team, you will help our customers get the most out of our software with GT-SUITE’s sophisticated user interface that enables our customers to build, run, and analyze output produced by our physics engine. Building models often occurs within collaborative environments at our clients, and we deliver the capabilities to efficiently re-use data, share subsystems of larger models with other groups, and deploy front-end interfaces (including web-based) for users with different levels of experience. Running models involves model validation and real-time run-time monitoring, requiring extensive user experience design. Post-processing involves setting up customized reports and utilizing data analytics techniques ranging from data smoothing and trendline generation to using sophisticated machine learning techniques to answer engineering questions. Visualization is also a key capability that allows our customers to generate plots, tables, and diagrams that allow effective digestion of physical trends to make engineering decisions. Job ResponsibilitiesEngage with customers to identify and prioritize UI / UX development opportunities to deliver best-in-class softwareDefine and own the long-term vision for the user experience of key components of GT-SUITE’s user interfaceAct as product owner for your assigned areas of our user interfaceGenerate feature proposals to satisfy design requirementsManage concurrent development projects to deliver timely feature updates to GT-SUITEParticipate in sprint planning, standups, etc. representing your component(s) of the softwareWork with customers after the delivery of features to support a high quality user experienceEducation, Experience, and SkillsBS or BA in Engineering, Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction disciplines, or other similar technical degrees.5+ years of experience with product management/ownership, or experience as a user of CAE software is preferredAdditional Qualifications Desired:Experience with product management/ownership of web applicationsExperience with Agile development methods and associated tools such as JIRAExperience with PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) Software, such as Siemens Teamcenter or Dassault Enovia/3DS is a plusSalary and BenefitsGT offers competitive pay, vacation, sick and personal days, and a work environment that allows you to grow and prosper.We offer best-in-class health benefits for you and your dependents.We offer a 401k and Roth 401k retirement plans.We provide an onsite fitness center.The primary work location will be our Westmont, IL office. We’ve adopted a hybrid work policy asking employees to report to the office 2-3 days per work week.As an organization, we value collaborating and learning from our peers in person, while providing the necessary flexibility for our employees to have a meaningful work-life balance.Other Requirements and Notes:Due to the issuance of Executive Order 14042 which effectively mandates COVID-19 vaccination for all U.S.-based employees of federal contractors and subcontractors, all U.S.-based GT employees will be required to be fully vaccinated by January 18th, 2022, or by their first date of employment if after that date, subject to legally required accommodations.All candidates must be eligible to work in the US for any employer; no third parties, please.Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere is at the heart of our company. We promote diversity of thought, culture, and background, which connects the entire Gamma Technologies community. As such, Gamma Technologies is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance.About Gamma Technologies, LLC GT, a leading multi-physics CAE simulation software provider, develops a suite of integrated solutions that guides and accelerates the engineering transformation of today’s products in the transportation, power generation, and industrial equipment industries. GT’s flagship product, GT-SUITE, an engineering simulation software is used by over 600 companies including all global automotive manufacturing companies GT-SUITE includes a complete library of physics-based modeling templates covering fluid flow, thermal systems, mechanics, electrics, magnetics, chemistry and controls. It supports the entire product development cycle from concept to validation. GT-SUITE applications include a wide variety of engineering systems such as conventional, electrified and fully electric vehicles and their powertrains, engines and catalysts, batteries, motors and power electronics, pumps and compressors, thermal management and HVAC, hydraulics and lubrication, multi-body mechanics and much more. GT-SUITE software comes with exciting and easy-to-learn User Interfaces, ranging from 3D pre-processing to real-time monitoring. The entire software platform uses state-of-the-art backend technologies that leverage the growing popularity of high-performance centers and the cloud. At GT, we are committed to using technology to make a global impact by helping the industry deliver products for a cleaner, sustainable environment! We pride ourselves on our company culture which encourages collaboration between all levels at the company, from entry-level to upper management. Within a team, daily interactions and outside social events allow us to form bonds that result in higher productivity and job satisfaction.

Company / Location Information We are one of the world’s leading manufacturers of water heating and water treatment technologies in the world. We are a $3.5 billion company with 140+ years history and we employ more than 12,000 individuals globally who pride themselves on providing the world with innovative water technology. We are committed to Continuous Improvement, not just in our factories or processes, but in our people. Primary Function The Project Engineer is responsible for assignments related to the design, development, and optimization of water heating products. The Project Engineer leads the design team in the planning, organization, implementation, and completion of engineering project assignments within area of responsibility by performing the following duties personally or through other project team members. Responsibilities Oversees all aspects of a significant heat pump development project, from start to finish, so that it is completed on time and within budget. Develops an action plan and estimates requirements for resources—management, labor, materials, and time required to complete project. Prepares monthly reports, detailing progress and costs for top management. Analyzes and identifies causes of component failures. Capable of providing technical solutions to help solve manufacturing issues or address customer field issues; has some familiarity with multiple operations. Responsible for engineering assignments related to the development of heat pump products for water heating applications. Provide detailed test programs and guidance to assigned lab and CAD personnel in the conductance and documentation of product specific test standards. Evaluate data and make recommendations. Review product design for compliance with engineering principles, company standards, and customer contract requirements, and related specifications. Coordinate activities to efficiently resolve technical developments, rescheduling issues, and engineering design and test problems as they arise. Evaluate and approve design changes, specifications, and drawing releases. Interact with other Engineering Staff to provide input regarding areas of individual expertise. Prepare project expense estimates and control expenditures within the limitations of the project budget. Travel as needed to complete agency certification, review field installations, attend meetings, provide technical support to sales, etc. Analyze production methods to ensure time and cost goals are reached. Support engineering functions for a product or a product family from design through production. Use CAE tools such as Solidworks, MATLAB, LabView, Minitab, EES, CFD, FEA. Enters and modifies product data in ERP system. Initiates, reviews, and approves PCP in ERP system. Provide occasional support to manufacturing and acquire comfortable familiarity with manufacturing operation. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Mechanical engineering or related field OR Master's Degree in Engineering or related field 3+ years of related work experience, product development experience dealing with refrigeration and electronic applications Excellent written and oral communication skills. Communicates well with other engineering functions including design, process, production, quality, and reliability. Excellent analytical and organizational skills; solves complex problems. Experience with Microsoft Office; Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, etc Experience with 6-sigma and FMEA preferred. We Offer Competitive compensation package and comprehensive benefits plans which include medical and dental insurance, company-sponsored life insurance, retirement security savings plan, short- and long-term disability programs and tuition assistance.

CAE Engineer - Finite Elemental Analysis: Test Engineer II - Body/Chassis Strength and Durability
column7: Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Goken America is an Engineering Services and Product Development company founded in 2004. At Goken America we strive to expand and deliver upon our company motto of “Creating Something Different”. We are continually striving to strengthen our organization, and are always seeking talented individuals who have a strong desire to work in an environment where they can make a difference.    Our “Vision” is to empower our associates to affect change wherever change is needed. Our “Mission” is that in building trust we foster greatness in our people, excellence in our clients and impact in our communities.    Goken America provides an excellent benefits package, one month of paid time off per year and a very competitive compensation plan. In addition, when applicable, we will also provide relocation assistance, temporary housing, visa support and other fringe benefits.  This role will support engineering test and development activities for Automotive Body and/or Chassis sub-systems' Strength and Durability verification through concept to Mass Production. Responsibilities Lead and support the engineering test activities by applying engineering principles, experiences and various analysis tools in following established test plans/procedures to test parts/components in area of specialty to determine design feasibility and ensure parts/components meet design acceptance criteria, performance level targets and any applicable regulatory/internal standards. Depending on functional area, have to perform objective and subjective testing by driving. Utilize data acquisition tools to collect data, analyze and report results. Conduct vehicle benchmarking for the purpose of target setting. Support vehicle tuning and instrument vehicles for objective tests. Analyze and resolve problems with moderate level of guidance and direction. Negotiate with other departments internally and suppliers externally to meet the spec requirements. Coordinate with design and CAE teams to report results and develop countermeasures. Search new ways to increase overall efficiency, utilize up-to-date technology. Travel to client / test sites required. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Engineering and 5+ years relevant exp. or Master’s degree in Engineering and 3+ years relevant exp. Education with the following specialties preferred: Mechanical, Mechanical Technology, Aerospace, Automotive, Manufacturing. Minimum 2yrs experience using Data Acquisition tools. Test track / driving experience required for test driving. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Proficiency in MS office. Formula SAE (FSAE), BAJA SAE, EcoCar, Mini BAJA SAE, experience preferred. Hands on experience with wrenching and vehicle instrumentation preferred. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to handle or feel and reach with hands and arms.   Goken America (“Goken”) is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, or any other applicable protected basis under federal, state, or local law. The information collected by this application is solely to determine suitability for employment, verify identity, and maintain employment statistics on applicants.    Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is, in simple terms, a change in the way things are typically done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity. Please inform Goken’s personnel representative if you need assistance completing this application or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Do you want to be a part of a highly innovative, digitally transformative team and work on cutting edge, state of the art technologies? If yes, then this is for you! Exciting opportunity awaits, let us help you get started.  Please reach out to me for immediate interview: Allan Angeles at (248) 936-0633 / Allan.Angeles@stefanini.com  Stefanini Group is looking for a   Simulation and Analysis Engineer for a globally recognized automotive company based in Greensboro, NC!  This is open for C2C candidates.  Description: Deliver quality assured calculation models and results. Draw conclusions and make recommendations using control systems and function simulation and analyses. Perform analyses and deliver validated results with respect to design targets. Support continuous improvement of methods and tools.  Conduct CFD analysis of components, sub-systems (e.g.: heat exchangers, exhaust systems, air intake systems etc.) and complete vehicle under-hood thermal simulations Conduct technical research, post-process and analyze CFD results, write engineering reports and provide design recommendations to identify and rectify potential design issues, and improve existing designs. Work with engineering, testing and project teams to plan, develop and coordinate test plans, provide instrumentation roadmaps, and interpret test data to make design recommendations. Own the analysis until there is an acceptable outcome from all project stakeholders.Ability to manage multiple tasks using analytical and critical thinking skills. Master's degree in mechanical or aerospace Engineering with at least 7 years of experience in CFD. Experience in automotive cooling airflow, thermal management and aerodynamics is considered a plus. Strong background in fundamentals of fluid dynamics, heat transfer and thermodynamics Proven track record of validating and optimizing vehicle designs through use of CAE simulation tools. Experience with geometry cleanup skills in a commercial CAE pre-processing tool (e.g., ANSA, HyperMesh etc.) and building fully detailed CFD models for complex analysis types. 5+ years' experience in the use of commercial CFD software such as PowerFLOW, StarCCM or Fluent, and TaiTherm is a must. Experienced with Linux OS and use of HPC systems for submitting and monitoring CAE jobs. Experience in shell/Linux scripting to automate repetitive tasks is a plus. ***Listed salary ranges may vary based on experience, qualifications, and local market. Also, some positions may include bonuses or other incentives.   Stefanini takes pride in hiring top talent and developing relationships with our future employees. About Rivian:     Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.  Role Summary:     We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Automotive NVH (Noise, Vibration, and Harshness) Engineer to join our dynamic engineering team. You’ll work with a team of engineers and scientists to investigate and analyze unique problems, identify innovative solutions, and deliver a world-class customer experience for NVH by collaborating with a diverse group of cross-functional teams.  As an NVH Engineer you will play a crucial role in ensuring the refinement and quality of our current and future products by pushing the boundaries of what can be done in a vehicle. We are looking for a strong background in Mechanical Engineering and NVH principles, and a passion for building amazing products.  Responsibilities:  Build, refine and characterize Full vehicle simulation models (CAE), including Finite Element (FE), Statistical Energy (SEA) and Superlement models to identify opportunities for NVH performance. Utilize bench and on-road test data to drive simulation models and improve NVH CAE model fidelity to increase simulation reach and correlation between virtual models and test response. Work with NVH physical test and simulation data to build and refine NVH Simulator models (VI-Grade) to evaluate Vehicle comfort, NVH quality and character, and work with NVH team to refine user tactile and auditory experience. Utilize NVH simulation tools such as Modal and Transfer Path Analysis to understand the contribution of structure and airborne through different paths to characterize the NVH mechanism of our systems. Develop design solutions based on first principles, simulation, and test data analysis to improve product NVH experience. Collaborate and with a variety of teams, such as Powertrain, Battery, Structures, Thermal and Chassis amongst others to discuss and work with the system constraints to ensure NVH performance is achieved. Utilize coding and scripting (Python) to develop simulation tools to post-process large amounts of data and generate dashboards for easy visualization. Prepare technical documents, standards, and other visual representation to discuss and communicate the complex NVH data relationship discovered as part of your work. Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, Automotive Engineering, or a related field. Master's degree preferred. Proven experience in automotive NVH engineering, with at least 3-5 years of relevant work experience. Strong understanding of Mechanical principles and NVH fundamentals. Understanding of Digital Signal Processing (DSP) and NVH measurement Expertise in Pre-Process codes ANSA/Hyperworks and Postprocessor META/Hyperworks. Experience performing Modal Analysis and Transfer Path Analysis (TPA), Operational Deflection Shapes via Simulation CAE using either Optistruct and/or Nastran. Proficiency in NVH analysis software such as LMS Test.Lab, Siemens Simcenter, or equivalent. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively convey findings and recommendations. Knowledge of Python and other relevant programming languages is a plus. Understanding of relevant industry standards and regulations related to automotive NVH. Detail-oriented with a strong commitment to quality and safety. Pay Disclosure:   Salary Range Irvine-Based Applicants: $150,000-$173,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, and other factors permitted by law).  Salary Range Palo Alto-Based Applicants: $163,000 -$188,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, and other factors permitted by law).  Benefits Summary: Rivian provides robust medical/Rx, dental and vision insurance packages for full-time employees, their spouse or domestic partner, and children up to age 26. Coverage is effective on the first day of employment, and Rivian covers most of the premiums.  Company Statements:  Equal Opportunity   Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.  Candidate Data Privacy   Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.  Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.  Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions. Eaton’s PSD Power Systems Division division is currently seeking a New Product Development Engineer. The expected annual salary range for this role is $77249.97 - $113299.96 a year. Please note the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations. What you’ll do: PRIMARY FUNCTION: This high impact role is involved in the design and development of underground cable accessories, transformer components, and overhead fuses and switches. In this role, creativity and innovation are focused on developing new electro-mechanical product solutions for application on electrical power systems. This position works directly with a broad set of technologies involving polymers, castings, metal fabrications, metal alloys and circuit interruption. Assignments range in scope from high level system concepts to detailed sub-system development and analysis. This role is a key contributor to cross functional project teams that push concepts through a formal project process. In addition to contributing to project teams it is expected that this role has the ability to lead and execute small projects or serve as a core team member on large projects. Primary duties include; planning (work breakdown), risk analysis, product design, design analysis, prototyping, verification and reliability test planning and execution. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Develop work processes and durations for completing assigned project tasks with the ability to identify critical dependencies and risks. Creatively and efficiently solve design challenges by understanding the elements within a design that are critical for success, while eliminating the non-value added elements. Develop complex 3D models. Analyze “Digital Prototypes” using CAE tools such as FEA and Dynamic Simulation. Learn and master new design tools and processes. Then have the ability teach others within the engineering department. Ability to translate internal and external customer requirements into measurable performance criteria, as well as, being able to identify and resolve poorly defined or missing requirements. Design for Cost/Design for Manufacture Analysis (DFM/DFA) on individual parts, subassemblies with the ability to propose alternate materials and methods of assembly and manufacture. Develop sub-system functional and reliability test plans, and coordinate the execution of the tests using both internal and external lab resources. Coordinate and execute sub-system level design reviews. Provide timely, accurate, and pertinent information and reports as required by management. Effectively follows instructions to deliver requirements meeting schedule, cost, and quality targets. Sets aggressive goals, measures performance, and strives to go beyond what is expected. Constantly looks for ways to improve processes, products and services; appropriately challenges the status quo. Qualifications: Basic Qualifications: Bachelor of Science in Electrical or Mechanical engineering from an accredited institution Minimum of two years of engineering experience (may include co-ops and internships) Must be able to work in the US without company sponsorship now and in the future No relocation is offered for this role. Candidates must reside within 50 miles of the Waukesha, WI Badger Drive site. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in Engineering analysis, digital simulation, and 3D modeling (CAD, Creo, FEA, statistical analysis, software applications, electrical/mechanical analysis tools, etc…,. Product design, DFM/DFA, and manufacturing knowledge. Experience with engineering related projects Kinematic/Dynamic Analysis Experience Green belt or black belt trained #LI-CM1 Skills Position Criteria:Demonstrated strong communication and interpersonal skillsExcellent computer and data analysis skills. Proficient using Microsoft Office softwareDemonstrated skills in Engineering analysis and digital simulation (CAD, FEA, statistical analysis, software applications, electrical/mechanical analysis tools, etc…,). FEV is a global engineering consultancy providing services to the automotive community as well as the heavy-duty and commercial engine industry. If you are interested in joining a team of experienced engineers in vehicle development to address future performance, electric range, efficiency, and customer comfort, FEV is where you want to be.   Projects will include integration and prototype fabrication of conventional and electric/hybrid electric powertrain solutions, coordination of testing and execution of vehicle testing including dynamics, energy, thermal, NVH, range, fuel economy, emissions, safety, and performance. Engineers will contribute to cross functional teams to support powertrain and vehicle integration programs. As a vehicle integration project engineer for powertrain development and integration programs, responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following:   Execution of engineering activities, under program manager's supervision Support vehicle technical specification (VTS) development , design validation planning (DVP), and execution of the DVPAcquisition of test data, data analysis, and presentation material preparation / support Report technical progress to program manager Support customer interface for project related technical communications Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or electrical engineering, or equivalent experience 2-6 years of experience in comparable job function Understanding of conventional and battery electric powertrains (engines, transmissions, motors) and vehicle systems The desire to be part of a team-oriented atmosphere, and work in a challenging, fast-paced environment Enjoy working in a "hands-on " environment Excellent communication skills Proficient with MS office tools (e.g. MS Word, MS PowerPoint, and MS Excel) Valid driver's license issued from any state with in the US Desired Qualifications: Experience with automobile repair Exposure to design/CAE and manufacturing drawings Homologation of vehicles in US, EU, and Asian markets Past exposure to data acquisition systems and transducers (Dewesoft, HBK, ATI Vision, Siemens Test.Lab, etc.) Past exposure to vehicle CAN systems, including relevant software and hardware (CANalyzer, CANoe, INCA) Programming experience (e.g. Visual Basic, MATLAB, LabVIEW) Physical Demands :   The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.    Regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls and reach with hands and arms. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit, and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. Must occasionally lift and/or move more than 5-10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.   Company Overview:  FEV is a globally leading engineering and digital mobility company. Together with our customers, we are shaping the future of the mobility sector for carbon-neutral and efficient, connected, and safe transportation. Through our in-depth expertise we provide customers and society with cutting-edge solutions for the highest value of mobility and the most advanced    transport experience from A to B. Our expertise includes intelligent software and sustainable propulsion system development, as well as full vehicle engineering. Additionally, our range of services includes sophisticated systems engineering, cyber physical system development, software- and E/E-integration for software defined vehicles with highly automated and safe driving functionalities as well as vehicle integration. FEV's engineering capabilities span the entire mobility ecosystem including all on-road applications as well as rail, marine, aerospace, agriculture, construction, mining, and industrial applications. Additionally, we transfer our elaborate know-how and innovations to adjacent markets, such as the energy sector, to deliver best-in-class industry solutions.    The FEV Group currently employs 7,000 highly qualified specialists in customer-oriented development centers at more than 40 locations on five continents.    Headquartered in Auburn Hills, MI, FEV North America, Inc. employs more than 500 highly skilled specialists. For more about FEV please visit our website at www.fev.com    Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled
