column7: Waltonen Engineering is actively seeking Power System Design Engineer to join our team! Overview The Power System Engineer duties include the development of Power Systems. Power Systems include generation, storage, distribution, and management. Develop product fabrication hardware/software requirements and test plans/reports for validation. Job Scope will be ensuring the power system design has been fully defined, properly sized, traceable, and validated during testing down to the components and software. Support lab testing and on vehicle trouble shooting and issue resolution tasks. Engineers shall ensure all of their deliverables are completed on-time and with quality. Work environment will consist of a prototype shop, laboratory, manufacturing and office. Responsibilities Design, develop, and support of the intelligent electrical power distribution and management systems for military vehicles Collect and review the customer requirements and component interface control documents (ICD’s) and developing / mapping and managing the power load schedule/distribution Create and draw power system architectures and schematics using Capital Logic software or CAMEO Responsible for power CAE analysis of the power system generation and distribution – using ANSYS or Matlab / Simulink Responsible for writing the electrical power system design requirements, and interface control documents Support the electrical power hardware component development Design and development of the test requirements, test plans and test procedures for the power system Create custom CAN power system networks physical layer design Test distribution and management systems and their associated power distribution hardware components and creating reports on findings Troubleshoot the vehicle electrical power systems and power system hardware for failures using Vector suite tools or other testing devices Support CAE analysis for wire/connector sizing Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or related field 5+ years’ experience in a related role Only United States Citizens can be considered Must Possess or be able to obtain a security clearance Experience with electrical power systems (power generation, power distribution, power management, energy storage) on automotive or military vehicles, including the specification, development, design, testing, integration, and troubleshooting of vehicle electrical power systems and their associated hardware components is required Familiarity with various communication busses, especially experience with CAN bus, along with the ability to troubleshoot CAN bus-related issues associated with hardware components of electrical power systems Experience in Analog and Digital Circuit Design of high power (28, 270, 600 Vdc) switching components/electronics, DC/DC converters, inverters, and motor controllers is desired Familiarity with many of the following required: power switching devices, power control devices, motor control devices, high power electronics, serial data busses (especially CAN bus), microprocessors, single board computers, digital I/O cards, analog I/O cards, and embedded systems Experience with hardware in the loop (HIL) and software in the loop (SIL) bench-level testing Experience using Vector Suite testing products including CANoe CAPL for testing interfaces Knowledge of J1939 CAN standard Familiarity with Teamcenter / Vismockup Preferred Qualifications Previous experience working on ground combat Vehicles This position may require the candidate to be able to climb on/off, work in, and work around military vehicles is desired. Must be able to pass ASR test (Anthropometric Size Requirement for confined space) Ability to bring continuous improvement processes and methodologies to the position Strong communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills are required. Ability to work as a team or individually Ability to work occasional evening and/or weekend overtime as required based on project needs Benefits Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance Vacation and Holiday pay Employer matching 401K Hybrid work schedule after 90 days for eligible positions Tuition Reimbursement Flexible Spending Programs (FSAs) Short-Term & Long-Term Disability insurance Employee Referral Program Additional Voluntary Benefit Programs Off-site company events & Employee Luncheons Who are we? Role and Responsibilities Summary Do you want to be part of a team that is developing simulators that replicate some of today’s state of the art aircraft and other vehicles? Does managing a project that starts with raw material procurement and finishes with the delivery of a 35,000-pound simulator moving on a 6 degree-of-freedom motion platform sound exciting to you? Would you enjoy working with a multi-discipline team of engineering professionals on a mission to make aviation, maritime, and ground vehicle platforms safer? CAE, the world leader in simulation and training, is looking for experienced Project Engineers to join our simulation team in Tampa, FL. Multiple positions are currently available depending on experience level. CAE’s simulation programs are leading the industry in high-tech development of mission rehearsal and training devices and applications, pioneering the development of simulation as a service, virtual/mixed reality, off-site data centers/cloud computing complexes, and traditional on-premise training centers with reduced hardware footprints using virtualization for real-time simulation applications. We’re Looking For Someone who leads a team with an infectiously positive attitude and enjoys your work. Someone who can act as a Business Owner for the SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework for Enterprise) lifecycle. Defines Features/Epics for each Program Increment (PI) planning session to clearly communicate program needs and monitors progress against program schedules. Someone who can clearly communicate with Product Owners and engineers but is still flexible to adapt plans throughout the lifecycle, as required. Someone who can manage orderly progress with software development by participating in Software Configuration Control Board (SCCB) reviews and coordinates with Configuration Management (CM) engineers for software releases. Someone to ensure that CAE’s flight simulation products match the aircraft, meet contractual requirements, and that all functional areas within engineering are compliant to the technical requirements for each assigned project. Someone that has a good understanding of the waterfall and Agile acquisition lifecycles. Someone that can cope with disruptions to their plans and can adjust the plans with an infectiously positive attitude. Defects happen. We need someone that can handle them effectively. Someone that can create, review, and provide constructive feedback to technical documents. Someone that is excited to lead the construction of a simulator from contract award to the very rewarding final sell-off of a training device with a fully satisfied customer. Someone that is comfortable speaking in public and enjoys leading presentations with customers and suppliers. Someone who enjoys working as a Program Team with Program Managers. Someone who acts as the focal point for all customer technical matters, both hardware and software. Someone that can estimate work required and work remaining, and brief progress to engineering and program leadership. Someone that can develop technical specifications (SPECs) and Statements of Work (SOW) for subcontracted efforts and can monitor the subcontractor’s progress. Someone that figure out the best way to do something with organized analysis or trade studies. Qualifications and Education Requirements Bachelor of Science Degree in an engineering discipline (Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Hardware Engineering, or similar) is preferred. Previous experience leading hardware and/or software development or acquisition projects will be considered. Minimum of 5 years of technical work experience. Flight simulation experience with detailed knowledge of flight simulator hardware and software technology is preferred, but not required. Demonstrable ability to create and understand technical documents related to aircraft, computers, electronics, and flight simulation technology is required. Exceptional writing and verbal communication skills are required. Familiarity with program management and business productivity tools such as Microsoft Project, Microsoft Office, JIRA and Sharepoint are preferred. Familiarity with modern software engineering tools such as GitHub, Jenkins, Visual Studio, Docker and Hypervisors (Hyper-V, VMWare) are preferred. Familiarity with hardware engineering tools such as Windchill PLM, Creo, Solidworks, AutoCAD, Microstation, etc. are preferred. Due to U.S. Government contract requirements, only U.S. citizens are eligible for this role. Security Responsibilities Must comply with all company security and data protection / usage policies and procedures. Personally responsible for proper marking and handling of all information and materials, in any form. Shall not divulge any information, or afford access, to other employees not having a need-to-know. Shall not divulge information outside company without management approval. All government and proprietary information will be accessed and stored electronically on company provided resources. Incumbent must be eligible for DoD Personal Security Clearance. Work Environment [Work is performed in an environment where irritants such as noise from telephones, temperature, and lighting variations may exist, but there is little chance of injury, accident, or occupational health problems. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Must be able to perform normal office duties (sitting for long periods at a desk and in technical meetings). Must be able to travel within the United States or to international destinations. Must be able to climb stairs on a regular basis. Must be willing to work overtime. Other Duties Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for their job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. CAE USA Inc. is an EOE/AA employer and gives consideration for employment to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you’d like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please click here EEO is the Law poster. PAY TRANSPARENCY NONDISCRIMINATION PROVISION The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. #LI-KB1 Position Type Regular  CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted. Equal Employment Opportunity At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception. As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team. At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, neurodiversity or age. The masculine form may be used in this job description solely for ease of reading, but refers to men, women and the gender diverse.

Are you detail-oriented, creative, and technically skilled at Engineering design and development? Come to Crane Aerospace & Electronics and use your excellent Engineering skills to design, improve, and deliver the next generation of products in the aerospace and electronics Industry! Crane Aerospace & Electronics offers a variety of fluid management solutions, including positive displacement pumps, centrifugal pumps, fuel flowmeters, fuel level systems and pressure sensing products. We draw on years of experience to precisely match our products to customer specifications and preferences. We have a unique and exciting career opportunity for a Mechanical Engineer located at our site in Elyria, Ohio. The Mechanical Engineer works with minimal supervision and uses originality, ingenuity and established procedures to perform engineering duties in researching, planning, designing, and developing products for use in the Aerospace or Electronics marketplace. The Mechanical Engineer works on new product designs, modernization, and upgrades, as well as performs extensive analyses to ensure cost, quality, and customer requirements. The Mechanical Engineer also uses computer-assisted engineering and design software and equipment to perform daily assignments, applying principles of science and mathematics to develop economical solutions to technical problems. Essential Functions:Work effectively with all functional groups to achieve product performance and cost targets. Build quality and manufacturability into the design. Define/understand/comply with company and regulatory guidelines to assure a safe operating environment.Support continuous process improvement activities including Kaizen, 5S practices to ensure an organized and efficient working environment, and personal development.Demonstrate proficiency with verbal and written English for technical reports, presentations, analyses, or other communications at the appropriate level throughout the organization.Understand, decompose, and define product and process requirements to support product development, sustaining and R&D.Plan, estimate, prioritize, and manage work activities to support meeting project schedules and budgets.Utilize experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Produce thorough and accurate design and development work of suitable complexity that meets all customer specifications and company requirements for schedule, cost, producibility, quality, and reliability.Utilize proficient problem solving processes, documentation, tools and analyses to quickly and effectively identify root cause and corrective actions to technical challenges and/or issue in support of product development and product sustaining assignmentsGenerate and review product development documentation including proposals, technical reports, procedures, correspondence, etc. necessary to satisfy customer and program requirements.Self-directed and motivated while working and communicating effectively within a team environment that consists of several engineering, operations, quality, and business disciplines.Provide support of IPT activities in collaboration with other technical, operations, quality, and business disciplines.Generate models and conduct analyses that are in compliance with customer requirements and appropriate agenciesPerform design experiments and evaluate test results to validate analysisGenerate and review documentation related to product development and prepare technical reports and documentation necessary to satisfy customer and program requirements, including proposals, procedures, reports, correspondence, etc.Any other task assigned by supervisor or managementMinimum Qualifications:Experience: 5+ years of relevant work experienceEducation/Certification: BA or BS Degree in an engineering discipline required. Masters or PhD preferred.Knowledge:     Knowledge of Mechanical Engineering Principles, including mechanics of materials, shock, vibration, heat transfer, and dimensional tolerance analysisKnowledge of electronics packagingKnows and applies the fundamental concepts, practices and procedures to assigned product or programSkills/Abilities     Proficiency with mechanical 3D modeling software such as Creo, and familiarity with numerical analysis softwareSelf-directed/motivated and able to work and communicate well within a team that consists of Engineering, Manufacturing, and other disciplinesAbility to effectively communicate in presentations, analyses, and reportsDemonstrated ability to rely on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goalsEligibility Requirement: This position may require access to controlled data or information and therefore only US persons will be considered. We are the movers of the world and the makers of the future. We get up every day, roll up our sleeves and build a better world - together. At Ford, we’re all a part of something bigger than ourselves. Are you ready to change the way the world moves?You'll have... Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering 2+ years of experience with electrical component design development process and vehicle charging experience or strong Ford Product Design and Release experience Previous design and release experience through all program phases in related field Working level knowledge of CAD/CAE methods Experience with developing quality documentation (DVP&R, P-diagrams, DFMEA’s etc.) Experience with problem solving tools (8D, 3L5W, or similar) Knowledge of high voltage automotive systems and electric and/or hybrid electric vehicle systems Proactive, self-motivated, and attention to detail Strong teamwork, organizational, oral communication, and written communication skills Strong leadership skills, able to effectively interact with multiple internal and external stakeholders Proven ability to handle multiple assignments with competing priorities  Even better, you may have… Understand basic electrical code requirements Experience (2+ years) with electric vehicles and/or charging systems either at the system or component level Ability to coordinate CAD and CAE support Experience in Ford WERS/FEDE/AIMS/GPDS/Integrator systems   You may not check every box, or your experience may look a little different from what we've outlined, but if you think you can bring value to Ford Motor Company, we encourage you to apply! As an established global company, we offer the benefit of choice. You can choose what your Ford future will look like: will your story span the globe, or keep you close to home? Will your career be a deep dive into what you love, or a series of new teams and new skills? Will you be a leader, a changemaker, a technical expert, a culture builder…or all of the above? The Electrified Powertrain D&R Engineer will own the design, release, packaging, and certification of Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EVSE) for future model battery electric vehicle (BEV) programs. We are looking for someone who can work effectively with various functions of a vehicle program team, that is proactive, self-motivated, and pays attention to detail. They must also have strong teamwork, organizational, oral communication, and written communication skills with the ability to progress design solutions while delivering the best compatibility with vehicle targets. The selected candidate will gain experience working with Studio on Class A parts, collaborate with multiple teams, drive future product development, and be part of the growing field of vehicle electrification! What you'll do...  Lead EVSE design, release, and testing for next generation electrified vehicles Lead packaging (including enclosure) and appearance design efforts together with supplier partner, including any necessary AAR Coordinate features and deliverables with the Applications Team Release core components in FEDE BOM and WERS and drawing/model updates from P-release through launch, working with as-installed engineers and supporting change control as needed, report program achievement deliverables Manage Component Design Specifications (CDS) and Design Change Requests (DCR) Participate in Design Reviews and Worst-Case Circuit Analysis Work with EDS and OBC teams for proper interfaces Handle quality foundation documents including Quality History, DFMEA, PFMEA, SCCAF, RCL/RDM, DVP&R, (refer to FMA) Phased PPAP process support through supplier visits and sign off Support Supplier PPAP process through visits and document review (Control Plan and PFMEA). Understand/support/review/approve PPAP elements such as MSA (GRR), Control Charts, and Capability Support launch of vehicle programs, vehicle testing, offboard testing, regulatory testing, homologation testing, and other Trustmark testing. Support GPDS builds and AIMS resolution with suppliers Evaluate electrical system engineering alternatives for various attributes, including cost, weight, package, quality, benchmarking, geometry creation and functional analysis Collaborate with various multi-functional organizations in jointly identifying the prime alternative recommendation delivering the best compatible solution for quality, cost, weight, and function Work with a team comprised of Tier 1 suppliers, purchasing/STA, manufacturing, attribute teams, interfacing teams, and vehicle team Responsible for production warranty investigation and Assembly plant returns/failures with suppliers to drive containment and elimination of early warranty Problem solving, development of countermeasures, containment actions, corrective actions, and prevent recurrence actions Oral and written communication and Presentation skills to Lead Technical Design Review items before Managers, Chief Engineers and Directors demonstrating component knowledge and technical capability Lead benchmarking efforts for core components, present findings and analyze EVSE architectures and features Work with other core engineers on authoring DVMs and perform the necessary bench and on vehicle testing to ensure component and vehicle operation to requirements.

Put a LIFT in Your Career! Hyster-Yale Group, Inc. (HYG), a world-class manufacturer of industrial lift trucks, has an outstanding opportunity for an exceptional and talented Electrical Engineer at our facility located in Greenville, NC.As an Electrical Engineer, you will work on the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, provide product design documentation through the creation of detail drawings, engineering lists and Engineering Change Notices (ECN) and integrate manufacturing input into the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, and may participate in the support of manufacturing activities such as Pilot or 1st Production.As an Electrical Engineer you will also create product design documentation – such as CAE (computer aided engineering), 3-d models, detail drawings, engineering lists, reports, test plans and software coding – to support release of Change Orders describing component design revisions. You will translate truck-level and system-level requirements to component requirements and plan and support development testing to ensure design robustness to requirements. The Engineer IV will interface with component suppliers and internal customers (Platform, Manufacturing, Marketing, Service, etc.) to understand detailed product requirements and develop concepts for system design as well as supervise other engineers/technicians.Key AccountabilitiesDesign and develop components as required for lift truck vehiclesDesign and develop assemblies as required for lift truck vehicles and order prototype partsDesign and develop wire harnessThe Engineer IV will also, evaluate component design and assembly, build prototype vehicles, design and evaluate systems and plan and execute prototype test activitiesProvide design specification documentation as required to manufacture the product such as detail drawings, engineering list structure and ECN writingProvide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productProvide product/process specification documents, detailed drawings/software development, test engineering reports, sales and product information data and test plansDevelop product around the most efficient and cost-effective manufacturing processes, and provide on-site Engineering support during critical Manufacturing activities such as Pilot and 1st Production; integrate Manufacturing/Purchasing input basic designThe Engineer IV will also provide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productThe Engineer IV will also provide leadership and guidance to individuals and project teams to ensure project deliverables are metHR administration and local project supervisionThe Engineer IV will also provide design/test input to project proposals, research for future product projects and develop design and evaluation concepts which enable program and project decisionsAdditionally, the Engineer IV will devise plans for component strategy creation that take advantage of unapparent opportunities given technology advances aligned with corporate visionMinimum Qualifications:B.S., Engineering discipline, requiredOne-Five years industry experience. All skill levels will be considered.Beginner-Master level knowledge/skill in drawing practices, CAD, design layouts, engineering analysisBasic specialized knowledge/skill in vehicle/automotive technology, manufacturing technology, design/test experience, test practices and proceduresBasic specialized knowledge/skill in industry regulationsBasic knowledge in scheduling and supervisionProficient demonstration of the core competenciesPreferred Skills:NX and Zuken experienceWho we are: HYG designs, engineers, manufactures, sells and services a comprehensive line of lift trucks and aftermarket parts marketed globally under the Hyster and Yale brand names. We are one of the global leaders in the Material Handling industry and have been building relationships and partnering with our customers, suppliers, dealers and employees for over 90 years.What we offer: Hyster-Yale Group offers competitive pay, tuition reimbursement, supportive work environment, hybrid work option, and opportunities for growth and development. A full benefits package: paid time off; medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, employer-sponsored profit sharing and 401(k).#LI-OP#LI-ONSITEJob Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Dental insuranceLife insuranceTuition reimbursementVision insuranceWork Location: In person

Saratoga, CAE-Space US – Space Systems Engineering // On-Site     Ready to make connectivity from space universally accessible, secure and actionable? Then you’ve come to the right place!        E-Space is bridging Earth and space to enable hyper-scaled deployments of space-powered Internet of Things (IoT) solutions and services. We are fundamentally changing the design, economics, manufacturing, coverage limitations and service delivery associated with traditional satellite and terrestrial IoT systems.        By building a highly-advanced low Earth orbit (LEO) space system—with a unique antenna design, highly sustainable spacecraft system and low-cost, small portable end-user devices—we can extend global satellite coverage, capacity and connectivity beyond legacy space services to provide a new kind of IoT platform that lets users sense, track, connect and act on information gathered, anywhere.        We’re intentional, we’re unapologetically curious and we’re 100% committed to saving space, protecting our planet and turning connectivity into actionable intelligence.    What is the role: As a Satellite AIT Engineer, you will participate in all phases of the E-Space satellite testing program, from satellite sub-system validation to system integration phases, as well as technical support for satellite environmental testing. You will be in charge of building necessary HW and SW infrastructure (Ground Support Equipment - GSE) for the testing activities, preparing and executing test procedures and reporting anomalies to the System Engineering team.        You will work collaboratively with engineers of various satellite sub-systems to understand their testing needs and integrate test benches accordingly. As an engineer on the E-Space AIT team you will have the opportunity to test thousands of flight hardware units and directly contribute to the success of innovative satellites.        This role is based in Saratoga, CA.    What you will do: Develop and integrate GSE for sub-system validation (sub-system test bench) PCBA and harness review before unit integration into the sub-system test benches Ensure that the sub-system validation process is covered by satellite TMTC database Elaborate validation test procedures with sub-system teams, and executing them Track anomalies detected during the execution of the test procedures Support flatsat testing activities: GSE, test procedures, anomaly reporting, and satellite TMTC database Contribute to satellite environmental tests Work with flight hardware designers on design-for-test strategies Contribute to the development of engineering best practices to support most efficient testing What you bring to this role: Bachelor of Science degree in engineering 5+ years of experience in space engineering, incl. electronics test engineering or hardware development, harness manufacturing Understanding of electrical test equipment, test procedures, data acquisition systems and instrumentation Experience in environmental testing such as vibration, shock, thermal and TVAC Demonstrated success working in a dynamic environment Bonus points: Proficiency with Altium Designer for schematic capture and PCB layout Understanding of designing electronic hardware from concept through production Experience with radiation effects testing Programming experience in Python, MATLAB, or LabView Project/program management skills     $100,000 - $150,000 a year    The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position in question, which is based on market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on location, skills and expertise, depth of relevant experience, and other relevant factors. For questions about this, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply for the role and are selected for an interview. Why E-Space is right for you: We want you to make the most of your journey at E-Space. That’s why we support and invest in the physical, emotional and financial well-being of our team members and their families. Some of what you can expect when working at E-Space:    An opportunity to really make a differenceSustainability at our coreFair and honest workplaceInnovative thinking is encouragedCompetitive salariesContinuous learning and developmentHealth and wellness care optionsFinancial solutions for the future Optional legal services (US only)Paid holidaysPaid time off

column7: Job Number: 60669 Group: Magna Corporate Division: Mobility USA Job Type: Permanent/Regular Location: TROY Group Description At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle. We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey. Role Summary The Magna New Mobility team is seeking a talented & nimble engineer to join our Powertrain (energy storage & propulsion) team to solve challenging problems towards advancing mobility for everyone and everything. An ideal candidate should be able to work in a fast-paced environment and comfortable working with ambiguity to develop innovative solutions solving problems related to people and goods mobility. You will be responsible for developing concepts, prototyping, validation and launching them into production. We encourage all individuals who give nothing less than their best to apply, we’d love to hear from you. Key Responsibilities Ability to architect complete powertrain systems. Battery selection, electric machine selection, DCDC selection. Electric machine calculations: continuous and peak power needed for individual drive cycles, gradeability, and various tire sizes Ability to read, understand and create diagrams, charts, and schematics, as well as develop test specifications. Create system and component requirements for electric machines / wheel hub drives. Ability to architect CAN messages for faults, cyclic messages, and motor operation Calculate overall power consumption including high and low voltage Create system and component requirements for energy storage systems Understand motor efficiency and effects on power consumption Develop creative engineering solutions to solve complex problems. Work with engineering tools to develop prototype and/or production intent solutions. Evaluate technologies and product designs with compliance to scientific principles, engineering principles, company standards and customer requirements. Understanding of DCDC functions and operational modes. Ability to right size the DCDC for the vehicles needs Analyze engineering results and proposed product changes to determine feasibility, and improvement of functional performance. Direct testing activities for components and equipment under designated conditions to ensure operational performance meets specifications Key Qualifications/Requirements Degree in an Engineering or related field Comprehensive understanding about automotive technology Good understanding of basic engineering principles including FEA, GD&T etc. WORK EXPERIENCE: 3+ years of recent, in-depth, hands-on experience in a relevant field in the automotive industry Additional Information Strong spoken and written English language skills, additional languages skills desired Ability to work in global team-based environment Proficient in Microsoft Office incl. high level skills on PowerPoint and Excel Excellent professional communication skills (written and verbal) and good presence Demonstrated technical ability and creativity to initiate, direct, and control specific projects. Basic understanding of fluid dynamics, heat transfer, and their importance in automotive systems Knowledge of laboratory mechanical testing (tensile, hardness, metallurgy) Coordinate fabrication and installation activities to ensure products and systems conform to engineering design and customer specifications. Provide design direction to CAD Designers and assist them in altering or modifying designs to meet objectives Communicate design concepts with CAE Engineers and evaluate structural analysis results Work Environment Normal amount of sitting or standing, average mobility to move around an office environment, able to conduct normal amount of work at a computer. Local and/or international travel may be required. Awareness. Unity. Empowerment. At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Together with our partners, customers and the world of science, we develop leading-edge technologies, and excellent products, solutions and services for 40 market segments. Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  As a Vehicle dynamics and Loads Technical Specialist on the Durability CAE team, you will support the design and development of the best vehicles in the world through application of world-class simulation tools. You will work with development engineers, and system owners across the company to develop robust and durable vehicles. The role Full vehicle dynamics with virtual proving ground simulations with focus on simulating Durability and Fatigue events Isolated subsystem analysis like suspension & powertrain using MBD/FEM software tools Performing load cascading to generate durability and fatigue loads from Vehicle dynamics simulations Correlation of loads and other test data (strain, displacements, accelerations etc.) between testing and simulation Flex body simulation and durability assessment of the loads, stress, strain, and other results for downstream CAE Running ADAMS CAR model for durability events and provide loads to the different engineering teams Work closely with the durability test team to improve ADAMS prediction capabilities and come up with test plans to validate the ADAMS model. Qualifications 8+ years of related experience with a Bachelor's degree; or 6+ years with a Master's degree; or a PhD with 3 years experience. Degree in mechanical engineering or a related field. Automotive experience with a solid understanding of vehicle dynamics principles A strong desire to create state-of-the-art engineering products as an integral part of a very capable team Proven experience in ADAMS (strong preference), CarRealTime, CarMaker, CarSim, Adams/Car or similar MBD simulation tools. Experience and understanding of MATLAB/Simulink fundamentals Good CAE fundamentals & desire for continual learning Excellent problem-solving ability, using fundamental principles and data-driven decision making Preferred Altair products: Optistruct, MotionView/MotionSolve, HyperMesh, Hyperview, Hypergraph FEA (Linear & Non-linear) and experience with co-simulation Experience with drivetrain modelling and simulation Experience with test plan development, physical testing, and validation Experience with control systems related driver control module, ABS system, active damping control system, active suspension systems etc.Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors.    California (Bay Area) - $138,000-198,000 per year  Additional Compensation and Benefits: Lucid offers a wide range of competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, vacation, and 401k. The successful candidate may also be eligible to participate in Lucid’s equity program and/or a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing such programs. (Cash or equity incentive awards, if any, will depend on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and company performance.)  Lucid maintains your privacy according to its Candidate Privacy Notice. If you are a California resident, please refer to our California Candidate Privacy Notice.    At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.  To all recruitment agencies:   Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Crane Aerospace & Electronics is seeking to hire a Mechanical Engineer to join our team in Elyria, OH. Job Summary: Assume complete responsibility for assigned proposals, projects, investigations, and/or other activities under the guidance of a supervising manager. Operate within cross-functional teams (engineering, manufacturing, quality, supply chain, business development, etc.) to achieve overall program objectives. Apply good program management skills on all assigned activities. Maintain control of project and product costs and schedules. Satisfy all department, project, and customer requirements including customer satisfaction, cost, quality, and delivery. Specific Duties and Responsibilities Project Management / Technical Leadership Responsibilities     Estimate and maintain effective control of project cost and schedule.Work effectively with all functional groups and/or suppliers to achieve product performance and cost targets.Define and manage technical and program requirements, including the generation and flow-down of subsystem specifications and requirements.Maintain technical liaison with customers, suppliers, contractors and other functional groups through effective teamwork and communication.Prepare technical reports and documentation necessary to satisfy customer and program requirements, including proposals, procedures, reports, correspondence, etc.Provide instruction, guidance, oversight and/or support to other personnel and/or disciplines supporting program objectives through utilization of engineering orders, test procedures, purchase requisitions, correspondence and other effective means.Maintain accurate program accounting through effective utilization of project records and data management.Identify, lead and/or support process definition and improvement efforts through support of Kaizen events or similar assignments.Engineering Responsibilities     Primary agent for product design insuring that all design and analysis activities are complete, accurate, and meet program requirements. Responsibilities include the following categories: Product architecture / configuration, Performance (mechanical, electromechanical) Modeling, Analysis, Weight, Reliability, Materials, SafetyCreate, review and/or approve product drawings, drawing release packages, drawing revisions and other design documentation in concurrence with company procedures.Support the Material Review Board (MRB) in the assessment and disposition of non-conforming hardware and material within the scope of assign products.Minimum Qualifications:The fundamental engineering concepts listed are required as related to product design including the ability to effectively oversee, coach and/or mentor supporting engineers and assigned personnel: Fluid Dynamics, Statics & Dynamics, Design of Mechanical Components, Vibration, Stress and Strain, Coatings, & Heat Treating, Metallurgy, Strength of Materials, Drawing Layout / Stack-ups, Geometric Dimensioning & TolerancingComputer Skills: Finite Element Analysis (Ansys preferred), CAD Drafting/3-D Solid Modeling (Pro/E preferred), Basic ProgrammingTeamwork and individual growth are fostered to enable employees to contribute and achieve their fullest potential. All employees must work as a team to meet or excess internal and external customer expectations by providing innovative products and services on time, every time.Bachelor of Science Degree in Mechanical Engineering8-12 years of related experienceOccasional travel to customer and supplier facilities for technical interchange meetings, design reviews, product support, and technical seminars. Passport required.Employment Eligibility Requirement: This position may require access to controlled data or information and therefore only US persons will be considered. As a US Department of Defense contractor, we are bound by International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR).About Crane: Crane Aerospace & Electronics supplies critical systems and components to the aerospace and defense markets. You’ll find Crane Aerospace & Electronics in some of the toughest environments: from engines to landing gear; from satellites to medical implants and from missiles to unmanned aerial systems (UAS). We are committed to operational excellence and world class processes. We employ Lean manufacturing techniques to optimize manufacturing efficiency and accuracy on all product lines. Our products are known for their technical strength, proven reliability and overall value. Crane Aerospace & Electronics offers competitive salaries and outstanding opportunities for career growth and development. Some of our amazing benefits include 401k match, education reimbursement, and 12 paid holidays per year. You can see a list of our benefits at https://www.craneae.com/company/careers or visit our website at www.CraneAE.com for more information on our company and great opportunities. In our efforts to maintain a safe and drug-free workplace, Crane Aerospace & Electronics requires that candidates complete a satisfactory background check. FAA sensitive positions require employees to participate in a random drug test pool. This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work being performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Crane Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, genetic information, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law. #LI-CK1 #CAE

column7: Ford Motor Company’s Electrified Systems Engineering (ESE) team is seeking a passionate Design and Release Engineer (D&R Engineer) that will be responsible for designing and releasing HV Battery Cell Vent Management (CVM) related components within the HV Battery system. The D&R Engineer will work with HV battery unit team, Cell/Array team, Manufacturing team, Test team & Component Suppliers to deliver parts that meet function, quality, weight, and cost. The D&R Engineer will also manage component suppliers throughout the entire design development process (from concept to production) and will be responsible for program deliverables including foundational documents (DFMEA’s, SCCAF), component DV testing, Supplier sourcing, requirement, and design rule compliance, etc.You'll have… BS of mechanical, thermal, or chemical engineering. Some other engineering disciplines may also be considered. 3+ years of Automotive component D&R experience 3+ years experience with FMEA, SCCAF and DVP&R documentation Willingness and passion for learning new technologies Even better, you'll have… MS of mechanical, thermal, or chemical engineering. Some other engineering disciplines may also be considered. 5+ years of Automotive component D&R experience 5+ years of high voltage Battery component design and development Experience using Teamcenter & CATIA CAD software. Experience in Ford Product development systems and tools Experience in prototype, part fabrication, and testing setup. Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently Experience with Microsoft Office Tools Clear communication skills   You may not check every box, or your experience may look a little different from what we've outlined, but if you think you can bring value to Ford Motor Company, we encourage you to apply! As an established global company, we offer the benefit of choice. You can choose what your Ford future will look like: will your story span the globe, or keep you close to home? Will your career be a deep dive into what you love, or a series of new teams and new skills? Will you be a leader, a changemaker, a technical expert, a culture builder…or all of the above? No matter what you choose, we offer a work life that works for you, including: Immediate medical, dental, and prescription drug coverage Flexible family care, parental leave, new parent ramp-up programs, subsidized back-up child care and more Vehicle discount program for employees and family members, and management leases Tuition assistance Established and active employee resource groups Paid time off for individual and team community service A generous schedule of paid holidays, including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day Paid time off and the option to purchase additional vacation time.  For a detailed look at our benefits, click here:  https://clicktime.symantec.com/15tpDLjrhq9fR5v5vzGbF?h=DS1lZ7UG2l7qu4CjksfykbJukG8poHer2J_d27Pus9o=&u=https://fordcareers.co/GSRnon-HTHD Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.  Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status. In the United States, if you need a reasonable accommodation for the online application process due to a disability, please call 1-888-336-0660.  #LI-HybridWhat you'll do… Release CVM components within the HV battery system to support all prototype and production milestones throughout the program life cycle Represent component-level interests to the HV battery unit program Develop system Boundary Diagrams, P-Diagrams, DFMEAs and other foundational documentation Support Development of 3D modeling and design Collaborate with the Engineering Team for Packaging as well as with other Internal Pack Module & Component Engineers Support all pack build phases and discuss/resolve issues with the commodity suppliers Work with suppliers to ensure timing is met with Quality, Cost, Weight, and Function Validate design changes through either CAE &/or bench level testing for the build phases Review and signoff on testing data per the DVP&R plan Release and Update Components Using the WERS System

column7: Scout Motors Here at Scout Motors, we're carrying forward the heritage of one of the most iconic American vehicles in history. A vehicle dating back to 1960. One that forged the path for future generations of rugged SUVs and will do so once again. But Scout is more than just a brand, it's a legacy steeped in a culture of exploration, caretaking, and hard work. Scout is all about respect. Respect for the environment by developing all-electric vehicles with the capability to get you to any location. Respect for the past and the future by taking an iconic American brand that hasn't been around for a while, electrifying it, digitizing it, and loading it with American innovation. Respect for communities by creating a company that stands for its people and its customers. And respect for both work and play, with vehicles that are equally at home at a camp site, a job site, or on a Tuesday commute. At Scout Motors, we empower our talented, inclusive, and entrepreneurial teams to innovate. What makes a Scout? Someone who is a visionary and a leader, who seeks new paths and shares lessons learned. A knowledgeable doer who collaborates across the company to build better. A go-getter with unrivaled passion. If this sounds like you, we invite you to apply below. What you'll do Become part of an iconic brand that is set to revolutionize the all-electric pick-up truck & rugged SUV marketplace by achieving the following:Responsible for closures sheet metal design and release of parts for new products, ensuring innovative and optimized solutions for Scout trucks and SUVs.Participate in collaborative design and creation of a simulation environment for testing new body system concepts and ideas related to vehicle handling, safety features, and overall driving experience.Develop prototypes for virtual and physical verification testing, including field testing.Proactively stay attuned to consumer experience and propose system improvements accordingly.Contribute to the design of production facilities for body systems of the Scout trucks & SUVs.Manage resources efficiently including infrastructure, financial, supplier partners and people.Be a key member and decision maker within the technical leadership team and liaison with all Scout functions.Location & Travel Expectations: The responsibilities of this role require attendance at in-person meetings and events occasionally. The role will be based out of a Scout Motors location in Detroit, MI. Applicants should expect that the role may require the ability to convene with Scout colleagues in person and be able to travel to participate in events on behalf of the company from time to time. What you'll bring We expect all Scouts to have integrity, curiosity, resourcefulness, and strive to exhibit a positive attitude, as well as a growth mindset. You'll be comfortable with change and flexible in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. You'll take a collaborative approach to achieve ambitious goals. Here's what else you'll bring:Bachelor's or master's degree in mechanical engineering, systems engineering, engineering management, or a relevant field.5+ years of experience in body electrical and mechanical areas and relevant automotive assignments. Including all three phases of product development (design, test and launch).Skilled in utilizing CATIA for designing and developing detailed parts.Strong technical skills and expertise in closures, coupled with a 1st principles approach to problem solving.Familiarity with computer-aided engineering (CAE) or direct experience in this field.An ability to build strong working relationships with people across all organizational levels.What you'll gain The benefits of joining Scout include the chance to build products and a company from the ground up. This is a chance to create something new and lasting – with an iconic brand at its foundation. In addition, Scout provides competitive compensation and benefits to support your physical, mental, and financial wellbeing. Program specifics are detailed in company policies and employee benefit guides, select highlights:Competitive insurance including:    Medical, dental, vision and income protection plans401(k) program with:    An employer match and immediate vestingGenerous Paid Time Off including:    20 days planned PTO, as accrued40 hours of unplanned PTO and 14 company or floating holidays, annuallyUp to 16 weeks of paid parental leave for biological and adoptive parents of all gendersPaid leave for circumstances related to bereavement, jury duty, voting time, or military leaveCorporate Vehicle Program with:    Eligibility to lease up to 2 vehicles at competitive ratesPay Transparency This is a full-time, exempt position, eligible to receive a base salary and to participate in an annual performance bonus program. The salary range listed represents the maximum and minimum starting base pay for this position as of the time of posting. Final salary offered will be determined based on factors including but not limited to the candidate's skills and experience. The annual performance bonus program is preset and not candidate dependent. Initial base salary = $120,000-$140,000 Internal leveling code: IC9 Equal Opportunity Scout is committed to employing a diverse workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, disability, pregnancy, or any other characteristics protected by law. Scout is committed to compliance with all applicable fair employment practice laws.

Are you detail-oriented, creative, and technically skilled at Engineering design and development? Come to Crane Aerospace & Electronics and use your excellent Engineering skills to design, improve, and deliver the next generation of products in the aerospace and electronics Industry! Crane Aerospace & Electronics offers a variety of fluid management solutions, including positive displacement pumps, centrifugal pumps, fuel flowmeters, fuel level systems and pressure sensing products. We draw on years of experience to precisely match our products to customer specifications and preferences. We have a unique and exciting career opportunity for a Mechanical Engineer located at our site in Elyria, Ohio. The Mechanical Engineer works with minimal supervision and uses originality, ingenuity and established procedures to perform engineering duties in researching, planning, designing, and developing products for use in the Aerospace or Electronics marketplace. The Mechanical Engineer works on new product designs, modernization, and upgrades, as well as performs extensive analyses to ensure cost, quality, and customer requirements. The Mechanical Engineer also uses computer-assisted engineering and design software and equipment to perform daily assignments, applying principles of science and mathematics to develop economical solutions to technical problems. Prefix Corporation is an engineering services company, developing innovative design and engineering solutions for various industries. Continuously owned and operated by the same founding family for over 40 years, today the company operates multiple facilities in Michigan with over 300 employees, and has become a single-source American manufacturing, prototype, concept vehicle and production solutions provider to the automotive, aviation, motion picture, themed entertainment, and a variety of other industries. At Prefix, we are wanting motivated, ambitious people who put the needs of our customers first, bring creativity to their work and will do whatever it takes to achieve success. If you share our passion for providing innovative solutions to complex challenges, we want you on our team. We have an opportunity for a Mechanical Engineer II to join our team. This position will be involved in the creation of mechanical designs on multiple systems from concept to commissioning for the Themed Entertainment industry. This includes mechanism design, 3D Computer-Aided Design (CAD) models, drafting, and assembly of complex mechanical systems as well as involvement in structural analysis of said systems. This position will work in a team environment on defined tasks while also collaborating with other team members to meet the customer’s needs and requirements for Show and Ride systems. The position is located at our Rochester Hills, MI facility. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Create feasible 3-D parametric solid part models, assemblies and fabrication drawings of complex electromechanical and structural systems to meet customer needs to specified design and specifications requirements. Participate and assist in the development and maintenance of Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA) and Design Validation Plan & Report (DVP&R) documents. Prepare design packages and reports and present mechanical design at formal reviews to team and customers. Assists in creation and management of Bill of Materials (BOM’s) and all other required design documentation. Assure design are in compliance to customer and industry standards, and manage engineering change through completion. Defines and develops hardware development tasks and required testing, in support of mock-ups, prototype / pre-production, and production builds Coordinate with CAE/FEA resources for simulation analysis and part mitigation resolution. Design of components and assemblies to meet or exceed the required stress load conditions, duty cycle, acceleration, velocity and other related engineering performance requirements. Collaborate, manage and oversee allocated CAD resources for the refined development of 3D models and 2D drawings as required. Provide design recommendations, alternative solutions and risk assessment for resolution to mechanical, performance and operational design issues. Collaborate with other project stakeholders (quality, purchasing, manufacturing, etc.) on issues including but not limited to design for manufacturing feasibility, cost, ease of assembly and error-proofing. SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS (Required): Bachelor degree in mechanical engineering or related technical degree Minimum 2 years of engineering experience in automotive, machine design or other related industry. Proficient using SolidWorks 2D/3D CAD (Computer-Aided Design) or similar operating system. Knowledge and understanding of CAE (Computer-Aided Engineering) practices. Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel (intermediate), Outlook, and PowerPoint). SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS (Preferred): Knowledge on manufacturing processes in machining, composites and metal fabrication Familiar with basic metrology & precision measurement skills and applications. Understanding and application of GD&T (Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing). Strong verbal and written communication skills and able to convey technical data to various audiences and thrive in a team environment and have strong organizational skills. Work experience and/or internship in themed entertainment industry. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: Direct Reports: 0 Travel Requirements: Up to 10% may be required. (Current valid passport preferred / not required) U.S. Citizen or legally authorized to work in the United States.

Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  As a Durability CAE Engineer, you will be leading the assessment of durability attributes for various vehicle subsystems like Suspension, Body, Powertrain, Battery Pack, interiors, exteriors, closures, seating etc. Along with CAE assessments, you will be involved in testing activities such as test plan development, test to CAE correlation etc. You will also have opportunity to drive the design changes through design optimization, defining the durability requirements, working with the design team to conduct trade-off studies. This position will work with all testing activities in the company including Regulatory, Certification, and Compliance testing as well as all system and sub-system/component testing.  Your exact job level (Engineer, Sr. Engineer, etc.) will be defined by the experience and technical ability you have and how well you demonstrate your skills during the interview. This role and team will be a mixture of different experience levels all working together to make groundbreaking products with amazing innovation. The Role Perform strength, stiffness, and fatigue analysis on different vehicle subsystems (chassis, closures, body structure etc) Perform correlation between test and CAE Maintain traceable documentation for all durability analysis and test work Able to create FEM mesh from CAD or from rough sketches Support design engineers in making sure the parts meet all the durability requirements Able to learn and use different CAE software tools (nCode Design Life, ANSA, MetaPost, OptiStruct, Hyperworks CAE products, ADAMS etc). Test and benchmark new analysis tools and techniques. Participate in new CAE method development, process automation and similar tasks. Qualifications 5 + years of related experience with a Bachelor's degree; or 3 years with a Master's degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience. Degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. Experience in vehicle level CAE analysis, testing and development. Working knowledge of linear, non-linear analysis, fatigue analysis, design optimization etc. Good fundamental knowledge of structures and mechanics of materials Proficiency in using ANSA, HyperMesh, HyperView, MetaPost, nCode, OptiStruct Strong knowledge of vehicle performance requirements, deriving load cases from requirements, setting performance targets, developing testing and validation plans. Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors.  California (Bay Area) - $115,000 - $165,000 Additional Compensation and Benefits: Lucid offers a wide range of competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, vacation, and 401k. The successful candidate may also be eligible to participate in Lucid’s equity program and/or a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing such programs. (Cash or equity incentive awards, if any, will depend on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and company performance.)  Lucid maintains your privacy according to its Candidate Privacy Notice. If you are a California resident, please refer to our California Candidate Privacy Notice. Summary As part of the Interoperability Group within the Software Engineering Department, the candidate will help develop interoperability solutions on all of our major programs. The Interoperability engineer will develop software and hardware solutions for the inter-operation of virtual trainers in a distributed environment with other virtual trainers, constructive simulations, or live exercise participants. The Interoperability engineer will also research latest technologies mainly in the area of networking and connectivity. The training environment is enriched with constructive entities provided via third party solutions or locally generated entities. The candidate will integrate third party tools such as middleware, tactical environments, federation management tools, stealth viewers, federation test tools and federated debrief systems. Responsible for code, test, and documentation of software systems designs, requiring the application of current industry design concepts and utilization of basic technical writing skills. These systems include either standalone or networked training devices. Assignments will be geared towards real-time programming techniques for interoperability simulation applications. Good interpersonal skills are required in this position, as interfacing with fellow group members and other engineering group members is essential. The person in this position will be expected to report work status concisely and accurately to the Engineering Manager and Director as requested. Demonstrated analytical and mathematical modeling ability. Technical areas of expertise must include current software development methodologies and tools. Rapid iteration from concept through to optimization  Package reviews / presentations  Attend design reviews  Produce CAD assemblies to support design standard creation  Regularly represent the department in design review and work closely with suppliers and other departments, such as studio, body, skateboard, and packaging teams.  Prepare hardpoint models such as wheel bogey models  Prepare dynamic swept volumes for packaging Required Skills Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in Automotive or Mechanical engineering preferred, but equivalent qualifications and experience considered.  Minimum 5 years working in automotive design engineering (OEM).  Solid fundamental knowledge of chassis component production technologies and materials; casting, forging, machining, pressing, sheet metal, injection molding, extrusion, welding, stamping, rolling of aluminum, steel, magnesium & polymers.  Solid fundamental knowledge and proven experience working on chassis related projects.  Experienced user of CAD (ideally CATIA V5/V6) in solid and surface modelling.  Quick turn over of work.  Ability to produce clear and thorough reports.  CAE experience beneficial but not essential.  Candidates should be self-motivated and able to work in a fast-paced team environment.  Excellent communication skills, able to interact effectively with domestic and international teammates & suppliers.  Must be a self starter, use initiative and engineering judgement.  Ability to interpret data and solve complex problems using first principles.  High degree of competence with GD&T.  must have ability to manage multiple component designs at once and able to prioritise workload. The position utilizes the combined skills of data analysis, manufacturing process knowledge, automotive quality tools, and 8D problem solving to support and improve the team's quality performance. Ability to communicate in a high pressure environment

Job description:The ideal candidate will be a vehicle dynamics expert with experience in tire modeling and vehicle simulations who will directly support tire development team and OEM customers.Primary Roles and Responsibilities: Provide technical expertise and consultation to the development team and OEMs as it pertainsto tire performance on vehicle. Request, receive, and process data from dynamic tire F&M tests (e.g. Flat Trac) includinghandling, ride, harshness and steady-state. Interpret tire data and models to team and customers. Interface with internal and external test facilities and OEM customers. Participate in tire virtual development process. Clear communication with the team, company, and customers. Identify, document and standardize best practices in F&M testing and modeling and data use.Secondary Roles and Responsibilities: Follow developments in areas of SiL, DiL, XiL testing/applications. Represent the company at consortia, conferences and research institutions to bring new ideasfor applied research. Follow trends in future mobility development and advances in tire engineering and modeling. Provide ideas to reduce the product Release parts for Service Collision team in the PLM system. Interface with suppliers for manufacturing feasibility, validation, and other engineering activities as specified for the assigned project Create (with component/system supplier) component and subsystem design verification plans and test methods. Complete component and system validation as required, ensuring targets are met and optimized Interface with Tesla and Supplier manufacturing to develop components that are optimized for the Collision Service environment Perform hands-on investigations, lab tests, and validations and have time management to handle multiple high priority projects, simultaneously Complying with all of Tesla’s safety rules, guidelines, and standards. Drive innovative initiatives to reduce repair complexity and cycle timeWhat You’ll Bring  Bachelor’s Degree in mechanical engineering from ABET accredited program, proof of exceptional ability in related engineering fields, or equivalent. 2 years preferred experience in structural design engineering. Automotive, Aerospace, or heavy equipment industry preferred. Machine shop and fabrication experience preferred. Hands-on experience in automotive body design and engineering. Proficiency in CATIA V5 or CATIA V6/3DX. Good understanding of GD&T in design engineering Proven ability to research information, solve challenging problems, and coordinate projects under tight timing constraints Capability to interpret CAE results and integrate recommendations into product designs.Sophisticated on managing projects with tight timing constraints. Job Summary    Join Nextracker's Team!     Are you ready to take your career to the next level. Look no further! Nextracker is seeking passionate individuals to join our innovative team. At Nextracker, we're not just building solar tracking solutions – we're shaping the future of sustainable energy.    Why Choose Nextracker:    Dog-Friendly Office: At Nextracker, we understand the importance of work-life balance. Our office is not only a hub of innovation but also a welcoming space for your furry friends. Enjoy a productive day at work while your four-legged companion relaxes by your side.    Proximity to Parks: Our office is strategically located in close proximity to parks and green spaces. Take a rejuvenating stroll during your breaks, enjoy outdoor team activities, or simply find inspiration amidst nature's beauty. We believe that a refreshing environment enhances creativity and well-being.    On-Site Gym: We prioritize your health and fitness. Our office boasts a fully-equipped gym, allowing you to conveniently fit in workouts and stay active.    What We Offer:    Innovative Environment: Be part of a team that's at the forefront of revolutionizing solar energy technology. Collaborate with experts who are passionate about driving clean and sustainable solutions to power the world.    Professional Growth: At Nextracker, we encourage continuous learning and provide opportunities for your professional development. Take on challenges, expand your skill set, and advance your career alongside accomplished professionals.    Collaborative Culture: We believe in the power of teamwork. Share your ideas, engage in cross-functional collaborations, and contribute to a culture that values diversity and inclusivity.    Impactful Work: Join us in making a real impact on the planet by accelerating the adoption of renewable energy. Your contributions will play a crucial role in building a more sustainable future.    Here is a glimpse of what you’ll do:      Contribute to the design and development of the next generations of Nextracker horizontal tracking products        Perform and manage engineering work using CAD/CAE software to solve problems in mechanical/structural design, finite element analysis, design optimization, prototype generation (such as stereo lithography on NC machining), fatigue analysis, structural dynamics and kinematics, vibrations, thermal analysis, production of manufacturing drawings, and plastic part design        Develop testing fixtures that accurately simulate real world scenarios        Perform and document engineering tests under general supervision        Write proposals, technical reports and papers        Participate in brainstorming sessions with the mechanical engineering team to identify concepts and designs for future products        Develop and maintain best practices to foster the creative process        Design mechanical components, execute prototyping, and manage design iterations        Implement continuous improvement in order to maximize efficiency in the design process        Partner with the Manufacturing Engineer on design for manufacturability to address questions and issues.      Here is some of what you’ll need (required):      B.S. or M.S. degree in Mechanical Engineering, Structural Engineering or a related field (advanced degree preferred) and 4+ years of experience.        Toolsets required: SolidWorks, ePDM, FEA, Ansys        Extensive knowledge/experience with drawings, model and GD&T standards and application.        Hands on experience with shop tools such as chop saw, band saw, grinders, wrenches, etc.        Strong understanding of DFM for castings and sheet metal stampings        Strong aptitude and intuition in mechanical failure analysis        Practical knowledge of prototyping manufacturing process        Must possess solid written and verbal communication skills        Ability to prioritize and juggle multiple projects        Self-motivated team player        Ability to work within a cross-functional team while maintaining self-sufficiency        Proficient in most common PC based applications (Word, Excel, Visio, PPT, MSProject, and the like)        Willingness to travel and work at client sites both domestically and internationally      Here are a few of our preferred experiences:      Management experience        Labview, MATLAB        Netsuite, Arena, Miro (Real Time board), Jira, Confluence        Python or other coding        Automation experience    Pay Range (Applicable to California)  $130,000.00 USD - $178,800.00 USD Annual    Job Category  Production Engineering  Relocation: Not eligible    Is Sponsorship Available?  No

Position Title: Product Engineer - Aeration Division: Global Product Management Location: Naperville, IL, USA About AGI AGI is a global food-based infrastructure company publicly traded in Canada. With over 4,200 employees and over 30 global manufacturing brands, AGI is a leading provider of equipment and technology solutions for agricultural commodities including seed, fertilizer, grain and feed systems and an expanding platform for food processing facilities. We are Canada’s largest manufacturer of grain aeration and natural air grain drying equipment under the Grain Guard and Keho brand names. As a division of AGI, we have dealers and distributors nationally and internationally to meet the needs of the agricultural industry worldwide. Fans, heaters and aeration systems are sold under AGI, Grain Guard and Keho brand names.
