CAE Engineer - Finite Elemental Analysis: Mechanical Engineer - ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems) Packaging
column7: Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  We are seeking a highly skilled Mechanical Engineer specializing in ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems) Packaging to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in the design and release of electromechanical assemblies for ADAS components, encompassing radars, lidars, cameras, and ultrasonic sensors. Your responsibilities will span the gamut from leading cross-functional activities to managing ADAS systems, subsystems, and components, ensuring they meet the highest standards of quality and reliability.    Your expertise will be vital in conducting vehicle packaging studies, collaborating with diverse teams, and resolving complex mechanical and integration challenges. Proficiency in CAD software, GD&T, and CAE tools is crucial, as is a working knowledge of sensor principles and testing methodologies. If you're an experienced mechanical engineer with a passion for innovation and a desire to shape the future of automotive technology, we invite you to explore this exciting opportunity. Join us in driving excellence and pushing the boundaries of ADAS technology. Role Responsibilities: Design and release electromechanical assemblies for ADAS components including radars, lidars, cameras, and ultrasonic sensors. ﻿﻿Lead cross functional activities for sensor components including CAE analysis, tolerance analysis, durability, environmental reliability, assembly etc ﻿﻿Create detailed 2D drawings with GD&T to communicate dimensional requirements to suppliers and cross functional teams. ﻿﻿Perform vehicle packaging studies related to ADAS sensors to meet mechanical, electrical, and perception requirements. ﻿﻿Participate in design reviews and trade-off discussions with other teams including design studio, exteriors, interiors, aerodynamics, perception, systems engineering etc ﻿﻿Manage ADAS systems, subsystems, and components information (HW and SW) through leading the release of Parts in PLM environment (CATIA/3DX) ﻿﻿Lead root cause analysis for and close quality issues for components arising from packaging, vehicle integration testing, durability, manufacturing, serviceability etc. ﻿﻿Work with downstream teams such as purchasing, supply chain, and supplier quality to develop supplier sourcing agreements and documentation leading to PPAP ﻿﻿Work with Tier 1 suppliers to understand mechanical system integration for supplier components. Required Qualifications: BS in Mechanical Engineering, ﻿﻿3+ years of experience working as a mechanical design engineer preferred in automotive industry ﻿﻿Proficiency in 3D CAD software. CATIA/3DX preferred ﻿﻿Experience designing parts for electromechanical assemblies Working level understanding of sensor physical principles ﻿﻿Experience creating detailed 2D drawings with GD&T ﻿﻿Experience with CAE tools like ANSYS ﻿﻿Knowledge of Thermal, Shock, and Vibration testing ﻿﻿Rapid prototyping experience Preferred Qualifications: Masters in computer engineer, mechanical engineer Expertise in ADAS mechanical component design Knowledge and experience of plastic injection molding Knowledge of vehicle build and electrical harnessing   Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors.  California (Bay Area) - $104,000 - $130,000 Additional Compensation and Benefits: Lucid offers a wide range of competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, vacation, and 401k. The successful candidate may also be eligible to participate in Lucid’s equity program and/or a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing such programs. (Cash or equity incentive awards, if any, will depend on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and company performance.)  Lucid maintains your privacy according to its Candidate Privacy Notice. If you are a California resident, please refer to our California Candidate Privacy Notice.    At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.  To all recruitment agencies:   Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Overview:     You’re passionate about a zero-emissions future and want to build something special. You want to own your space but work with talented, like-minded people on important projects. The pace doesn’t scare you - it excites you. Quality and integrity matter to you.  We feel exactly the same way.  Drive Forward. Introduce yourself to us and let’s start a conversation.  We are on the lookout for a Welding and Metallurgy Lead Engineer to join our Vehicle Engineering team. You will work closely with our Battery Electric and Fuel Cell Electric Vehicle systems teams.  Responsibilities:  Apply knowledge of welding, joining, brazing to solve new product design and manufacturing issues Define process requirements, specification details, engineering drawing details Develop and implement fusion-based welding technologies including, but not limited to, RSW, MIG, TIG, FSW and Laser for thin gauge automotive sheet metals such as Aluminium and Steel alloys Develop mechanical joining processes including Self-piercing Rivets, Flow Form, Bolt, Rivnuts etc. Responsible for metallurgical processes implementation including Casting, Forging, Heat Treatment etc. Responsible for implementation of welding/joining procedures for future model launches and process improvement Responsible to provide technical support and monitoring processes to ensure that quality product is delivered on time to the manufacturing team Conduct root cause analysis and problem-solving methods Support plant manufacturing and engineering staff during new program launches Developing welding and joining processes integrated with structural adhesives Develop internal weld/joint testing and evaluation programs with cross-functional teams to support application development and CAE models Qualifications:  Ph.D. or Master in Welding, Metallurgy, Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, or a related technical field 5+ years of practical knowledge in welding and joining technologies 2-3 years of research and development work experience with materials science Extensive knowledge of physical and welding metallurgy in the area of Aluminium and Steel alloys Familiarity with welding of low carbon and high strength sheet steels, and welding codes/specifications, particularly for automotive applications, would be a plus Working knowledge of mechanical engineering, structural engineering, failure of materials and experimental design Proven success working within an interdisciplinary team Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to teach a technically diverse audience using formal and informal techniques   Candidates must have current U.S. work authorization or be TN eligible from Mexico or Canada. This position is not eligible for CPT or OPT.    #LI-RM1  EEO Statement: Nikola Corporation™ is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

To strengthen our Technology and Product Development capability within the Mechanical Simulation Team, we are searching for an experienced engineer with expertise in engine and method development. From genset dynamics to valvetrain performance, to core engine components, the candidate should have a strong technical track record, be a self-motivated team player and passionate problem solver.  Essential Responsibilities: Take part in core engine development (1D, MBS, NVH, EHD, FEA) Lead, assist and mentor team in resolving technical problems of various priorities, complexities and scales while engaging with stakeholders Leverage existing analytical methods in supporting emerging problems, while creatively seeking automation and digitization opportunities Produce engineering documentation and contribute to design reviews Qualifications / Requirements: Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Mathematics or Equivalent 5+ years of work experience in analysis-led design, developing reciprocating engines core components and conducting dynamic mechanical simulations Experience in tools and methods development (Python, Matlab or other) Diverse experience in CAE software such as AVL Excite, GT-Suite, Simpack, Ringpack/Pisdyn, ANSYS, ABAQUS, FE-Safe and/or FEMFAT  Desired Characteristics: 5+ years of experience in the area of reciprocating engine development (MBS, NVH, EHD, FEA, etc.) Experience in model verification and validation by experimental testing Self-driven, motivated, team player Analytical yet pragmatic problem solver, innovative thinker, networker, and leader Comfortable in an international environment and have convincing oral and written communication skills. Comfortable with presentation of detailed technical themes across a wide range of audiences

Plant Maintenance EngineerPosition Summary:The Plant Engineer participates, directs, and coordinates activities concerned with repair; safety; design; construction; and predictive systems for the maintenance of equipment and machinery within the manufacturing operations. Also responsible for plant facilities and grounds; security and fire systems, utilities, energy management, planning and coordinating maintenance training requirements; capital programs and equipment design. Position is in South Windsor, CT.Work Schedule and Hours:Two shift working schedule and hours, final shift offered based on business needs. Two offered shifts are Monday – Friday 3:00am – 12:30pm, and/or Monday-Friday 12:30pm – 9:00pm; occasional weekend work and overtime is required.Key Responsibilities:Helps in reviewing the facility's maintenance program; identifying and analyzing equipment or machinery failures and takes corrective actions. Uses all methods of Root Cause Analysis and Predictive Statistical Methods to determine different programs and adjust Predictive and Preventive Maintenance Activities.Analyze control diagrams, electrical and mechanical drawings to determine the best approach to a comprehensive and sustainable maintenance solution for all equipment in the facility.Analyze PLCs and Control boards, troubleshoot, diagnose and repair equipment as needed.Responsible for maintaining the Safety & Health standards, actively participating in employee safety training, hazard prevention and control, worksite analysis, and exercising management leadershipImplement improvement projects (scope, cost estimation, request capital money, supervision of work, commissioning)Provide technical support to operations and maintenance personnel for equipment inspection, repair, and preventative maintenance activitiesDevelopment and implementation of loT technologies and digital manufacturingHardware and software development for technological facility projectsFulfill responsibilities which ensure food safety, legality, and qualityPerform CP's Coordinator duties as neededInvestigate and implement corrective actions for critical and recurrent equipment failures using appropriate failure analysis techniquesProvide technical training to the maintenance department personnelAssist in area shutdowns so that they are properly planned and parts are availableOversee, coordinate and direct outside contractors as necessaryWork with plant teams to achieve plant objectivesPerform other tasks as assigned by your managerRequired Education and Experience:Bachelor s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering Technology, Mechatronics Engineering or related degree with relevant experiencePreferred 3+ years of experience in industrial maintenanceDigital Manufacturing with CAD/CAE/CAM software preferredRequired Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Knowledge of industrial maintenance techniques (PM, PDM, RCM, TPM)Knowledge of mechanical conveying equipment (screw, drag, & belt conveyor, bucket elevators, dust collectors, rotary valves, centrifugal pumps, compressors, blowers, fans, mills, centrifuges, rotary dryers, and tanks)Knowledge of computerized maintenance management systems (CMMS)Understanding of good engineering and safety practicesAbility to coordinate, train, and motivate hourly employees and outside contractorsAbility to manage budget and to estimate costs related to various projectsKnowledge of capital money management and return on investmentStrong problem-solving skills and experience in failure analysisDemonstrated equipment reliability knowledgeStrong teamwork skills to collaborate with colleagues and to support the maintenance teamsPhysical Requirements and Work Environment:While performing the duties of this job, the employee is subject to standing for prolonged periods; frequently walks, grasps, lifts, holds, or feels objects; occasionally stoops, kneels, crouches, or crawls. The employee frequently is required to use manual and finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination when working and handling products, computers, or machinery. The employee is subject to assist and support up to 50 pounds with varying amounts of assistance on a as needed basis. The employee is required to have corrected vision and hearing within normal range and the ability to operate equipment if required. The employee may be exposed to moving mechanical parts and non-moving mechanical parts. The employee could have work conditions that are extremely cold or extremely hot. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Among the top benefits Tribe 9 Foods offers:Competitive wages with promotional opportunitiesHealth, Dental, and Vision insuranceCompany-paid vacation and holiday timeRetirement plan with matching contributions by Tribe 9 FoodsHealth savings account (HSA)Health fitness reimbursementProfessional developmentPaid volunteer hoursOur guiding principles:Tackle Anything: embrace the unknown; bring ideas to reality; conquer lofty goalsRelationship Driven: build partnerships and amaze our customersInspire Each Other: as each individual grows, so does the organization; unlock each other's potentialB Corp Values: balance profit and purpose; use business as a force for goodEntrepreneurial Spirit: challenge the status quo through creative destruction and innovationTribe 9 Foods is an Equal Opportunity EmployerJob Type: Full-time

Role and Responsibilities Responsible for maintaining a F16 training device’s network, hardware, and software on a highly complex F16 Block 50+ Simulator Training Program. Summary Perform a variety of duties in the electronic, mechanical, electromechanical, or optical areas in support of F16 MTC Flight Trainers located at Chiayi, Taiwan. May be asked to occasionally support F16 devices located in Hualien, Taiwan  Essential Duties and Responsibilities Install, maintain, repair, calibrate and test flight simulators, and other support equipment Install changes and updates to simulators and support equipment as required Perform required readiness checks on flight simulation equipment and instruments Conduct and document preventative maintenance checks required for simulator and support equipment Troubleshoot, repair, and document malfunctions of simulators and support equipment Remove and replace faulty equipment and complete maintenance data collection records Assist with installation and check-out of simulator and support equipment modifications Assist with general field site facility activities as required Work from engineering drawings and written or verbal instructions Apply comprehensive knowledge to solve complex problems by interpreting manufacturers' manuals or similar documents Perform other related duties as required by the supervisor or site manager Qualifications and Education Requirements Bachelor's Degree or a two-year electronic technician resident course at an accredited technical institute and/or military technical training and equivalent electronics maintenance experience on equipment of similar complexity Must have at least 4 years' electronic maintenance experience and have demonstrated competence by satisfactory progressive performance in electronic maintenance on simulation systems of comparable complexity to those supported on this program This position requires experience in large-scale integrated multi-computer systems, video generation and display systems, large-scale complex digital interfaces, high density cable/plug repair, software maintenance, and comprehensive troubleshooting and repair of general training device peripheral systems This is an overseas Field Service position and may require travel to other overseas locations. Prospective employee must be able to work independently and interface with the customer and home office when on travel. Product Engineer FSLA Status: Exempt Location: Lordstown, OH Reports To: Advanced Engineering Manager Primary Function: Providing essential support to our client's product design and development team. Responsible for BIW and chassis design reviews. This includes conducting comprehensive analyses of Design for Manufacturability (DFM), Design for Assembly (DFA), and Design for Service (DFS) and offering recommendations for design improvements that enhance part restructurability and reduce costs. Duties and Responsibilities: Provide product design input to drive improved manufacturability, assembly, and serviceability. (DFM, DFA & DFS Analysis) Conduct DFMEA studies to assess potential failure modes. Provide support for the DVP&R (Design Verification Plan & Report) process. Implement engineering solutions on manufacturing equipment based on product design or design modifications. Collaborate with the Manufacturing Engineering team to design, develop, and validate new equipment, optimizing workflow, assembly methods, and workforce utilization for increased efficiency. Foster cross-functional collaboration with multiple OEM customers. Aid OEM customers in developing their vehicles across various systems, aligning with Foxconn's manufacturing and assembly processes. Conduct feasibility studies for new programs in a virtual environment. Undertake advanced concept studies. Lead virtual builds with OEM customers to evaluate product designs. Create Process and Product Assembly Drawings. Generate Product Drawings for suggested component enhancements. Required Education Bachelor’s degree or associate degree with equivalent experience. Required Experience 4-6 years of 2d and 3d experience with AutoCAD and Solid works 4-6 years of CAE structural analysis experience with Hypermesh & Optistruct Proficiency in AutoCAD & SolidWorks / Catia Sound knowledge of reading and interpreting engineering drawings. Requires Skills/Licenses/Certifications Strong interpersonal and communication skills are required to establish and maintain professional, effective working relationships within and outside the company. Must be self-directed with exceptional time management, prioritization, and organizational skills; Strong project management skills to keep team and actions on track to completion. Prior background in automotive industries; Experience working with Automotive Suppliers is a plus. Strong knowledge of automotive product design & development process Strong background in DFMEA, DFM & DFA studies Strong background in CAD 2d & 3d drawing and detailing. Strong background in CAE analysis. Demonstrated hands-on approach, analytical abilities, and attention to detail. Motivated to learn and develop incredible on-the-job experience.

Put a LIFT in Your Career! Hyster-Yale Group, Inc. (HYG), a world-class manufacturer of industrial lift trucks, has an outstanding opportunity for an exceptional and talented Electrical Engineer at our facility located in Greenville, NC.As an Electrical Engineer, you will work on the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, provide product design documentation through the creation of detail drawings, engineering lists and Engineering Change Notices (ECN) and integrate manufacturing input into the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, and may participate in the support of manufacturing activities such as Pilot or 1st Production.As an Electrical Engineer you will also create product design documentation – such as CAE (computer aided engineering), 3-d models, detail drawings, engineering lists, reports, test plans and software coding – to support release of Change Orders describing component design revisions. You will translate truck-level and system-level requirements to component requirements and plan and support development testing to ensure design robustness to requirements. The Engineer IV will interface with component suppliers and internal customers (Platform, Manufacturing, Marketing, Service, etc.) to understand detailed product requirements and develop concepts for system design as well as supervise other engineers/technicians.Key AccountabilitiesDesign and develop components as required for lift truck vehiclesDesign and develop assemblies as required for lift truck vehicles and order prototype partsDesign and develop wire harnessThe Engineer IV will also, evaluate component design and assembly, build prototype vehicles, design and evaluate systems and plan and execute prototype test activitiesProvide design specification documentation as required to manufacture the product such as detail drawings, engineering list structure and ECN writingProvide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productProvide product/process specification documents, detailed drawings/software development, test engineering reports, sales and product information data and test plansDevelop product around the most efficient and cost-effective manufacturing processes, and provide on-site Engineering support during critical Manufacturing activities such as Pilot and 1st Production; integrate Manufacturing/Purchasing input basic designThe Engineer IV will also provide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productThe Engineer IV will also provide leadership and guidance to individuals and project teams to ensure project deliverables are metHR administration and local project supervisionThe Engineer IV will also provide design/test input to project proposals, research for future product projects and develop design and evaluation concepts which enable program and project decisionsAdditionally, the Engineer IV will devise plans for component strategy creation that take advantage of unapparent opportunities given technology advances aligned with corporate visionMinimum Qualifications:B.S., Engineering discipline, requiredOne-Five years industry experience. All skill levels will be considered.Beginner-Master level knowledge/skill in drawing practices, CAD, design layouts, engineering analysisBasic specialized knowledge/skill in vehicle/automotive technology, manufacturing technology, design/test experience, test practices and proceduresBasic specialized knowledge/skill in industry regulationsBasic knowledge in scheduling and supervisionProficient demonstration of the core competenciesPreferred Skills:NX and Zuken experienceWho we are: HYG designs, engineers, manufactures, sells and services a comprehensive line of lift trucks and aftermarket parts marketed globally under the Hyster and Yale brand names. We are one of the global leaders in the Material Handling industry and have been building relationships and partnering with our customers, suppliers, dealers and employees for over 90 years.What we offer: Hyster-Yale Group offers competitive pay, tuition reimbursement, supportive work environment, hybrid work option, and opportunities for growth and development. A full benefits package: paid time off; medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, employer-sponsored profit sharing and 401(k).#LI-OP#LI-ONSITEJob Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Dental insuranceLife insuranceTuition reimbursementVision insuranceWork Location: In person

column7: Mechanical Design Engineer Location: Marysville, OH What Makes a Honda, is Who makes a Honda Honda has a clear vision for the future, and it’s a joyful one. We are looking for individuals with the skills, courage, persistence, and dreams that will help us reach our future-focused goals. At our core is innovation. Honda is constantly innovating and developing solutions to drive our business with record success. We strive to be a company which serves as a source of “power” that supports people around the world who are trying to do things based on their own initiative and that helps people expand their own potential. To this end, Honda strives to realize “the joy and freedom of mobility” by developing new technologies and an innovative approach to achieve a “zero environmental footprint.” We are looking for qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences, continuous improvement values, and a strong work ethic to join our team. If your goals and values align with Honda’s, we want you to join our team to Bring the Future! About this Position: The position is to function as an entry level mechanical designer; supporting a team dedicated to the development and integration of equipment into Honda facilities. The associate is responsible for equipment development for both business plan and new model projects. They are responsible working through concept development to a completed design. This associate is tasked with ensuring design meets the target criteria and has been optimized as a design solution. Responsibilities include: Provide mechanical design to produce automated production equipment solutions to assemble/build and install/mature to our production facilities. Work in an engineering team atmosphere understand design requirements to create/modify automated production equipment. Provide on-site support to install, system up, and mature the control system for production equipment. Create and maintain a critical path schedule for work assignments to produce the control system design deliverables to achieve the overall project milestones for small to medium projects/ low to medium complexity. Conduct and attend design reviews to ensure design standards are achieved and design meets specification requirements for work assignment deliverables. Continuously apply engineering mindset to learn new skills/processes/technology to expands one knowledge base in relevant manufacturing technologies. Who we are seeking: Required Work Experience: Two terms of Co-Op or internship experience in field of Degree or 2 years’ experience designing automated equipment. Required Education: Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent work experience. Desired skills: Knowledge of 3D CAE systems and software. Background in automated equipment development.Technical communication skills (both written and oral).Additional Position Factors: 90% Office environment – creation of specification documentation.  10% Manufacturing floor – Line side investigation / system-up support / verification at any Honda facility. Must be willing to travel locally, regional, and internationally as required on a project basis (to Honda facilities or external equipment vendors). At Honda, you will play a key role in our journey to become a company that society wants to exist now, and in the future. Your endless curiosity will drive innovation and your courageous spirit will challenge the status quo. We believe having a workforce made up of diverse thinkers and innovators makes us a better Honda. Respect for each other and respect for diversity each and every day drives our associates to contribute at the highest level and work effectively in a team environment. We make the dream of mobility a reality with our innovative and high-quality products. Together, we Bring the Future to our customers, associates, and communities. We are Honda! What differentiates Honda and make us an employer of choice? Total Rewards: Competitive base salary  Annual Bonus Paid time off, including vacation, paid holidays, sick time, personal days 401K Plan with company match + additional contribution Relocation assistance (if eligible) Career Growth: Advancement opportunities Career mobility  Education reimbursement for continued learning Training and Development programs Additional Offerings: Wellbeing program Community service and engagement programs Product programs Free drinks onsite Honda is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.

The Manufacturing Engineer evaluates the safety, quality and efficiency of current manufacturing processes, raw materials, vended parts, and part and system designs. Participates in the identification of alternate materials, parts, and processes that improve product quality, reliability, manufacturing efficiency, and cost. Compensation Data: Competitive salary based upon experience. Incentive Bonus eligible. Location: Newbury, OH. This position is 100% onsite, M-F, 8-5. Travel: None Key Responsibilities: Evaluates and recommends changes to current product designs to increase product reliability and manufacturability, and to reduce costs. Evaluates and recommends raw materials for manufacturing to increase product reliability and reduce costs. Evaluates and recommends changes to the production processes to increase efficiency, reduce costs and ensure safety. Identifies opportunities for automation within the manufacturing process. Serves as project lead for the implementation of automated equipment including hardware testing and software programming. Develops tools and machines and designs new automation equipment or processes to increase productivity and efficiency in all manufacturing areas. Defines and implements design and process validation plans, performs process failure mode effect analysis, and prepares control plans for manufactured and vended products. Writes Engineering Changes and deviations to document changes to form, fit or function of production parts or manufacturing processes. Coordinates with the Product and Manufacturing process specialists on potential material, part and system changes. Collaborates with product development teams on new product design and field testing. Evaluates returned goods for manufacturing defects, non-conformances, and product issues. Performs dimensional and functional review of manufactured and purchased parts. What you will need to succeed: Education & Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in manufacturing and industrial engineering with 5 -8 years of manufacturing process or manufacturing production experience. Lean Six Sigma Training – Preferred Green Belt level, Black Belt a plus. Competencies: Experience with Statistical Process Control (SPC). Experience using CAD and/or CAE Software. Experience with specifying, supporting and troubleshooting automation equipment and ancillary components. Experience with plastic injection molding a plus. Experience with plastic part design a plus. Good analytical and problem-solving skills. Good computer skills including word processing and spreadsheet proficiency. Good interpersonal/customer relation skills. Why Join Kinetico: Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug Insurance Coverage Employer Provided Life Insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Benefits 401(k) Contribution Matching Program Employer Funded Defined Contribution Plan Paid Vacation, Holidays and Community Service Volunteer Time-off Benefit Wellness Program Educational Assistance Reimbursement Program Work-life Balance Advancement Opportunities Our Commitment and Difference: Founded in 1970, Kinetico pioneered the development of non-electric, fully automatic water treatment systems. In the years since, we have grown into a global company of independent Kinetico water experts and international distributors serving more than 100 countries. We offer complete water systems that deliver only the highest quality water for general use and drinking. We back every piece of our equipment with industry-leading warranties. Our approach reflects our deep commitment to preserving and conserving fresh water, one of our planet's most precious and endangered natural resources. Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  We are currently seeking a Restraint System - Test Engineer. This position requires an excellent understanding of mechanical engineering fundamentals with testing to be responsible to manage our validation plans with autonomy. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.  Note: Sub-system means the Airbag together with the host component, like Passenger airbags and knee airbags in Instrument panelSide airbags in seat,Role Manage and execute part of the Restraint Sub-system integration validation plan:For new development as well as model years variantsSupport the DREs to build validation plan and keep the validation plan tracker up-to-dateManage Testing: forecast, material order, test lab, test fixture, support resources, parts certification, pre-test checks, witness testing, post-tests checks, tear-down, first level analysis, kinematic tracker, test report, scrap/storage of the parts, etc..Ensure that the tests are performed properly to meet the expectation. Work together with the Restraints and Interiors DRE to learn the design and behavior of their individual parts and drive the common development for the sub-system Make test reports for tests performed by Lucid (at Lucid or external facilities), or collect tests reports from external test labs or suppliers when Lucid delegates the test ownership. Perform test video analysis and document the test trackers Actively participate in root cause analysis with the owners of the components involved in the issue Assemble the test parts onto the test fixture (includes heavy parts like seats or IPs) Having short and punctual intervention in climatic chambers at low or high temperatures (around -35C or +85C) Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or other related fields and a minimum of 2 years of related experience; or an advanced degree without experience; or equivalent work experience. Enough experience to demonstrate the capacity to fully meet the role; 6 months experience in testing of Restraints, Seats, IP or upper trims, Crash tests or other Safety components Deep understanding of Mechanical Engineering fundamentals: mechanics of materials, materials properties and engineering of materials, kinematics of solids, failure mechanics and capacity to apply those fundamentals in problem solving Enough CAD skills to consult existing CAD assemblies to understand the assembly and taking useful measurements in relation to the tests Advantageous Some knowledge about the design and engineering of airbags and/or interiors parts, direct experience in automotive OEM or Tier 1 suppliers Experience in assembly and dis-assembly of Automotive interiors parts Experience in testing (crash, airbag deployment, seats, IP and/or upper trims) Enough CAD skills to design small brackets or design simple fixtures Experience in occupant safety system performance optimization Experience using APQP processes (DVP&R, 8D, DFMEA, DRBFM) Knowledge of CAE analysis and restraint system integration and optimization 6 sigma Green or Black Belt Ability to conduct efficient reporting, both oral and written; Ability to articulate highly technical issues to audiences such as the crash safety field engineering or Interiors engineering Capacity to negotiate (with test labs, logistic, plant or other to achieve our goals without compromising future relationship with those partners) High ethics and diligence Physical capacity to manipulate interiors parts in and out of test bucks or tests fixtures Curiosity, thoroughness Education Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or other related fields and a minimum of 2 years of related experience; or an advanced degree without experience; or equivalent work experience. Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors.  California (Bay Area) - $104,000-$143,000 Additional Compensation and Benefits: Lucid offers a wide range of competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, vacation, and 401k. The successful candidate may also be eligible to participate in Lucid’s equity program and/or a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing such programs. (Cash or equity incentive awards, if any, will depend on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and company performance.) American Battery Solutions has a full-time opening for an Electrical Battery Engineer in Lake Orion, Michigan. Job Summary: The Electrical Battery Engineer is responsible for the battery system electrical requirements, architecture, and their analysis. They apply an interdisciplinary approach to the engineering of battery systems and components; what is required of the design. They analyze and drive early integration of battery electrical systems and continue to support them over the project life cycle. They define and document overall electrical architecture and schematics at the system level and oversee verification of the electrical sub-system requirements. This includes defining electrical system requirements early in the development cycle, identifying top technical risks, contributing to the design synthesis, and driving the concept verification via testing and analysis. This individual will work closely with the systems and engineering design team, prototype manufacturing team, key suppliers, validation/testing team, customers, program managers, and business development. Responsibilities: Develop electrical system architecture and schematics. Derive sub-system electrical requirements and allocate to electrical architecture. Develop external interface specifications for the electrical interfaces to other systems. Lead cross-functional electrical system engineering meetings with other engineers. Drive resolutions in the electrical systems, between customers and design engineers Support the Lead Systems Engineer with electrical engineering related topics. Support the DREs with their design reviews of the electrical components. Analyze failure modes of electrical systems in the DFMEA; support functional safety analysis. Track and prioritize top technical risks and known electrical system issues. Develop electrical sub-system integration test plan and drive prototype testing and analysis. Develop electrical inspection requirements for end of line testing. Drive model-based analysis of the electrical battery system with CAD and CAE teams. Help troubleshoot battery pack issues and support development of engineering guidelines. Adhere to federal and state regulations. Adhere to all company policies, processes, and procedures. Performs other duties as requested, directed, or assigned. Predictable and reliable attendance. Position Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, or equivalent degree. Masters degree preferred. Minimum of three (3) years of experience in HV automotive applications or similar, such as Electronic Control Units (ECUs), HV/LV power, communication, and sensory systems. Preferred experience with High Voltage/Low Voltage battery systems, Battery Management Systems (BMS), Battery Disconnect Units (BDU), Power Distribution Units (PDU), wiring, controls, CAN, connectors, relays, contactors, fuses, and busbars. Experience with DFMEA, PFMEA, DFM/DFA, and DVP&R. Hands-on lab/shop skills (multimeters, oscilloscopes, HiPot isolation testers, LCR meters, CANalyzer/CANoe, DAQs, ect.). Ability to work hands-on with High and Low Voltage Power and Communication systems. Preferred experience in a requirement engineering management tool and systems engineering (e.g. Jama, DOORS) and MBSE modeling architectures. Preferred experience with MATLAB/Simulink/Simscape controls and simulations. Preferred experience with CAD/CAE and 3D electrical design tools. Familiar with common automotive & industry standards. Adept in basic data processing and statistical analysis. Presents strong interpersonal communication, listening, and technical writing skills. Preferred experience with the handling of high voltage lithium-ion battery systems. Preferred training in High Voltage safety and Personal Protection Equipment (PPE). Abides by safety standards and protocols. Effective communicator, capable of presenting technical test data to various audiences. Self-motivated problem solver who pays attention to details and drives improvement. Ability to travel and work flexible hours as needed (less than 10% travel on average). Ability to organize and plan effectively with project teams. Basic engineering knowledge outside electrical (mechanical, software, industrial, ect.). Key Competencies: Influences Others: Has personal and organizational impact built on mutual trust, fairness, and honesty. Flexes their style to direct, collaborate, or empower, as the situation requires. Self-Leadership: Enjoys positions of responsibility and authority. Desires and chooses to be in a leadership position. Takes Calculated Risks: Takes calculated risks to achieve goals. Finds a balance between analysis and action. When fails, accepts it, learns from it, and moves on to the next challenge. Takes Initiative: Exhibits strong drive for results and success; conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure; persists despite obstacles and opposition. Teamwork: Works cooperatively with others to accomplish team goals and organizational objectives. Delivers Results: Achievement-oriented, feeling a sense of urgency to reach goals on time, if not before. Communications: Exchanges thoughts, feelings, and information effectively. Assertiveness: Maintaining a position when you know you are right; standing up to others and expressing views without fear or for approval and without engaging in unnecessary aggression. Physical Requirements / Working Conditions: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment. Ability to adjust focus, especially due to concentration on a computer screen. May need to lift and carry up to 30 pounds and/or position the body to reach items on the floor/below knee level or reach overhead. The person in this position needs to occasionally move about in industrial environments, and on uneven terrain. Works in a temperature-controlled office environment, with occasional work in outdoor weather conditions, and in industrial environments. The noise level in the work environment can be moderately loud. Why Join Us American Battery Solutions (ABS) provides comprehensive benefit plan options at no cost and a competitive salary to all associates. ABS is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Benefits Overview Paid time off includes 4 weeks, 15 holidays, and parental leave. 100% company-paid medical, dental, vision, short-term disability, long-term disability life insurance. Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA) offerings. Company provided 401K savings plan with matching contributions to help you save for retirement. Voluntary benefits offerings. Tuition assistance. Employee Referral program. Employee development and career growth opportunities. About Us At American Battery Solutions (ABS) we are developing the next generation of battery energy storage systems that will power the vehicles of today and tomorrow! Our team works with the latest technologies and battery chemistries engineering, testing, and manufacturing batteries to power the world’s electric propulsion transition. At ABS you may get a chance to work on a project for an autonomous warehouse robot or an autonomous lawnmower, or you may work on a battery for a fleet of delivery vehicles or a transit bus, or even an EV start-up or a massive grid energy storage system. Our team is led by some of the industry’s most experienced professionals, but we pride ourselves on developing a diverse team of next-generation battery experts. The Location - Lake Orion American Battery Solutions Headquarters and Innovation Center is located in the heart of South-East Michigan in Orion Township. Orion Township is a Pure Michigan Trail Town that has a long-standing dedication to enhancing trails and pathways in its community, which is home to the Polly Ann Trail, Paint Creek Trail, and Iron Belle Trail. The township boasts more than 50 miles of trails. Southeast Michigan also boasts some of the best eating around! Whether your interest is in furthering your education, enjoying one of the many regional sporting events, or enjoying the vast outdoors that Michigan has to offer, you’ll be at the center of it here! AMERICAN BATTERY SOLUTIONS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

Launch your new career with SYSTIMA a Division of Karman Space & Defense! Take a look at who we are! https://youtu.be/gB9JqcGYtWA COME JOIN OUR TEAM! We are looking for a Structures Design Engineer II for our Advanced Materials & Processes Division! Pay: $95,000 - $114,000 DOE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS: Conceptualize, develop, and design structures, tooling, and mechanisms in accordance with customer requirements, with a focus on advanced composite components Create component and assembly level CAD models Create engineering drawings, and define bill of materials, manufacturing system requirements, and quality assurance inspection requirements in accordance with appropriate standards and specifications Implement geometric tolerancing and perform basic mechanical engineering calculations Review designs for cost, manufacturing, and quality assurance issues Provide technical support to customers Designate off-the-shelf mechanical component or systems, identify vendors who can supply them, and request their purchase in a manner timely with delivery requirements Document requirements for performance, compliance with customer requirements, plans, test procedures, test reports, and any other contractual specifications Support manufacturing, quality assurance, testing, and deployment of designs from concept to delivery Support proposal/presentation preparation for business development and market surveys. Perform analysis of designs to ensure safe operation in meetings EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent experience and registration Typically possesses 2-5 years aerospace and/or defense hardware design experience Demonstrated proficiency in mechanical design, engineering, and drawing conventions Hands on experience with composite part and tool manufacturing preferred Knowledge of CAD/CAE tools relevant to mechanical systems design Proficient with CATIA V5, experience with CATIA Composite Work Bench preferred Proficient with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing methods Detailed knowledge of design based military and commercial specifications Self-motivated, able to multi-task, work independently on assignments with minimal oversight or direction, quality-oriented and safety conscious Possesses strong mechanical aptitude as well as creativity in solving problems; able to track overall goals and “see the big picture” while focusing on details Excellent communication and customer relationship skills Must be a U.S. Citizen Must hold or be able to obtain a DoD SECRET clearance COMPANY BENEFITS: Medical Dental Vision Life 401k Tuition Reimbursement Paid Holidays Employee Referral Program If an exciting career in the Space & Defense Industry is for you, we'd LOVE to talk to you! KARMAN SPACE & DEFENSE: Karman is the market leading suppliers of metallic and composite flight hardware and sub-assemblies for the space, missile, and hypersonic markets. Karman offers an unprecedented capability set to customers, creating a supply chain solution in a historically fragmented supply base. The Karman team draws on in-house expertise in engineering & design, precision machining, large part forming, welding, heat age, finishing, assembly, ablative & insulative composites, and other capabilities to serve as a strategic partner to customers. Karman is headquartered in greater Los Angeles and currently has 5 locations in Southern California and 1 location in Mukilteo, Washington. Karman is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis (“protected class”) including, but not limited to race; color; religion; genetic information; national origin; sex; pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions; age; disability; citizenship status; uniform servicemember status; or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law. We are seeking an experienced Driveline & Axles Product Development Support professional to join us. This role involves working closely with cross-functional teams to supply to the design, engineering, and successful launch of driveline and axles products. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in product engineering, design, and release processes, We are looking minimum of 5 years of relevant experience. Experience with NX and Teamcenter software is a plus. Responsibilities :- Product Engineering / Design & Releasing: Collaborate with the engineering team to develop and refine driveline and axles products. Generate detailed designs, perform feasibility studies, and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.Develop DFMEAs and Evaluate Designs: Develop Design Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (DFMEA) documents. Evaluate designs for potential failure modes and recommend design improvements to enhance product reliability and safety.DVP&R (Design Verification Plan & Report): Contribute to the creation of DVP&R documents outlining testing and validation procedures. Work with testing teams to ensure successful execution and documentation of verification tests.CAE Reviews with CAE Team: Participate in CAE (Computer-Aided Engineering) reviews with the CAE team. Provide guidance, evaluate simulations, and supply to refining designs based on CAE analysis!Monitoring Sourcing with Purchasing: Work closely with the purchasing department to supervise the sourcing of components and materials required for the products. Ensure timely availability of resources while adhering to cost and quality considerations.Supplier Technical Reviews: Support technical reviews with suppliers to ensure alignment on design specifications, manufacturing processes, and quality standards. Address any technical concerns and collaborate on resolution.Support Pre-Pilot/Launch Activities: learn and Play a crucial role in pre-pilot and product launch activities. Collaborate with multi-functional teams to ensure readiness for production, addressing any last-minute design or engineering adjustments.Tooling Kick Off: Participate in tooling kick-off meetings to ensure accurate and timely development of required manufacturing tools and equipment.Lead and facilitate change management processes, ensuring that design changes are properly evaluated, documented, and implemented while minimizing disruptions.Required Skills :-Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field. Advanced degree is a plus.We are looking Minimum of 5 years of experience in product engineering, design, and releasing, preferably in driveline and axles domain.Proficiency in CAD software, particularly NX, and experience with Teamcenter is advantageous.Strong understanding of DFMEA, DVP&R, and CAE processes!Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with internal teams and suppliers.Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills.Always eager to learn and improve.Strong interpersonal and writing skills. Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  We are currently seeking an Engineer, Hardware Safety Electronics. This position requires an experienced professional in Safety Electronics packaging and mechanical development. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment. Role Responsible for design release of Safety Electronics hardware. Support Design Engineers in the mechanical integration and release of Safety Electronics components. Maintain PLM data for Safety Electronic Components. Work closely with the design studio and interior engineering teams to develop the optimum restraint system packages for occupant protection performance and interior styling. Manage Tier 1 suppliers for both engineering development and program timing. Work closely with supply chain team to deliver against key program and vehicle milestones. Responsible for definition of electrical interface documentation, connector selection, pinout etc. Work closely with vehicle electrical harness team to integrate the safety sub-system into vehicle overall electrical architecture. Support vehicle homologation team to ensure regulatory compliance of the systems. Provide expertise on Safety Electronics system design to meet all vehicle targets (performance, cost, timing, weight, Studio design, quality, manufacturing, etc…). Qualifications 2 years of related experience; or an advanced degree without experience In-depth knowledge about the design and engineering of automotive electrical safety systems, direct experience in automotive OEM (preferred) and/or Tier 1 suppliers. Enough CAD skills to package the component models into vehicle models, check interfaces with the rest of the vehicle and make small modifications if necessary. The ideal candidate should possess enough CAD skills to design simple brackets, fixtures, etc. 3 Years experience in Catia/NX/Creo Knowledge of GD&T and drawing/print creation A proven track record of technical excellence in vehicle electrical system development, ideally with experience in any of the specified safety sub-systems Knowledge of latest technology advancement in the field of vehicle crash safety. Knowledge of vehicle networks and topologies, including CAN, LIN and Ethernet. Engineering fundamentals in problem solving. Advantageous Experience in working with Functional Safety processes and relevant documentation. Experience in creation and management of Failure Mode Analysis techniques, including DFMEA. Experience developing and delivering embedded system hardware and/or software. Experience with CAE Simulation. Experience in test equipment design. Experience in harness design. Experience with electric propulsion systems, including relevant controls. The ability to articulate highly technical issues to audiences not in the safety field, such as top management, design studio, purchasing team, etc. Excellent people skills to manage suppliers, push the envelope to develop optimal technical solutions, ensure timely delivery of all components. Working understanding and application of project planning and task management. Have strong ethics, attention to detail and desire to create the very best product. Excellent writing, verbal and organization skills. Education Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 2 years of related experience; or an advanced degree without experience Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors. Description:   * Visa sponsorship is not supported for this position * Hybrid/Remote: This position will require occasional onsite presence at the New Philadelphia, Ohio facility. Onsite presence for this position will be required occasionally as the business necessitates, in addition to 1 week onsite for new hire orientation and training. Battle Motors prides itself on delivering efficient, effective solutions for the heavy-duty work truck industry. With the evolution of our new EV (Electric Vehicle) technology, we are growing faster than ever. At Battle Motors, we believe the most fulfilling place to work is where extraordinary people collaborate to solve difficult problems. As a Functional Safety Engineer, you will guide the Engineering team on this wholistic discipline with the goal of designing not only to the desired function, but the many ways that systems or components may fail or operate outside what is intended. By practicing this discipline, we make better more robust products for our customers. Battle Motors is committed to delivering the highest quality of products by ensuring that these complex technologies are designed with FuSa engrained in our designs. This is a terrific opportunity to work with an exceptionally talented team of engineers and to collaborate with the brightest minds in the EV Medium & Heavy Truck industry. ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIESRapidly begin to work with cross-functional teams within Product Development including System, Hardware, and Software engineering to conduct ISO 26262 Functional Safety analysis of challenging technology including EV powertrain, infotainment, advance driver assistance, and V2X technologies.Function as a subject matter expert in ISO 26262 processes, methods, tools, and information (on the job training for System, Software and Component engineers as necessary).Results in becoming a technical lead for Functional Safety and a key Systems engineering resource in Battle Motors Engineering organization.Lead the establishment and continuously improve simple and safe advanced system designs.Work with System, Software, and Component engineers to globally author common safety ratings, processes, methods, tools, & training and help to accelerate company adoption of SysML based Functional Safety analysis at Battle Motors.Participate in moving fast and continuously innovating Systems engineering for creating exciting technology at Battle Motors.Support the definition of safety requirements and inform architecture and design.Participate in design reviews and discussions to help ensure that safety goals and requirements are addressed.Research Federal and State Compliance requirements for all functional safety areas including EV powertrain, mechanical, electromechanical, controls & calibrations and frontal & side impact, etc. and assign functional safety testing to meet those requirements.Perform design safety analysis FMEA, FTA for systematic failures for both hardware and software systems.Prepare test case specifications for functional safety validation & testing.Prepare and complete Hazard Analysis and Risk assessment and DFMEA System, Hardware, Software checksCoordinate any functional safety testing for new and existing products with internal and external validation engineers to ensure on time execution.Develop, derive, and document safety concepts and requirements analysis for new electrical architectures.Performing analyses for feasibility for manufacturing, assembly, and service processesProduce concise management summaries and report-outs that meet the needs of management system functions. · Interact with suppliers, dealers, and customers as required.· Other duties as requested, directed, or assigned. Requirements:  QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTSBS Degree in Mathematics, Chemistry, Physics, Materials Science, Computer Science, Electronics Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field. Master’s degree in engineering (preferred).2+ years’ experience in Functional Safety (ISO 26262, or another IEC 61508 based standard) or the engineering of safety critical electronic systemsExperience with EV powertrains required.Experience ensuring ISO26262 compliance is achieved for new features and components (both HW & SW)Deep knowledge of Finite Element Analysis, Applied Solid Mechanics, Material science and Numerical Methods within an automotive/commercial product development environment, or Advanced CAE simulation certification required.Good understanding of Global regulatory safety protocols and performance requirements.Experience conducting failure analysis methodology like FMEA and fault trees.Define functional safety concept/goals at feature and component level.2+ years of experience conducting Hazard Analysis and Risk Assessments (HARA)2+ years authoring technical safety requirements.Motivation to make complicated systems more robust and have influence in the EV truck industry.Excellent communication skills leading system and component level engineers thru the FuSa process PREFERRED EXPERIENCE AND SKILLSExperience in all phases of developing a new complex product.4 years experience demonstrating leadership in Systems Engineering, software, or hardware architecture design.Experience with SysML or other MBSE tools, for example MagicDraw, Enterprise Architect, Medini Analyze, or equivalent tools.Understanding of high voltage energy storage and charging systems for EVsDesire to work in a rapidly changing, multidisciplinary product development environment. This position will adhere to the Battle Motors Environmental Health and Safety Program by following all safety rules, procedures, practices, training, and safe use of equipment; this includes use of personal protective equipment (PPE) as required. This individual will work in a way that stresses the importance of preventing injury, accidents, or illnesses to themselves or co-workers by correcting or reporting unsafe situations, incidents, or occurrences to their Supervisor immediately. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, national origin, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. #LI-BM1

Job Brief Entry LevelCrane Aerospace & Electronics has a unique and exciting career opportunity for a full-time Radio Frequency (RF) Engineer in our Chandler, Arizona facility. Job Summary: The RF Engineer will use established procedures and perform assigned tasks by working cross-functionally with Engineering, Operations, Suppliers and Customers. Provide engineering services for RF/Microwave/ Millimeter communications hardware systems for defense application including responsibility for technical proposals, prototype to production, performance, customer presentations, schedule, and cost requirements. Will have knowledge of concepts, practices and procedures of assigned product or program. RF Engineer Essential Functions:End to End Systems analysis, model and simulate circuit or system performance using analytical tools, Cascade analysis of up/down converters. Detailed analysis and design of RF (from VHF through millimeter-wave) and mixed-signal communications hardware components, including digital receiver subsystems and exciters (front ends, IF sections, phase-lock loops, AGC loops, synthesizers, A/D and D/A conversion). Filter modeling, analysis and design. System integration, test and development of RF/millimeter-wave communications hardware for spaceflight. Investigate; evaluate new communications technologies for spaceflight applications. Work with interdisciplinary teams to insure that the designs meet the customers electrical, environmental as well as internal manufacturing requirements and standards. Support internal concurrent design criteria. Functional as technical interface for customers and attend technical meetings as required, and specification development with customer. Translate customer specification; generate design documentation required for prototype and/or production releases as needed. Document new designs per established guidelines including but not limited to simulations, test circuit measurements and tolerance analysis. • Provide appropriate input to the development of test procedures, fixtures and software. Respond to RFQ/RFPs input & quote information relative to Engineering & Production costs. Any other task assigned by your supervisor or management RF Engineer Minimum Qualifications:Experience: 2+ years of experience in microwave/millimeter-wave design theory component design; Experience with high reliability hardware from conceptual design through flight delivery; Experience with microwave modeling tools (I.e. Genesys, ADS, AWR, Ansoft HFSS, Ansoft Designer, Ansoft Maxwell, Matlab and AutoCAD or equivalent software.)Knowledge: Knowledge of complex communication systems theory; Systems architecture, RF architecture, RF/Microwave circuit design; Detailed knowledge of RF and mixed-signal design techniques and technologies, including receivers, synthesizers, and transmitters; Millimeter wave Radio systems design; synthesizer design, mixers, amplifiers, PLLs, low phase noise VCOs, filters, etc., from DC > 40Ghz; Magnetic circuit analysis experience desired.
