employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Job SummaryNokomis is a dynamic technology company with over 16 years history of technical excellence in the development of next-generation Radio Frequency (RF) sensor systems for multiple applications. Our core technology, the Hiawatha RF sensor system, is among the most sensitive RF sensors available and allows monitoring of low power signals for a variety of applications. Located in the Greater Pittsburgh area, Nokomis has undergone significant expansion and growth and is looking to add to our technical capabilities.Nokomis is seeking skilled Mechanical engineers to join and compliment our 20+ member R&D team. Successful candidates are driven by technical accomplishments and making a strong impact on the development of advanced technology. This position will focus primarily on core technology for RF sensing and spectral analysis for target detection, cyber security, and other application areas. The position requires strong technical skills and excellent communication skills. Proposal and technical writing skills are strongly desired. This position will have significant opportunities in proposing new R&D efforts and to lead advanced research efforts. Candidates with ambition and drive are highly sought after to join Nokomis as it accelerates its growth in cutting edge research areas.The Mechanical engineer role at Nokomis will help turn revolutionary R&D technologies into prototypes and RF products.Responsibilities and DutiesThe Scientist will be part of the Nokomis R&D team in the design, development, and transition of advanced technologies in challenging and exciting technical areas. The Scientist will be responsible for the design and execution of technical experiments, data analysis, result reporting, and presentation. Technical writing, including proposal applications, are a significant opportunity for the Scientist to direct the course of future work and quickly advance to positions of leadership and greater responsibility.Primary responsibilities include:Design, fabrication and assembly of electronics enclosuresDevelopment of design documentationWorking within a larger R&D team to evolve solutions from concept to realityPatent developmentOperate rapid prototyping equipment and design for manufacturingProvide status updates to team members and supervisors on project progressPerform 3D CAD design for electronics enclosuresAssist and advise with mechanical design on early stage projectsQualifications and SkillsRequired:Master’s Degree or Bachelors Degree (5+ years professional experience preferred)Strong knowledge of principles of mechanical engineering and designCurrency with rapid prototypingDesign for electrical enclosures experienceFluency with 3D CAD/CAM/CAE softwareExpert level hardware/software troubleshooting skillsProficiency with rapid prototyping equipment and methodsAbility to work alone and with teams, handle multiple tasksDesired:Strong knowledge of electrical principlesModeling and simulation material propertiesElectrical and/or antenna design experienceGood electronics lab skills; soldering, rework, building jigs and adaptersJob TypeFull-timeExperienceMaster's Degree OR 5+ years of experience with CAD/CAM/CAE software with a Bachelors Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent fieldEducationBachelors Degree or Master’s Degree (5+ years professional experience preferred)Company Description:Nokomis is a high growth technology company dedicated to providing advanced technical capability for our customers.Over the last decade our team has developed and delivered state-of-the-art uniquely capable sensors and technology solutions.Nokomis is a certified small business with corporate offices located in Charleroi, Pennsylvania. The 50,000 sq ft Charleroi facility is endowed with state-of-the-art scientific, engineering and manufacturing capabilities.Additional locations include an Embedded Systems Division located in Toledo, OH; a Non-Destructive Evaluation Division in McDonald, PA; and a 163 acre test facility in Mather, PA.Job Type: Full-time

Overview:   External Title: RF Engineer Internal Title: Specialist, RF Engineer Location: Melville, NY Salary: $90,000-$125,000   Responsible for solving engineering problems in one or more phases of ongoing long term product development and test/manufacturing support. Involving the analysis, research, design, development, fabrication, and testing of devices or systems. Assignments may be varied and somewhat difficult in character, but usually involve limited responsibility with some evaluation, originality, or ingenuity.  Responsibilities:  Investigate and conduct studies on specifications and requirements of the project. Perform original RF circuit design and analysis. Supply technical assistance and coordination to designers and staff assigned to the project. Provides direction to the Engineering Technician and Associate Engineer while breadboarding, wiring, debugging and testing is being performed. Design and plans wiring layouts and schematics. Plan tests to be conducted and arranges the test setup. Check performance of devices during tests and evaluates the results. Provide technical assistance in the preparation of spare parts lists, special tools, test equipment and other engineering data. Specify the procurement of specialized components and test equipment. May participate in field tests and other travel duties. Assist in preparation of bids and proposals. Use PC-based Computer Aided Engineering (CAE) programs of moderate complexity. Maintain a positive work environment by professional and courteous conduct and communications with others, including supervisors, co-workers, clients, and vendors. Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree Electrical engineering (BSEE) or equivalent Knowledge of Computer-Aided Engineering (CAE) programs preferred. 4+ years of RF Microwave Engineering experience in design, development, analysis and investigation of electronic devices and systems required. Must be familiar: Modeling and Simulating Optimizing new conceptual circuits along with evaluating, testing, tuning, and modifying circuits to meet specifications Amplifier design using both packaged components and bare die Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience writing technical specifications and other technical documents Costpoint, ERP systems, Microsoft Office proficiency BENEFITS: Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Company-provided Life and AD&D Insurance Voluntary Supplemental Life Insurance, STD and LTD Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Tax-deferred 401K with 6% company match PTO and Holidays Employee tuition reimbursement Business casual dress environment Stellant Systems is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status or membership in any other group protected by federal, state or local law. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing and background checks. To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by ITAR (22 CFR §120.15).

PharmEng Technology has been providing quality services to leading manufacturers of healthcare and pharmaceutical products since 1997. Our specialists hold expertise in Commissioning and Qualification, Validation, Quality Systems, Regulatory Affairs, Engineering, and Training to ensure that our clients can keep on providing the world with their cost-effective and high-standard healthcare products. PharmEng Technology aims to create a conducive work environment that fosters empowerment, passion, and perseverance while serving our clients to achieve their unique business goals. Utilizes advanced skills to perform complex preventive maintenance and corrective repair of buildings, industrial systems, vehicles, equipment, and grounds. Working under limited supervision monitors building system operations and performance. Utilizes several trade skills such as carpentry, plumbing, electrical, painting, roofing, heating, and cooling. We are looking for a Manufacturing Engineer to help us implement manufacturing processes that result in high-quality products. You need to have a good knowledge of tool design and fabrication methods. Other necessary manufacturing engineer skills include project management ability, commitment to quality, and familiarity with safety and environmental standards. If you’re also inventive and meticulous, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you’ll be the one to ensure our production lines work efficiently and effectively to satisfy our customers. Responsibilities Evaluate manufacturing processes based on quality criteria, such as efficiency and speed. Study production and machine requirements. Develop and test effective automated and manual systems. Design and install equipment. Organize and manage manufacturing workflows and resources. Integrate disparate systems (e.g. equipment handling, transport). Optimize facility layouts, production lines, machine operations, and network performance. Resolve issues and delays in production. Find ways to reduce costs and maximize quality. Train staff in new and existing processes. Collaborate with other engineers, contractors, and suppliers. Upgrade systems and processes with new technology. Requirements and skills Previous experience as a manufacturing engineer Knowledge of manufacturing processes, fabrication methods, and tool design. Familiarity with manufacturing equipment and quality assurance techniques. Commitment to health and safety standards and environmental regulations. Experience in mechanical engineering Working experience with product lifecycle management (PLM), finite element analysis (FEA) and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) Hands-on experience with computer-aided engineering (CAM) and computer-aided manufacturing (CAE) Well-versed in relevant software (e.g. CAD, MS Office), Project management skills. Problem-solving ability. Teamwork skills. Degree in Engineering

Mission-Driven. Honor-Bound. Fairbanks Morse Defense. What’s your calling? For the men and women of Fairbanks Morse Defense it’s the rapid and effective support of the fleets that entrust us to design, develop, and deliver the best naval power technology on the planet. We’re one of the nation’s leading marine defense contractors because of the highly trained and dedicated teams that provide reliable power systems, parts, and aftermarket services to the U.S. Navy, Coast Guard, Military Sealift Command, and Canadian Coast Guard. When you join Fairbanks Morse Defense, you join a legacy of commitment that spans 150 years. Fairbanks Morse Defense offers competitive benefits with a wide range of training and development opportunities. Our world-class teams are dedicated to helping every individual achieve their full potential. Discover what it’s like to be a part of the Fairbanks Morse Defense team here: https://www.fairbanksmorsedefense.com/careers  Position Summary The Analytical Engineer will utilize hand calculations, computer aided engineering (CAE) software packages, and internally developed calculation tools to analyze medium speed diesel engine systems, components, and associated hardware to solve problems related to hardware design, failure investigations, concept evaluations, etc. Principle Duties and Responsibilities Write clear and concise reports documenting analyses and tests from objective, references, and methodology through results and conclusions. Reports may be subject to review and approval by external customers and third parties.Perform analysesSimplified hand calculations for concept evaluations, design guidance, etc.MIL-DTL-901 Shock and MIL-STD-167 Vibration qualification and extensionTorsional vibration (including forced response) of engine drivetrains to determine critical speeds and meet customer requirementsEngine troubleshooting using vibration analysis and other methodsFailure analysis, root cause analysis, and general problem solving using structured methodsStatic and dynamic FEA for stress, strain, etcOther engineering analyses as requiredWrite test procedures, participate in test fixture design, and perform or witness testing to validate analysis results.Help coordinate analysis projects executed outside of FMD. Evaluate results for validity.Build and maintain centrally located analysis reports and models (from both internal and external sources).Standardize and coordinate application of best-practice analysis guidelines Qualifications, Skills and Educational Requirements BSME with 3 years of experience in an engineering analysis role or MSME graduate. Related engineering fields will be considered. Emphasis in dynamics and vibration strongly desired.Understanding of complex mechanical engineering systems and components, experience with engine design or development is desiredCreative thinking, highly motivated, and the ability to work both independently and as a member of a team is a mustExcellent organizational, interpersonal, and written/verbal communication skillsExperience working with 3D modeling design tools (SolidWorks preferred)Stress analysis experience using hand calculations and FEA (ANSYS preferred)MathCAD, MATLAB, and/or Maple experience is beneficialExperience in solving problems in solid mechanics, dynamics, and/or thermal-fluids systemsThis position requires access or potential access to Unclassified Naval Nuclear Propulsion Information, which is Not Releasable to Foreign Nationals (NOFORN) data. Therefore, to meet NOFORN requirement, you will have to provide proof of US Citizenship and attest that you do not have dual citizenship. Acceptable proof of US Citizenship is a US Passport, US Birth Certificate or Naturalization CertificateTravel: 5% Language: English  Fairbanks Morse Defense offers a competitive benefits package including but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurances, and 401k retirement plan with employer match. In addition, we offer paid time off, paid holidays, paid parental leave, and tuition reimbursement.  Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

About Canoo:     Canoo’s mission is to bring EVs to Everyone and build a world-class team to deploy this sustainable mobility revolution. We have developed breakthrough electric vehicles that are reinventing the automotive landscape with pioneering technologies, award-winning designs, and a unique business model that spans all owners in the full lifecycle of the vehicle. Canoo is starting production and is distinguished by its pioneering and experienced team of technologists, engineers, and designers. With offices around the country, the company is scaling quickly and seeking candidates who love to challenge themselves, are motivated by purpose, and possess a strong desire to get things done.  The “Canoo Way” Canoo’s success is the direct result of our disciplined application of our core operating principles and drills, which are based on three main principles: Think 80/20 (“Important versus less important”), Act 30/30 (“Reduce waste and increase output”), and Live 90/10 (“We have each other’s back”). We hire based on “MET” - Mindset, Equipment, and willingness to Train - and seek individuals that take accountability and deliver results while being Humble, Hungry to succeed, and Hunting for opportunities to win. We train our team to engage with each other by modulating between their intellect (iQ) and emotional intelligence (eQ), applying Facts, Finesse, and Force when they communicate. The principles and drills of the CANOO Way have been fundamental to our success, our ability to grow, continuously improve, and innovate are at the core of our day-to-day operations.  Overview:     The EMC/EMI Engineer will be responsible for the successful Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC) validation of assigned programs. This entails working in concert with other engineering and developments teams within Canoo as well as directly with customer teams, in all stages of development from the early design through final validation testing.  Responsibilities:   Responsibilities (80s of the Position) Work with development teams to provide direction on design for EMC issues at the PCB and system/vehicle levels. Own and create system and vehicle level test plans for validating the product for EMC compliance. Supervise and perform EMC tests to determine compliance to domestic and international regulatory standards. Select suppliers of EMC testing and manage the relationship between Canoo and the supplier ensuring quality results, value for money and timely execution. Analyze results and perform diagnosis of problems and recommend solutions. Coach and educate hardware teams internally on the significance of EMC, the current test methods, regulations and the criteria and targets that need to be met. Support the investigation and resolution of EMC related issues assuming the role of subject matter expert. Develop models for interference coupling mechanisms, shielding integrity, and circuit/cable interface isolation to mitigate and control conducted/radiated emissions and susceptibility stimuli. Own the EMC capital investment strategy and ultimately of construction of internal EMC testing facilities and capabilities. Deliver EMC performance status to cross functional leadership on a regular cadence. Participate in product engineering team meetings to ensure consistency and technical issues are identified and resolved. Write detailed test reports recording subjective and objective findings and any issues through JIRA. Manage all open Concerns discovered on test with the responsible Design Engineers until a design countermeasure is achieved and plan for validation by retest, CAE simulation, or other means to close out open concerns. Manage critical path timing of multiple tests to ensure completion on time and within budget. Candidate should be able to prioritize tasks effectively and handle various tasks at the same time. Must be "team oriented" with excellent communication skills.   #LI-MS2  Qualifications:   Required Experience: BS in Electrical Engineering with Electronics Design, Electromagnetics’, or RF/Wireless projects. 5+ years of experience in EMC validation of electronic components, systems, and vehicles. A clear understanding of EMC standards and regulations. Experience of utilizing essential test equipment, such as Spectrum/Network Analyzers, Oscilloscopes, etc. as well as experience outsourcing test activities to 3rd party suppliers. Familiar with EMC standards for EMC testing on emissions and immunity such as CISPR25, ISO-11452-2, -4, ISO-7637-2, -3, ISO-10605, IEC 61000-4-2, -3, -4, -6. Experience using software tools for that will ultimately manage complex test programs and report findings cross functionally - Office Suite, JIRA, etc. Experienced in troubleshooting and root cause analysis. Broad knowledge of creating and executing DVP&R’s. Preferred Experience: Experience working at various test labs and facilities with broad test industry contacts. Proven ability to identify and solve complex engineering problems. Excellent oral and written communication skills, displays a high level of maturity, ability to work as a member of a small nimble team, ability to work in a self-directed manner. Travel Requirements: Ability to travel domestically and internationally up to 20% of the time. Physical Requirements: While performing the duties of this job, employees may be required to sit for prolonged periods of time, occasionally bending or stooping, lifting up to 10 pounds, and prolonged periods of computer use.  Reasonable Accommodations: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position. What's Cool About Working Here...:  Meaningful, challenging work that will redefine the automotive landscape and make EVs available to everyone Comprehensive Health Insurance Equity Compensation Flexible Paid Time Off Casual workplace with an unbelievable feeling of energy Canoo is an equal opportunity-affirmative action employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, past or present military service or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles submitted in response to our job posting shall be considered the property of Canoo Inc. and its subsidiaries and are not subject to payment of referral or placement fees if any such candidate is later hired by Canoo unless you have a signed written agreement in place with us which covers the applicable job posting. Canoo maintains compliance with the OFCCP. As such, please feel free to review the following information:  https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters  https://www.dol.gov/agencies/olms/poster/labor-rights-federal-contractors  If you are a person with a disability needing assistance with the application process, please call (214) 529-8055 or email us at talentacquisitionteam@canoo.com    Equal Employment Opportunity Posters    Equal Employment Opportunity Posters | U.S. Department of Labor (dol.gov)

Job Summary The Senior Battery Electrical Engineer is responsible for the design, development and execution of core battery electrical system components and assemblies. They are responsible for defining, documenting, designing, and releasing critical electrical systems and interfaces within the battery pack (e.g., cell interconnections & sensing circuitry, high voltage/high current interfaces) and overseeing validation of those components and assemblies. This role is release responsible for the Battery management System (BMS) Hardware. The Senior Battery Electrical Engineer is comfortable applying technical knowledge to innovative designs, driving resolution of challenges, and taking ownership of new product development activities. ResponsibilitiesApply technical knowledge to the on-time delivery of work products through the product development life cycle for each project.Own the design & development of efficient designs for components & sub-assemblies.Work in concert with manufacturing engineers in the development of processes & tools supporting manufacture and assembly.Component definition, sizing, selection, and design of cell electrical interconnections & bussing, module and pack high current and high voltage electrical interconnections & bussing, fusing, sensing, and control circuitry.Commodity responsible engineer for Battery Management System (BMS) Hardware and interfaces to relevant battery subsystems.Work closely with Systems Engineers and CAE Engineers to prove out design concepts prior to pack prototype builds.Act as a mentor and advisor to Design Release Engineers (DREs) on the team.Key contributor to electrical system DFMEAs/PFMEAs, DVP&Rs and Product & Process design reviews.Lead supplier evaluation and development for responsible commodities, in collaboration with purchasing.Support prototype system builds by ensuring parts are on time and that issues are resolved in a timely manner.Other duties as assigned.Predictable and reliable attendance. Position QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent degree.Minimum of five (5) years of experience in high voltage (>350V) electrification product design or product development.Proficient in root cause analysis and resolution.Adept in data processing and statistical analysis.Effective communicator, capable of concisely presenting highly technical data to internal & external customers, as well as effectively communicating with suppliers.Experience with PCBA HW / ECU development and troubleshooting, BMS specific experience preferred. Demonstrated understanding of the system operating principles and software functions of said ECU(s) to be an effective interface to Systems and Software Engineering counterparts.Experienced with the design, handling, and manufacture of high voltage lithium-ion battery systems.Knowledge of EMC/EMI design standards and ability to interpret and troubleshoot test results.Educated on common automotive & industry standards.Familiar with the product design process.Self-motivated problem solver; pays attention to the details.Challenges the status quo and strives for continuous improvement.Abides by safety standards and protocols. Key CompetenciesMission, Vision, Values & Strategy: Understands and actively supports the organization’s mission, vision, values and strategic priorities.Decision Making & Analysis: Makes sound decisions based upon a mixture of data-driven analysis, expertise, experience, and judgment; collects relevant information, seeks input from others, and identifies connections and/or root causes of problems.Takes Initiative: Exhibits strong drive for results and success; conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure; persists despite obstacles and opposition.Continual Improvement: Displays a consistent orientation toward producing the highest quality products or services, while keeping a focus on sustainability. Constantly looking for incremental improvements in work processes and results.Delivers Results: Achievement oriented, feeling a sense of urgency to reach goals on time, if not before.Assertiveness: Exhibits a penchant for maintaining a position when you know you are right without fear or seeking approval and without engaging in unnecessary aggression.

CAE Engineer - Finite Elemental Analysis: Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer - Seat Complete
column7: About Rivian:     Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.  Role Summary:     You will be responsible for the design and development of Complete Seats Systems for the most adventurous vehicles on the planet! You will also deliver break-through technology and capability in our products.  Responsibilities:  Be an integral member a technical team of product engineers to deliver Complete Seats for all Rivian programs Develop and implement the latest technologies in materials, processes and design execution Utilize CAE toolsets to define/optimize and verify product designs prior to physical prototype. Validate seating systems through the creation and testing of the DVP&R, DFMEA, GD&T, Functional Safety, statement of requirements (SOR) and component technical specifications (CTS) Support Purchasing in creating nomination plans, RASIC, deliverables, and service agreements for suppliers of seating systems & components and then manage suppliers from nomination to PPAP and through SOP Conduct supplier meetings to ensure product design integrity and conformance to the statement of the requirements and all technical requirements, responsible for design releases/signoff Provide technical expertise for seating systems when working in cross functional teams of body, studio, restraints, LVE, and packaging Coordinate design work to deliver timely releases that meet all design for manufacturing inputs from the supply base & manufacturing team. Develop and manage system, subsystem, and component information through the Enovia PLM to Catia V6 environment Have the opportunity to develop personally to become a leader professionally Qualifications:  Bachelors of Science in an engineering discipline (Masters degree is a plus) 5+ years of first hand experience developing, validating, and launching into production seating systems High proficiency with standard 3D CAD software, preferably CATIA V5 and/or V6 Strong understanding of the first-principle physics & requirements of seat systems – the loads, forces, and overall function of the systems System approach to design and development with the desire and curiosity to strive for continuous improvement Excellent understanding of GD&T standards Understanding of FE analysis technique to drive design and its optimization is essential Ability to conduct & drive the DFMEA process Eagerness to work cross-functionally in a dynamic environment where you are part of a team Pay Disclosure:     Salary Range for California-Based Applicants: $121,000 - $139,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, and other factors permitted by law).  Benefits Summary: Rivian provides robust medical/Rx, dental and vision insurance packages for full-time employees, their spouse or domestic partner, and children up to age 26. Coverage is effective on the first day of employment, and Rivian covers most of the premium  Company Statements:  Equal Opportunity   Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.  Candidate Data Privacy   Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.  Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.  Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions.  Please note that we are currently not accepting applications from third party application services.

Job Summary The Senior Battery Electrical Engineer is responsible for the design, development and execution of core battery electrical system components and assemblies. They are responsible for defining, documenting, designing, and releasing critical electrical systems and interfaces within the battery pack (e.g., cell interconnections & sensing circuitry, high voltage/high current interfaces) and overseeing validation of those components and assemblies. This role is release responsible for the Battery management System (BMS) Hardware. The Senior Battery Electrical Engineer is comfortable applying technical knowledge to innovative designs, driving resolution of challenges, and taking ownership of new product development activities. Responsibilities Apply technical knowledge to the on-time delivery of work products through the product development life cycle for each project. Own the design & development of efficient designs for components & sub-assemblies. Work in concert with manufacturing engineers in the development of processes & tools supporting manufacture and assembly. Component definition, sizing, selection, and design of cell electrical interconnections & bussing, module and pack high current and high voltage electrical interconnections & bussing, fusing, sensing, and control circuitry. Commodity responsible engineer for Battery Management System (BMS) Hardware and interfaces to relevant battery subsystems. Work closely with Systems Engineers and CAE Engineers to prove out design concepts prior to pack prototype builds. Act as a mentor and advisor to Design Release Engineers (DREs) on the team. Key contributor to electrical system DFMEAs/PFMEAs, DVP&Rs and Product & Process design reviews. Lead supplier evaluation and development for responsible commodities, in collaboration with purchasing. Support prototype system builds by ensuring parts are on time and that issues are resolved in a timely manner. Other duties as assigned. Predictable and reliable attendance. Position Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent degree. Minimum of five (5) years of experience in high voltage (>350V) electrification product design or product development. Proficient in root cause analysis and resolution. Adept in data processing and statistical analysis. Effective communicator, capable of concisely presenting highly technical data to internal & external customers, as well as effectively communicating with suppliers. Experience with PCBA HW / ECU development and troubleshooting, BMS specific experience preferred. Demonstrated understanding of the system operating principles and software functions of said ECU(s) to be an effective interface to Systems and Software Engineering counterparts. Experienced with the design, handling, and manufacture of high voltage lithium-ion battery systems. Knowledge of EMC/EMI design standards and ability to interpret and troubleshoot test results. Educated on common automotive & industry standards. Familiar with the product design process. Self-motivated problem solver; pays attention to the details. Challenges the status quo and strives for continuous improvement. Abides by safety standards and protocols. Key Competencies Mission, Vision, Values & Strategy: Understands and actively supports the organization’s mission, vision, values and strategic priorities. Decision Making & Analysis: Makes sound decisions based upon a mixture of data-driven analysis, expertise, experience, and judgment; collects relevant information, seeks input from others, and identifies connections and/or root causes of problems. Takes Initiative: Exhibits strong drive for results and success; conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure; persists despite obstacles and opposition. Continual Improvement: Displays a consistent orientation toward producing the highest quality products or services, while keeping a focus on sustainability. Constantly looking for incremental improvements in work processes and results. Delivers Results: Achievement oriented, feeling a sense of urgency to reach goals on time, if not before. Assertiveness: Exhibits a penchant for maintaining a position when you know you are right without fear or seeking approval and without engaging in unnecessary aggression. Physical Requirements / Working Conditions The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment. Ability to adjust focus, especially due to concentration on a computer screen. Must be able to maintain attention for long periods of time. Occasionally move about in industrial environments, and on uneven terrain. Works in a temperature-controlled office environment, with occasional work in outdoor weather conditions, and in industrial environments. The noise level in the work environment can be moderately loud. Why Join Us American Battery Solutions (ABS) provides comprehensive benefit plan options at no cost, competitive salary, and equity eligibility to all associates. ABS is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace Benefits Overview Paid time off includes 4 weeks, 15 holidays, and parental leave. 100% company-paid medical, dental, vision, short-term disability, long-term disability life insurance. Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA) offerings. Company provided 401K savings plan with matching contributions to help you save for retirement. Voluntary benefits offerings. Tuition assistance. Employee Referral program. Employee development and career growth opportunities. About Us At American Battery Solutions (ABS) we are developing the next generation of battery energy storage systems that will power the vehicles of today and tomorrow! Our team works with the latest technologies and battery chemistries engineering, testing, and manufacturing batteries to power the world’s electric propulsion transition. At ABS you may get a chance to work on a project for an autonomous warehouse robot or an autonomous lawnmower, or you may work on a battery for a fleet of delivery vehicles or a transit bus, or even an EV start-up or a massive grid energy storage system. Our team is led by some of the industry’s most experienced professionals, but we pride ourselves on developing a diverse team of next-generation battery experts. The Location - Lake Orion American Battery Solutions Headquarters and Innovation Center is located in the heart of South-East Michigan in Orion Township. Orion Township is a Pure Michigan Trail Town that has a long-standing dedication to enhancing trails and pathways in its community, which is home to the Polly Ann Trail, Paint Creek Trail, and Iron Belle Trail. The township boasts more than 50 miles of trails. Southeast Michigan also boasts some of the best eating around! Whether your interest is in furthering your education, enjoying one of the many regional sporting events, or enjoying the vast outdoors that Michigan has to offer, you’ll be at the center of it here! AMERICAN BATTERY SOLUTIONS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

Dana is a global leader in the supply of highly engineered driveline, sealing, and thermal-management technologies that improve the efficiency and performance of vehicles with both conventional and alternative-energy powertrains. Serving three primary markets – passenger vehicle, commercial truck, and off-highway equipment – Dana provides the world's original-equipment manufacturers and the aftermarket with local product and service support through a network of nearly 100 engineering, manufacturing, and distribution facilities. Job Purpose Assist in all phases of customer BEV programs / projects from customer RFQ to production launch. Facilitate internal communications between Engineering, Sales, Quality, Manufacturing and Assembly for specific programs / projects (voice of customer within the Dana organization). Perform Dana product application & performance analysis for new customer programs Lead in determining and specifying the best vehicle architecture configurations to meet customer vehicle requirements Lead in packaging Dana BEV sub-systems & components into customer chassis. Complete engineering/design requirements/definition for offshore design group. Benchmarking of competitive BEVs and components/sub-systems. Complete customer program PDS, BOM, DFMEA, DVP, ED&T, and support RFQ response. Lead and provide hands-on support of special vehicle builds as well as coordination of special orders. Support Advanced Program Quality Planning and Design Review activities. Develop and lead implementation of BEV component cost savings and assembly process improvement proposals. Attend/facilitate/host customer engineering meetings and help bring open issues to closure. Provide BEV expertise in support of the customer's requirements. Engage with customer engineering community, representing Dana in a positive, ethical, and professional manner. Qualifications Desired: Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering (BSME) preferred. Consideration may be given to candidates with other engineering degrees such as manufacturing, industrial or aeronautical with strong experience in product design. 5+ years’ experience in design or manufacture of driveshaft components and assemblies for automotive industry. Experience in drivetrain/powertrain/chassis engineering or related field is a plus Experience with battery electric vehicles and/or components a plus Basic CAD, CAE, and dimensional stack-up skills Excellent mechanical aptitude, along with strong analytical capability. Understanding of engineering prints and specifications. Must have excellent interpersonal skills to work with people at all levels within Dana and customers in a professional manner. Ability to develop strong customer relationships Strong project management/follow-up skills in order to organize multiple responsibilities and meet multiple deadlines. Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills. Knowledge of automotive quality standards including APQP, DVP&R, 8D, PPAP,VE/VA, & FMEA Must be self-directed and motivated individual who is willing to accept responsibility. Willing and able to work excess hours when necessary. Must be able and willing to travel domestically and internationally. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters Please note that as per Dana policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters were engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that Dana will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.

Description       The University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) Engineering and Technology Development (EITD) department https://www.uab.edu/engineering/eitd/ is seeking a Project Engineer to join our team. This position will provide the opportunity to work as part of a multi-discipline engineering team that specializes in the development of cold stowage systems for use in microgravity and space exploration. The systems developed by our team provide researchers with a means of preserving experiments in a thermally controlled environment onboard the International Space Station, as well as onboard launch and landing vehicles.      Duties and Responsibilities:       Primary responsibilities will include developing viable mechanical or electrical systems and component designs based on project requirements and specifications. Produces and supervises the associated engineering drawings and schematics for use in the fabrication and assembly of complex engineering hardware and devices. Reviews and checks engineering drawings produced by others for adherence to technical specifications and requirements. Works with CAE (Computer-Aided Engineering) (SolidEdge and/or ProE) Mechanical design software or OrCAD electrical design software. Demonstrates design experience with high-reliability instruments and works closely with engineers of other disciplines to develop systems.              Other responsibilities will include general support for the multi-disciplinary engineering team, in areas such as reviewing and checking engineering drawings produced by others for adherence to technical specifications and requirements.             Supervises/mentors less experienced engineers and student employees on projects.             Perform other duties as assigned.      ($77,640 - $126,170)  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering and six (6) years of related experience required. Work experience may NOT substitute for education requirement. STEM related degree preferred and U.S. Citizenship is required.  Primary Location: University     Job Category: Professional & Managerial     Organization: 440002000 Engineering & Innovative Tech Develop     Employee Status: Regular     Shift: Day/1st Shift     Work Arrangement (final schedule to be determined by the department/hiring manager): Onsite

Intercax’s mission is to innovate software that fundamentally advances computer-based modeling, integration, and analyses of complex systems. Our technology is helping transition the industry from disconnected engineering silos to an integrated model-based engineering environment backed by enterprise-scale and secure digital threads. From spacecraft and avionics to automotive, energy, healthcare, and manufacturing, our digital thread technology is paving the future of digital engineering. Intercax is opening a new position – Digital Thread Applications Engineer – with the following specifics. Location (1) Candidate must be a US citizen or US Permanent Resident (2) Fully remote, work anywhere in the US, occasional travel to user meetings and conferences Roles and Responsibilities (1) Build and demonstrate live digital threads in multiple industry domains – aerospace, automotive, energy, biomedical/healthcare, marine, mechatronics, manufacturing, and cybersecurity. (2) Integrate data/models from multiple disciplines, such as below, to build real and live digital threads.SysML/UAF/UML modeling tools, including SysML v2Requirements management toolsHardware design and development, such as PLM, CAD/CAE systemsSoftware design and development, such as ALM, Software Version Control, and IDE systemsAnalysis and Simulation environmentsVerification and Test management systemsReal-time Data Streams and DatabasesData Science and Notebook platforms(3) Demonstrate digital thread methodologies and applications to end-users (4) Provide technical support via our helpdesk, and gather end-user stories and challenges to help improve our products. (5) Work closely with our software architecture and development team to provide test models and challenge scenarios, test the latest builds, and provide feedback on improving the usability and quality of our products. (6) Develop whitepapers, blogs, and presentations showcasing live digital threads in multiple industry verticals. Publish on our company blog site, present directly to customers in-person or via web conferences, and at international conferences and workshops. Qualifications and Skills (1) Bachelors (BS/BE/BTech) or Masters (MS/ME/MTech) degree in engineering such as mechanical engineering, electronics/electrical engineering, computer engineering, robotics, manufacturing, or industrial engineering from a reputed university. (2) 3-5 years of experience building and executing models in engineering tools related to Systems Modeling, PLM, CAD/CAE, Simulation, Verification/Test, Software Development, or Requirements management. Candidates must have an experience in at least three (3) areas listed above. (3) 2-3 years of experience working directly with customers and delivering project work, such as software, engineering models, reports, and whitepapers. (4) Excellent written and oral communication skills. Provide examples of conference papers, presentations, blogs, and other articles you have authored. (5) Excellent problem-solving and analytical thinking skills that can take on the toughest challenges and carve solutions. An aptitude and eagerness to learn new technologies and improve skill sets are essential for this position. (6) An attitude to genuinely help people, to work patiently with them, and be their superhero. Team and Opportunity (1) Opportunity to work with leading global organizations in aerospace, automotive, transportation, healthcare, manufacturing, electronics, and other verticals. (2) Fully remote. Focus your creative energies on work rather than commuting. (3) Fast-paced environment with a global team of experts to help you learn new technologies. (4) Excellent compensation package. (5) Regular working hours (US ET) for work-life balance. (6) Opportunities to travel to conferences/events to present your work, meet customers, and represent the company. To Apply Email your resume to jobs@intercax.com with the following details. (1) The subject of the email should be in the following format “Digital Thread Applications Engineer – <Your Full Name>”, e.g. Digital Thread Applications Engineer – Jane Doe. (2) The body of the email should contain a short paragraph (<10 lines) stating why you are a great fit for this position (3) Don’t forget to attach your resume/CV as a PDF. (4) Include links to conference presentations/papers, technical articles, blog posts, or Git repositories in your resume showcasing your applications engineering expertise. Learn more To learn more about Intercax and Syndeia, our digital thread platform for model-based engineering, visit: (1) www.intercax.com (2) www.syndeia.com (3) Blog – https://intercax.com/blog (4) YouTube – https://www.youtube.com/@Intercax

We’ve got what you’re looking for.  Job Description: Parsons is looking for an amazingly talented Electrical Engineer to join our team! What You'll Be Doing: Performs a variety of engineering tasks by applying standard engineering techniques and analyses within a discipline. Completes a variety of assignments such as drawings, specifications, and other materials suitable for procurement and construction purposes, utilizing CAE/CAD as applicable. Prepares standard engineering computations, material quality takeoffs, estimates, surveys, and designs. Prepares detailed requisitions for equipment and materials. Reviews small and portions of larger supplier drawing submittals and assists in performing technical bid analyses. Prepares and issues specifications, data sheets, and other construction documents. What Required Skills You'll Bring: Bachelors degree in Engineering (or related field) and typically 3+ years of related work experience. In addition, an Engineer-in-Training (EIT) Certificate may be required (or other related certifications). What Desired Skills You'll Bring: Able to design drawings in AutoCAD designs with attention to the details Ability to write specifications Ability in working with a design team to develop and satisfy customer and client needs Ability to perform Arc Flash Calculations Good Skills in Low voltage control wiring both 12 and 24 Volt DC and AC power is a plus but not required. Our Federal Solutions segment delivers resources to our US government customers that ensure the success of missions around the globe. CAE Engineer - Finite Elemental Analysis: Defense - Advanced Product Research & Technology – Composite Engineer 3
column7: Overview:     Spirit AeroSystems designs and builds aerostructures for both commercial and defense customers. With headquarters in Wichita, Kansas, Spirit operates sites in the U.S., U.K., France and Malaysia. The company's core products include fuselages, pylons, nacelles and wing components for the world's premier aircraft. Spirit AeroSystems focuses on affordable, innovative composite and aluminum manufacturing solutions to support customers around the globe.  Responsibilities:   Work Location: Wichita, KS Job Summary:   This is an experienced composite engineer job position requires working in a cross-functional team of engineers and analysts to develop materials, manufacturing processes, and designs for cutting-edge development projects, in support of our composite aircraft manufacturing. Using design for manufacturing skills, you will provide manufacturing definition, perform part fabrication, and ensure developmental thermoplastic composite materials and processes are capable of quality, high-rate manufacture.  Key Responsibilities: Conceive new product configurations, designs, manufacturing processes and advanced technologies for new aerostructures. Define and perform research programs to mature concepts, technologies and processes. Define future factory vision, concepts and options. Perform trade studies for design and manufacturing alternatives. Define test plans, conduct testing, and author test reports. Work in concert with key functions to align and advance research plans. Build positive relationships with internal support disciplines, customers and suppliers. Progress concept through initial configuration, prototyping, risk reduction and mature technology readiness. Produce tooling and composite manufacturing definition for test and demonstration articles and implement in a production representative environment. Create plans and evaluations for future work packages, i.e., bid and proposal. Define necessary resources and development plans. Provide support to R&D projects and function as the Principal Investigator if needed. Qualifications:   Requirements: This role requires US Citizenship. Candidates must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance. Works mostly independent with minimal supervision Strong technical knowledge of composite materials, mechanical engineering in an aerospace or similarly regulated environment Function as technical expert for various composite manufacturing including but not limited to autoclave cure, resin infusion, bonding, oven consolidation, stamp forming, and welding areas. Develop test plans, coordinate testing, test reports and author process specifications for both internal and external customers. Excellent oral and written communication skills Preferred Qualifications:  3D CAE/CAM of composite structures Experience with the processing of thermoplastic based continuous carbon fiber composites, especially stamp forming and welding processes Experience with mechanical testing of composites Educational Requirements: BS or MS Degree in mechanical, aerospace or materials science engineering from an ABET accredited institution For Bachelors, 5 – 8 years of professional experience within aerospace industry For Masters, 3 – 6 years of professional experience within aerospace industry Spirit AeroSystems is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law.  Kansas Tax Credit: Join Spirit AeroSystems’ Kansas team and you may be eligible for a $5,000 state of Kansas Aviation tax credit for up to five years. Click here for more information on the tax credit.

Microsoft Outlook, etc. Knowledge of electrical manufacturing processes Knowledge of raw materials, production, and other related processes Education and Experience: The Mechanical Engineer position Engineer (other related experience like consultancy, QA/QC, Estimating, Quantity Surveying, Designing, Piping, Power Plant, Onshore, Offshore, Oil & Gas may NOT be considered). Additionally, having experience in Federal Construction Contract is a plus. GPSI is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At Intramotev, we are building self-propelled railcars and vehicles to change the paradigm in freight logistics. We're providing the rail industry tools that will make the 200 year old industry competitive for the next 200 years. By helping us make rail competitive with trucking, you can contribute to work that matters in solving big societal problems like reducing emissions, improving safety, and minimizing road congestion. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.EV Drivetrain and Battery EngineerAs a member of the Electric Drivetrain Engineering team, you will play an active role in development of the company's battery systems for self-propelled freight railcars, addressing challenging requirements for durability and longevity. This position is in-person and requires the candidate to be onsite in St. Louis, MO.This position involves working in a dynamic team environment on small (1-2) to medium (3-6) person projects where excellent interpersonal and communication skills are needed. Due to the research nature of the work, project objectives and requirements are likely to evolve over the course of the role. A small amount of domestic travel to support integration, demonstration and customer engagement may be required.Build an exciting career with us, as together we develop the next generation of rail, rapidly connecting the past and the future to make a faster and more environmentally friendly rail connected world.Position ResponsibilitiesExecute conceptual and detailed design tasks related to mechanical elements of the powertrain/drivetrain systemMechanical and electrical design and development of battery components, including but not limited to battery modules, current collectors/busbars, coolant systems, disconnect module, etcDesign components for manufacturing using high-volume processesComponent analysis (Finite Element Analysis (FEA) / Computer-Aided Engineering (CAE) / provided)Understanding of design for high-volume manufacturing processesExperience with 3D modeling software and GD&TElectric Vehicle (EV) experience strongly desirablePreferred Qualifications teams and collaborating with other engineering disciplines.Typical Education and Experience:Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor or higher) and typically 3 or more years' related work experience.Relocation:This position offers a competitive relocation package for qualified candidates.Vaccination Requirements:Intramotev does not currently (HYG), a world-class manufacturer of industrial lift trucks, has an outstanding opportunity for an exceptional and talented Electrical Engineer at our facility located in Greenville, NC.As an Electrical Engineer, you will work on the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, provide product design documentation through the creation of detail drawings, engineering lists and Engineering Change Notices (ECN) and integrate manufacturing input into the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, and may participate in the support of manufacturing activities such as Pilot or 1st Production.As an Electrical Engineer you will also create product design documentation – such as CAE (computer aided engineering), 3-d models, detail drawings, engineering lists, reports, test plans and software coding – to support release of Change Orders describing component design revisions. You will translate truck-level and system-level requirements to component requirements and plan and support development testing to ensure design robustness to requirements. integrate Manufacturing/Purchasing input basic designThe Engineer IV will also provide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productThe Engineer IV will also provide leadership and guidance to individuals and project teams to ensure project deliverables are metHR administration and local project supervisionThe Engineer IV will also provide design/test input to project proposals, research for future product projects and develop design and evaluation concepts which enable program and project decisionsAdditionally, the Engineer IV will devise plans for component strategy creation that take advantage of unapparent opportunities given technology advances aligned with corporate visionMinimum Qualifications:B.S., Engineering discipline, requiredOne-Five years industry experience. Position: Mechanical EngineerBig Metal Additive (BMA) is an engineering and manufacturing company. We produce high value customized metal components for our space, aerospace, maritime, energy and industrial customers. We provide value added engineering services with these products. BMA has captured and executed engineering development projects for pressure vessels, cryogenic tanks, satellite chassis components, air vehicle components and other products. We are now in a phase of production readiness for several products which require strict compliance with material standards, process standards, performance requirements, inspection requirements and adherence to our Quality Management System.We are looking for a professional Mechanical Engineer experienced with CAD, CAM and CAE software and metal product manufacturing operations. We produce large metal products with CNC controlled additive manufacturing machines and robots. The Mechanical Engineer provides the digital analysis, model adjustments and toolpath work instructions to operate the machines. Experience with CAM for CNC machining is a prerequisite. Working closely with Manufacturing Engineers, Operators and Quality Engineers is considered daily teamwork.Our company culture has a lean business model with hardworking, professional people, and an emphasis on a respectful and pleasant work environment. Our leadership team includes a globally recognized, award winning founder who continues to challenge the team with exciting new opportunities. BMA has recently won a prestigious industry Innovation Award for which we were nominated by a customer.Description:Big Metal Additive is seeking an experienced Mechanical Engineer responsible for product digital design and manufacturing. Customer CAD models are analyzed for producibility, and recommendations are made for adjustments to improve manufacturing. The additive manufacturing process is planned in CAM software, creating toolpaths, and verifying them with simulation. Toolpaths are post processed for a CNC controller and shared with a Manufacturing Engineer; close collaboration on machine operation and performance is a big part of the job. The BMA process uses MIG welding to produce large, sophisticated components – therefore MIG welding experience is helpful to understand the manufacturing process. Weekly assignments include coordinating activities for multiple manufacturing projects and development efforts, prioritizing tasks appropriately to deliver on a range of responsibilities.The Mechanical Engineer shall use CAD software to examine, analyze and manipulate customer digital models. The Mechanical Engineer shall plan toolpaths for the additive manufacturing process using CAM software. The Mechanical Engineer shall simulate the toolpaths in a virtual environment for validation and post process the toolpaths to CNC code. The Mechanical Engineer shall work closely with BMA teammates during the additive manufacturing process to adjust toolpaths, part design or CNC code. Responsibilities include creating and editing production work instructions, accurate daily project documentation, and complying with quality standards and customer requirements.Experience with Siemens NX is highly valued. Experience working in a factory manufacturing environment with Additive Manufacturing or CNC type machines is necessary. Work experience in an AS9100 or API Q1 quality management manufacturing environment is important (ISO9001 may be considered). This position reports to the General Manager and includes frequent cross functional collaboration with other BMA engineers.Good technical writing skills are critical. Effective creation/editing high quality, technical PowerPoint presentations and written reports are essential. Regular documentation of operations, processes, and records are essential. Meeting deadlines on time is imperative.The company values at Big Metal Additive are hard-working, high integrity founded on personal accountability and kind behavior that embodies acceptance of other people. It can be a professionally demanding workplace but for those who match the company values, it is a rewarding place to work.Big Metal Additive (BMA) is committed to manufacturing high-quality metal components that meet or exceed the requirements and expectations of our customers. This will be ensured by having an efficient and reliable Quality Management System in accordance with AS9100D and API Q1. We will actively pursue measurable and continuous improvement of our products, processes, and people. Everyone at BMA is expected and encouraged to be a champion for quality, continuous improvement, and customer satisfaction.Requirements:· US Citizen with BS engineering degree from accredited engineering college· Significant experience CAD, CAM and simulations (NX preferred)· Significant experience with CNC manufacturing operations· Significant experience with business operations software and applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote and Outlook· Experience operating, documenting, and delivering within a Quality Management System manufacturing environment· Experience with engineering MIG welding5+ years’ experience in manufacturing, mechanical, metallurgical, or engineering fields involving complex or high-performance products compliant with quality standards and delivered to customers.Additional Information:Big Metal Additive is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.Job Type: Full-time (40 hours per week minimum)Salary: BOEBenefits:401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Denver, CO 80239: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (required).Work Location: On-site, Denver, CO 80239Job Type: Full-timePay: $70,000.00 - $110,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftWork Location: In person

The Giti Tire Manufacturing (USA) , Ltd. is proud to be the first North American plant and will produce passenger and light truck tires for the replacement and original equipment markets.JOB SUMMARY The Mechanical Engineer is responsible for designing mechanical and electromechanical products and systems by developing and testing specifications and methods. Performs engineering duties in planning and designing tools, engines, machines, and other mechanically functioning equipment. Oversee installation, operation, maintenance, and repair of such equipment. TE Connectivity’s R&D/Product Development Engineering Teams conceive original ideas for new products and introduce them into practice. They are responsible for product development, and qualification from market definition through production and release; assist in the qualification of suppliers for new products to ensure suppliers deliver quality parts, materials, and services for new or improved manufacturing processes; conduct feasibility studies, and testing on new and modified designs; direct and support detailed design, testing, prototype fabrication and manufacturing ramp. The R&D/Product Development Engineering Teams provide all required product documentation including, but not limited to, Solid Models, 2D/3D production drawings, product specifications, and testing requirements. They create and modify detailed drawings and drafting or conceptual models from layouts, rough sketches, or notes and contribute to design modifications to facilitate manufacturing operations or the quality of products. Typical fields of expertise include materials, mechanics and systems, electrical, optics, chemistry, software, automation systems, packaging, testing and measurement, and manufacturing of electrical, mechanical, and electronic components, products, and their integration into systems.Please note: This position may involve working with technical data, technology, software/source code, hardware, or other items (collectively “items) subject to U.S. and non-U.S. export control laws and regulations. Under these regulations, it may be necessary for TE to verify a candidate’s national origin and/or citizenship status to determine whether a U.S. or other government export license is required prior to releasing its technologies to the candidate. If TE determines that TE will require a license or will be prohibited by applicable laws from providing the candidate with items necessary for the performance of this position, then TE expressly reserves the right to either a) make an offer of employment contingent upon TE receiving required export licenses from the appropriate government agency, b) consider the candidate for a different position that is not subject to such restrictions, on whatever terms and conditions TE shall establish in its sole discretion or c) decline to move forward with the candidate’s application.
