CAE Engineer - Finite Elemental Analysis: Target Systems Department Projects Staff Engineer
column7: We Are:    Fermilab is America’s premier laboratory for particle physics and accelerator research, funded by the U.S. Department of Energy. We support discovery science experiments in Illinois and at locations around the world, including deep underground mines in South Dakota and Canada, mountaintops in Arizona and Chile, CERN in Europe and the South Pole.    We are strategic risk takers, innovators, and collaborators. We are engineers, scientists, technicians, administrative professionals. We are over 2,000 employees advancing knowledge for the benefit of humankind. Fermilab has been at the forefront of particle physics for more than 40 years. We build world-leading accelerators and detectors to conduct some of the most advanced particle physics experiments possible. We collect and analyze the data from those experiments with some of the most powerful computers in the world. We conduct this research on a 6,800-acre prairie, 35 miles outside Chicago, a treasure that has been designated a National Environmental Research Park.    The Fermilab Accelerator Division Target Systems Department (TSD) seeks a highly motivated Target Systems Projects Staff Mechanical Engineer candidate. You will be part of a diverse team of talented and dedicated accelerator physicists, engineers, designers, and technicians. This department performs the design, fabrication, operation and upgrade of high-power target systems for ongoing and future accelerator experiments at Fermilab, most notably the Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility (LBNF). The LBNF Project is responsible for building the accelerator and detector facilities for the US flagship neutrino experiment, Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment (DUNE; see lbnf-dune.fnal.gov for more information). The challenging and sophisticated LBNF beamline target system equipment converts the intense proton beam into a focused neutrino beam. The equipment includes targets, magnetic focusing horns, beam windows, beam absorbers, collimators, and beam instrumentation and associated support systems. These devices are operated in a harsh environment subject to beam-induced heating, thermo-structural stresses, magnetic pressure, vibration, radiation, and fatigue. Handling of these critical beamline components requires specialized techniques and equipment design (e.g., remote handling provisions, vision systems). With a variety of levels and types of job responsibilities and assignments, this position offers opportunities in machine design, thermal/mechanical design and analysis, oversight of fabrication, installation, and operation efforts, and project engineering and management. For additional information regarding this position, please contact the hiring manager, Patrick Hurh (hurh@fnal.gov).  You will:  Utilize standard engineering concepts and methods to contribute to the development of LBNF Beamline target components and associated support equipment, oversee fabrication, and help to transition the systems to operation Assist the Target Systems Department Project Engineering Group’s efforts to develop and maintain project resource estimates and schedules, provide project design documents and presentations for reviews, and develop interfaces with other Project efforts Specify and procure complex target system components for the TSD Projects, currently expected to be the LBNF Beamline Project, including fabrication oversight, QA activities, acceptance testing, and developing specifications and assembly and operations procedures Assist with field engineering activities and troubleshoot problems during the installation and commissioning phases of the LBNF beamline Proactively interface with multiple disciplines to integrate target systems with other Project teams and Fermilab organizations, including Conventional Facilities (civil engineering), Accelerator Division electrical and controls engineering, environment safety and health, and accelerator and radiation physics Abide by and responsible for performing all duties in accordance with all environmental, health and safety regulations and practices pertinent to this position Contribute optimally within a diverse workforce and uphold Fermilab’s dedication to equity, diversity, and inclusion   We are looking for:  Bachelor or Master of Science Degree in Mechanical, Aerospace or Nuclear Engineering from an ABET accredited institution and 3+ years of professional engineering experience. Candidates with a less extensive work history will be considered at the appropriate level. Experience in performing mechanical stress, deflection, thermal and fluid system calculations, including application of strength of materials and other design limit criteria Demonstrated CAE experience, including creating 3D models and high tolerance 2D drawings for production, and some familiarity with thermal and structural FEA analyses, data analysis and presentation methods Experience in machine design, including familiarity with remote lifting and positioning systems, alignment systems, and structural supports Experience in preparing and presenting effective design reports, operational procedures, specifications, and technical presentations to team members, management, and sponsors (verbal and written) Experience in design for fabrication including knowledge of machine shop practices and techniques Familiar with developing credible and documented cost, labor, and schedule estimates for complex mechanical engineering projects Familiarity with application of national consensus safety codes and standards (e.g. ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code, ASME B31.3 Process Piping Code, ANSI Steel Construction Manual etc) is a plus Experience with in-the-field assembly, installation, and operations work Experience in the design, assembly, and operation of particle beam target system components and/or accelerator engineering is a plus Experience in performing advanced thermal and structural FEA is a plus Familiarity with project management concepts and methodology is a plus Electro-mechanical experience (including automation and controls) is a plus Physical Activity and Work Conditions   Human Factors: Mental Concentration, Sitting, Tight Work Schedule, Visually Demanding.    Fermilab is an Equal Opportunity Employer and believes a diverse and inclusive environment based on mutual respect is essential to our mission. Fermilab is committed to recruiting and developing the most hardworking people and does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, ethnicity, color, religion, age, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, country of birth, geography/postal code, disability, marital status, parental or gestational status, or other non-merit factor.    REAL-ID Requirement for access to Fermilab Campus   Fermilab and FRA requires all members of the public to produce a REAL-ID, or equivalent, to access the Fermilab Campus for interviews or career events. A list of acceptable forms of ID can be found here:      https://get-connected.fnal.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/REALID-Documents.pdf   If a candidate is selected for an interview but does not possess any of the equivalent documents, we may schedule a virtual interview.

Position Overview:     Navistar has an exciting new opportunity for a Project Engineer – Frames and Assemblies at our headquarters in Lisle, IL. The project engineer will work in Navistar’s Chassis Engineering product development group which is accountable for all design development and system ownership of frame systems across all our commercial vehicles. The systems include frame ladder (long members, cross-members, front end castings, and sheet metal structures, etc.), cab and chassis access steps and step mounting structures, after treatment device covers, battery boxes, fifth wheels, high voltage battery mounting, and fuel tank protective structures for buses.  Duties include design release, CAD modeling, BOM structure, and development of engineering requirements and verification plans for new product development. Also, includes sustaining projects including current product manufacturing issue problem solving. Duties also include assignments on multiple programs to deliver to cost and quality goals utilizing engineering analysis and experience in metal fabrications, castings, and extrusions.  The project engineer – Frames and Assemblies will be required to perform engineering judgment and provide technically sound justifications for those recommendations in a design review environment.  Responsibilities:  Research and Design new products and systems for customer needs Modify existing products or processes to improve vehicle performance using computer-aided design (CAD) and computer-assisted engineering (CAE) Integrate suppliers into design development to create prototypes for Design Validation Develop new options and combinations of features to meet customer needs Provide technical support and information to production plant team to ensure product integrity Maintain production orders by performing containments (interim corrective actions) and releases (permanent corrective actions) The role would also include mentoring junior engineers in the accomplishment of the tasks listed. In addition, the candidate will be expected to participate in the budgeting process by estimating program effort and preparing project plans for assigned work. Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 5 years of experience in product design/development and/or computer science experience   OR  Master’s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 3 years of experience in product design/development and/or computer science experience   OR  PhD in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science Additional Requirements:  Qualified candidates, excluding current Navistar employees, must be legally authorized on an unrestricted basis (US Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident, Refugee or Asylee) to be employed in the United States. Navistar does not anticipate providing employment related work sponsorship for this position (e.g., H-1B status) Desired Skills:  Experience in truck and/or automotive design and development process Experience in design release process Experience in Unigraphics/NX 3D modeling software is a plus Understanding of manufacturing processes such as metal forming, stamping, and casting Structural design experience is a plus MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Project Company Overview:     Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t.  Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts.  With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. Additional information is available at www.Navistar.com.  Accelerating the Impact of Sustainable Mobility:     Visit us at   www.Navistar.com to discover more about our organization  Navistar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.  #ridewithnavistar

OXMAN  OXMAN is a hybrid Design and R&D company that fuses design, technology, and biology to invent multi-scale products and environments. The fusion of disciplines within our work opens previously impossible opportunities within each domain—allowing design to inspire science and science to inspire design.  At OXMAN, we question dominant modes of design that have divorced us from Nature by prioritizing humanity above all else (human-centric design). Although it is design that has caused this rift, we believe that design also offers the greatest opportunity to heal it.  We propose a Nature-centric approach that delivers design solutions by, for, and with the natural world, while advancing humanity. In this pursuit, we reject all forms of segregation and instead call for a radical synergy between human-made and Nature-grown environments.  This approach demands that we design across scales for systems-level impact. We consider every designed construct a whole system of heterogeneous and complex interrelations—not isolated objects—that are intrinsically connected to their environments. In doing so, we open ourselves up to moving beyond mere maintenance toward the advancement of Nature.  Summary  OXMAN is seeking a Mechanical Engineer to join an all-star interdisciplinary team of deep thinkers and brilliant makers. This person demonstrates creativity and originality in problem-solving and problem-seeking, alongside an interest in materials sciences and biological processes. In this position, they will build machines and design new manufacturing and fabrication processes that enable the realization of innovative materials, technologies, prototypes, and products. They will own the mechanical domain within work of various scopes, including both client-specific design projects and longer-term internal research projects.  Successful applicants embody stellar technical skills, hold the capacity to navigate and resolve uncertainty, and demonstrate a unique “language” of biology (wetware) / computing (software) / fabricating (hardware), or a combination thereof. They exemplify a passion for systems-based thinking with a wide range of potential applications for their work; personify an appreciation for engineering, science, and art; and seek synergy between biology and technology in research, practice, and direct industrial utility. Core responsibilities Lead mechanical design at all project stages, from concept development to product fruition Research and develop Nature-centric design solutions to technical problems, grounded in theories and first principles of science and mathematics Translate the team's sketches and ideas into practical design solutions, taking an open-minded, innovative, and process-driven approach Prepare and review drawings, specifications, and models at various levels of polish Develop and conduct tests for system performance and engineering design validation, including design-level calculations, simulations, and analysis Manage engineering assets, including documentation, exchanges, drawings, files, and other vital information related to the projects Maintain knowledge of current technical standards, material systems, and processes Nurture and augment the design vision of OXMAN, upholding core design principles and ensuring the highest and most innovative quality of work Actively collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of engineers, biologists, and designers Engage in design reviews, presentations, and other team development processes, providing constructive and timely feedback, with an emphasis on visual communication of ideas through sketches, models, and renderings Qualifications & competencies Portfolio demonstrating out-of-the-box thinking and stellar taste in design MS or BS degree in mechanical engineering, industrial design, or relevant fields Minimum 4 years of experience in a professional environment Mastery of CAD/CAE software (e.g., AutoCAD, Fusion 360, Solidworks) Proficiency with simulation and analysis tools (e.g., spreadsheets, MATLAB, FEA) Experience with electromechanical hardware (e.g., motors, sensors, PCB assemblies) Experience with manufacturing tools, (e.g., CNC routers, robotic arms, 3D printers) Knowledge of the fundamental physics and environmental interactions that influence design (i.e., thermal, structural, vibration, dynamics) Knowledge of electronics design is a plus Interest in design, biology, architecture, materials science, and/or sustainability is a plus Strong logic, reasoning, and problem-solving skills to identify and evaluate multiple hypotheses, solutions, conclusions, or approaches Strong “maker” mindset and skill set Ability to thrive in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills Excellent independence, self-motivation, organizational skills, and attention to detail Strong commitment to the team; maintains positive working relationships with diverse people, including internal team and external partners Embodies ethics and integrity in all work, respecting both company and broader community policies in all conduct   OXMAN does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristics.  NYC Pay Range: $75,000-$138,000    Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other business and organizational needs.

Important EEO information related to opening in the US     Solvay is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics. Click on the links to read      "The EEO is the Law" poster and the      “EEO is the Law” poster Supplement.    Solvay is a science company whose technologies bring benefits to many aspects of daily life. Our purpose—we bond people, ideas and elements to reinvent progress—is a call to go beyond, to reinvent future forms of progress and create sustainable shared value for all through the power of science. In a world facing an ever-growing population and quest for resources, we aim to be the driving force triggering the next breakthroughs to enable humanity to advance while protecting the planet we all share. We bond with customers and partners to address today and tomorrow’s megatrends. As a global leader in Materials, Chemicals and Solutions, Solvay brings advancements in planes, cars, batteries, smart and medical devices, water and air treatment, to solve critical industrial, social and environmental challenges. You can count on our innovative solutions to contribute to safer, cleaner and more sustainable future.We are looking for: You will be part of our Customer Technical Development function within Solvay Specialty Polymers that provides strong technical expertise and value to our customers by leveraging the entire product portfolio, resources, and know-how of the GBU. We are looking for creative, curious self-starters and leaders interested in non-routine challenges to join the Technical Development team and support thermoplastic applications for automotive in North America. You will be responsible for providing technical application development expertise to customers and will interact with the internal organization (commercial teams, application development team, R&D, Manufacturing, etc.) to develop total customer solutions. We count on you for: As CTD Engineer, you are our customers’ point of contact as expert for technical topics of our products:     In close collaboration with commercial and business development, you will develop new applications and consult on polymer material selection and design (metal to plastic conversion, mold flow and CAE support in collaboration with our Engineering department, etc.) You will provide technical support to our customers on tooling, processing trials, troubleshooting, and testing (thermal, mechanical, rheology, microscopy, etc.) for the final validation of the parts as well as initiate new product developments together with commercial and R&D teams Organize and facilitate technical trainings about polymers, applications and processing to internal and external stakeholders (product trainings, Tech Days,…) You can count on us for: Long-lasting excellent customer relations, self-dependent working, and a variety of tasks in one of the world’s leading chemical companies. Excellent training & development possibilities. You will bring: Education and Experience: Academic degree in engineering, material science or a technical related field Masters and PhD highly desirable (considering recent graduates) 2+ years experience in polymer melt processing such as injection molding, extrusion, compression molding and/or numerical simulation tools is a plus 2+ years experience working with customers. Skills: Technical and analytical skills-set and simultaneously enjoy communicating and networking with people Strong communication skills & customer-focus. English - fluentYou will get: Competitive salary: The U.S. annual base salary range reasonably expected to be paid for this new hire is: $91,000. to $130,000. Since actual compensation packages are based on a variety of factors unique to each candidate, we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted base salary range. Total compensation for this role also includes bonus and/or other incentives. 16 weeks or more of maternity/paternity and co-parenting leave,according to local regulations. Training platform for all employees Free language courses (24 languages available) Free well-being sessions (physical and psychological)Additional information: Location(s): Alpharetta (Georgia, US) - Hybrid work style Availability to travel up to 40% of the time #LI-JM2 #LI-HYBRIDAfter 50 years, we are going back to the Moon... Solvay Materials are making it possible once again for Humans to return to the Moon. Check here our Artemis missions with NASA: we will land the first woman and first person of color on the Moon. Solvay’s purpose is to bond people, ideas and elements to reinvent progress. We can only fulfill this purpose with a diverse workforce that feels respected and appreciated, and has equal opportunities to work, grow and thrive. Our differences, visible or not, are valued. As Solvay seeks to promote unity and not uniformity, we invite you - regardless of background, age, gender, race, national origin, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, ability or identity - to consider a future with us.

Scout Motors Here at Scout Motors, we're carrying forward the heritage of one of the most iconic American vehicles in history. A vehicle dating back to 1960. One that forged the path for future generations of rugged SUVs and will do so once again. But Scout is more than just a brand, it's a legacy steeped in a culture of exploration, caretaking, and hard work. Scout is all about respect. Respect for the environment by developing all-electric vehicles with the capability to get you to any location. Respect for the past and the future by taking an iconic American brand that hasn't been around for a while, electrifying it, digitizing it, and loading it with American innovation. Respect for communities by creating a company that stands for its people and its customers. And respect for both work and play, with vehicles that are equally at home at a camp site, a job site, or on a Tuesday commute. At Scout Motors, we empower our talented, inclusive, and entrepreneurial teams to innovate. What makes a Scout? Someone who is a visionary and a leader, who seeks new paths and shares lessons learned. A knowledgeable doer who collaborates across the company to build better. A go-getter with unrivaled passion. If this sounds like you, we invite you to apply below. What you'll do Become part of an iconic brand that is set to revolutionize the all-electric pick-up truck & rugged SUV marketplace by achieving the following:Responsible for seats design and release of parts for new products, ensuring innovative and optimized solutions for Scout trucks and SUVs.Participate in collaborative design and creation of a simulation environment for testing new body system concepts and ideas related to vehicle handling, safety features, and overall driving experience.Develop prototypes for virtual and physical verification testing, including field testing.Proactively stay attuned to consumer experience and propose system improvements accordingly.Contribute to the design of production facilities for body systems of the Scout trucks & SUVs.Manage resources efficiently including infrastructure, financial, supplier partners and people.Be a key member and decision maker within the technical leadership team and liaison with all Scout functions.Location & Travel Expectations: The responsibilities of this role require attendance at in-person meetings and events occasionally. The role will be based out of a Scout Motors location in Detroit, MI. Applicants should expect that the role may require the ability to convene with Scout colleagues in person and be able to travel to participate in events on behalf of the company from time to time. What you'll bring We expect all Scouts to have integrity, curiosity, resourcefulness, and strive to exhibit a positive attitude, as well as a growth mindset. You'll be comfortable with change and flexible in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. You'll take a collaborative approach to achieve ambitious goals. Here's what else you'll bring:Bachelor's or master's degree in mechanical engineering, systems engineering, engineering management, or a relevant field.5+ years of experience in body electrical and mechanical areas and relevant automotive assignments. Including all three phases of product development (design, test and launch).Skilled in utilizing CATIA for designing and developing detailed parts.Strong technical skills and expertise in seating systems, coupled with a 1st principles approach to problem solving.Familiarity with computer-aided engineering (CAE) or direct experience in this field.An ability to build strong working relationships with people across all organizational levels.What you'll gain The benefits of joining Scout include the chance to build products and a company from the ground up. This is a chance to create something new and lasting – with an iconic brand at its foundation. In addition, Scout provides competitive compensation and benefits to support your physical, mental, and financial wellbeing. Program specifics are detailed in company policies and employee benefit guides, select highlights:Competitive insurance including:    Medical, dental, vision and income protection plans401(k) program with:    An employer match and immediate vestingGenerous Paid Time Off including:    20 days planned PTO, as accrued40 hours of unplanned PTO and 14 company or floating holidays, annuallyUp to 16 weeks of paid parental leave for biological and adoptive parents of all gendersPaid leave for circumstances related to bereavement, jury duty, voting time, or military leaveCorporate Vehicle Program with:    Eligibility to lease up to 2 vehicles at competitive ratesPay Transparency This is a full-time, exempt position, eligible to receive a base salary and to participate in an annual performance bonus program. The salary range listed represents the maximum and minimum starting base pay for this position as of the time of posting. Final salary offered will be determined based on factors including but not limited to the candidate's skills and experience. The annual performance bonus program is preset and not candidate dependent. Initial base salary = $120,000-$140,000 Internal leveling code: IC9 Equal Opportunity Scout is committed to employing a diverse workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, disability, pregnancy, or any other characteristics protected by law. Scout is committed to compliance with all applicable fair employment practice laws.

Saratoga, CAE-Space US – Space Systems Engineering /Full-Time/ On-Site     Ready to make connectivity from space universally accessible, secure and actionable? Then you’ve come to the right place!        E-Space is bridging Earth and space to enable hyper-scaled deployments of space-powered Internet of Things (IoT) solutions and services. We are fundamentally changing the design, economics, manufacturing, coverage limitations and service delivery associated with traditional satellite and terrestrial IoT systems.        By building a highly-advanced low Earth orbit (LEO) space system—with a unique antenna design, highly sustainable spacecraft system and low-cost, small portable end-user devices—we can extend global satellite coverage, capacity and connectivity beyond legacy space services to provide a new kind of IoT platform that lets users sense, track, connect and act on information gathered, anywhere.        We’re intentional, we’re unapologetically curious and we’re 100% committed to saving space, protecting our planet and turning connectivity into actionable intelligence.    What is the role: As a Senior Controls Engineer, you will focus on maintaining and integrating control and estimation algorithms into our satellite’s real-time flight software. You will engage with E-Space hardware and software engineers to capture the required behavior and performance of estimation and control algorithms designed by the Guidance, Navigation and Controls (GNC) team - then integrate, test and operate them as part of our satellites’ mission-critical flight software.        This position will report to the GNC Lead. This position will be based in Saratoga, CA.    What you will do: Design, implement and test control algorithms and software for E-Space satellites Maintain and enhance the E-Space satellite simulator with data and critical analysis Interface with software engineers to integrate controls and estimation software into the flight software stack Own all aspects of controls software development, including auto-coding, testing, hardware-in-the-loop simulations, mission integration and operation Design, improve and follow rigorous software configuration management and code development and integration processes Interact cross-functionally with other subsystem engineers, providing expertise as needed Participate, present and prepare documentation for design reviews What you bring to this role: Bachelor of Science degree +5 years / Master of Science degree + 3 years / PhD in Software, Electronics, Aerospace Engineering, or equivalent, with work experience in relevant fields At least 3+ years of professional experience in software development in C, C++, and Matlab/Simulink Proficient in object-oriented programming methodology and multi-layer system architectures Experience in implementing and testing Kalman filters, linear and non-linear controllers Hands-on experience with building and debugging complex software Familiarity with actuators and sensors for low Earth orbit satellite applications Knowledge of spacecraft dynamics and orbital mechanics Knowledge of software testing procedures and test case design, including experience in designing fault tolerant software Experience with Git and Linux     $100,000 - $220,000 a year    The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position in question, which is based on market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on location, skills and expertise, depth of relevant experience, and other relevant factors. For questions about this, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply for the role and are selected for an interview.     We are redefining how satellites are designed, manufactured and used—so we’re looking for candidates with passion, deep knowledge and direct experience on LEO satellite component development, design and in-orbit activities. If that’s your experience – then we’ll be immediately wow-ed.    Why E-Space is right for you: We want you to make the most of your journey at E-Space. That’s why we support and invest in the physical, emotional and financial well-being of our team members and their families. Some of what you can expect when working at E-Space:    An opportunity to really make a differenceSustainability at our coreFair and honest workplaceInnovative thinking is encouragedCompetitive salariesContinuous learning and developmentHealth and wellness care optionsFinancial solutions for the future Optional legal services (US only)Paid holidaysPaid time off

We're ALTEN Technology USA, an engineering company that provides solutions for engineering, technology, and product development projects. For decades, we've been helping our clients develop products that are changing the world, whether that's by shaping the future of space exploration, saving lives with medical devices that set a new standard of care, or creating the fully autonomous electric taxi of tomorrow. Our team of more than 600 people works across industries including aerospace, medical devices and life sciences, unmanned systems and robotics, automotive OEM and tier 1 suppliers, commercial vehicle, electric vehicles, rail, and more. Our offices across the US have different industry focuses and engage with our clients in different ways, ranging from working on-site at client facilities to performing product development at our delivery centers.ALTEN Group, our parent company, has been a leader in engineering and information technology for more than 30 years. ALTEN Group operates in 30 countries across Europe, North America, Asia, Africa and the Middle East and employs more than 36,000 people, 88% of whom are engineers. The company covers the whole development cycle and offers a choice of service levels, from technology consulting to complete project outsourcing.When you join ALTEN Technology USA, you join a group of people passionate about collaborating to solve some of the world's most technical engineering challenges. Our success is tied to taking care of our employees by building relationships and providing opportunities for mentorship and career growth. We offer comprehensive benefits for all full-time employees, including medical, dental, and vision insurance; a 401(k) plan with employer matching; paid time off (PTO); paid parental leave; and mentorship to help you take your career to the next level. You don't have to take our word for it that we are a great place to work—we were named on the 2023 Top Workplaces list thanks to feedback from our proud employees.Job Description: BS Degree or higher in ME. Minimum of 6+ years of industry experience in using and developing CAE methods. This role will be responsible to create and validate CAE methods and processes related to Optimization of 1D/3D CAE models, Automation of CAE workflows, and robustness (stochastic) processes. Expectations are proficiency with CAE software such as iSight and modeFRONTIER along with experience with various CAE software such as Abaqus, Nastran, StarCCM+, GT-Suite, SimPack, AmeSim, Hypermesh and Ansa are preferred. Also proficient with programming language software such as Matlab, Python, and VBA. Related advanced degree may be substituted for 2 years of experience.

Job Summary:     Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI) is currently searching for an   Electrical Engineer to join the Alvin Submersible Engineering and Operations Group. This is a regular, full-time, exempt position and is eligible for full benefits.  Alvin is the world’s most renowned human occupied submersible, continually operating since its commissioning in 1964. For over five decades, and 5000+ dives Alvin has advanced our understanding of the Earth’s ocean environments, uncovering many significant scientific discoveries along the way. Alvin was recently certified to 6500m and now has the ability to explore over 98% of the ocean floor.  The Alvin Group is currently seeking a highly motivated, technically competent and responsible   Electronics/Electrical Engineer to join our operations team. With supervision, a successful candidate applies electronic/electrical aptitude and acquired knowledge of established procedures to the maintenance, troubleshooting and repair of vehicle related equipment used in the operation and support of the Alvin submersible.  This is a physically demanding position requiring the ability and willingness to spend six-to-eight months per year at sea. The remainder of the year’s workload would be at the institution and may require a local residence. After an initial training period, the position would allow for minimally supervised maintenance on the vehicle, and additional qualifications to perform key submersible support roles. Exceptional candidates will be entered into the Alvin Pilot in Training program with the goal of completing qualifications as Alvin Pilot in Command.   This is an entry-level position designed to encourage the connection and application of academic training to results-orientated projects in support of scientific and research activities. Initially this position will have direct supervision to achieve structured and assigned objectives.  The internal working title for this position is   Engineer I. Essential Functions:     This position requires individuals to possess a strong electrical background, meticulous work habits, superb attention to detail, excellent interpersonal skills, solid work ethic, self-motivation and professionalism, which are hallmarks of Alvin engineering and operations personnel.  Specific tasks include (but not limited to):  Apply and follow written procedures to maintain, test, and repair submersible electronic/electrical systems and equipment associated with the operation of the submersible. Examples include digital and analog circuits, battery components, power supplies, relays and power distribution systems, motors (DC brushless) and controllers, serial data systems and networks, underwater camera and video systems, etc. Preparation and interface of scientific equipment and sensors used with the submersible. Maintenance and repair of fiber-optic components and equipment. Use of electronic test equipment (multi-meters, oscilloscope, fiber-optic testing equipment, etc.) Participate in all phases of the vehicle launch, recovery and surface support activities. Complete the training required to qualify as an Alvin support technician, support swimmer, launch coordinator, and launch system operator and surface coordinator. With a combination of directed training and significant self-study, complete the training program necessary to become a qualified Alvin Pilot Go to sea up to 8 months a year in support of Alvin operations. Applies basic research principles and standard laboratory instrumentation to engineering design effort. Tests designs, calibrates instrumentation, and troubleshoots mechanical/electronic systems. Develops computer code, microprocessor code, and uses CAD, CAE tools. Participates in report writing to document instrumentation developments and tests. Develops basic practical engineering skills to enhance technical competence and versatility NON-ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: As deemed necessary by supervisor Education & Experience:   Engineer I This is an entry level position designed to encourage the connection and application of academic training to results-orientated projects in support of scientific and research activities. Initially this position will have direct supervision to achieve structured and assigned objectives. Characteristic duties:  Applies basic research principles and standard laboratory instrumentation to engineering design effort. Tests designs, calibrates instrumentation, and troubleshoots mechanical/electromechanical systems. Participates in report writing to document instrumentation developments and tests. Develops basic practical engineering skills to enhance technical competence and versatility. Prior experience:   Bachelor's degree in Electrical or Electronics Engineering or other appropriate discipline with minimal work experience, or evidence of an established specialized engineering skill gained through experience in the absence of a formal degree.  3-5 years of applicable experience in electrical/electronic systems maintenance. Alternatively, a BS in Electrical Engineering or similar curriculum with two years of practical experience is preferred At-sea experience desired. ROV, AUV and/or manned submersible experience a plus. Strong aptitude for evaluating and repairing analog and digital electrical and electronic components and systems. Must be capable of analyzing equipment problems using drawings/documentation and schematics in conjunction with test equipment and procedures. Windows and Linux operating system fluency, serial and network communications protocols, embedded processor hardware development, schematic capture and CAD software. Use and evaluation of electrical and electronic test equipment. Basic proficiency in the use of common mechanical tools. Strong aptitude in completing detailed maintenance documentation and reporting. Experience with mechanical, electromechanical and battery systems is a plus. Special Requirements:  Must be a US Citizen and current US passport holder Must be able to acquire a TWIC card Sea duty required Ability to swim with mask/snorkel and dive fins in an open ocean environment Must be able to pass a pilot physical with equivalent standards to the FAA 3rd class pilot physical Physical Requirements:  Physical duties for this position include but are not limited to, ability to lift less than 25 lbs independently, 2-3 times per day; carry 25-50 lbs, 3-4 times per day. Visual abilities to include near, far, peripheral, depth perception, and ability to distinguish basic colors. Ability to ascend/descend a vertical ladder through a 20” diameter hatch opening. Hearing requirements include the ability to hear and respond to instructions, communicate effectively in loud areas (pier/dock, warehouse). Other physical tasks include occasional prolonged standing/walking; use of hands for basic /fine grasping and manipulation, repetitive motion, reaching above and below the shoulders, pushing, pulling, kneeling, bending, twisting, and stooping. Other occupational requirements include talking, traveling, working around others, and with others. Will be exposed to dust or other irritants and electrical/mechanical/power equipment hazards. Physical duties are subject to change. Sea Duty:     May work at least 8 hours per day and, at times in excess of 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Sleep and work hours can deviate from those on land. May be expected to work on watch schedule (such as 8 hours on and 8 hours off or 12 hours on and 8 hours off) for all or part of a cruise or to work as hours are needed to accomplish the planned work. May need to travel during holidays and for long distances to and from foreign ports. May experience rudimentary living and working conditions, with shared and basic living quarters and laboratories. May experience bad or extreme weather conditions, including heavy seas, winter weather or hot, tropical weather. Work on deck may occur in both hot and cold conditions around the clock. Sea conditions will lead to active ship motion. Should be able to climb steep and vertical ladders and able to enter and exit compartments through hatches, doors, and sills. Should be able to carry heavy gear and participate in the loading and unloading of the ship as well as in the activities on deck and in the labs during the cruise. Shipboard environment may include: confined areas, shared sleeping quarters (berths) and bathroom facilities, small and basic berthing, fixed meal times and basic menus. Modest levels of heating, cooling, ventilation, and illumination, limited or no email and internet access and limited off-duty and recreational facilities (library, lounge, movies). May be exposed to potential allergens and irritants, including paint fumes. May experience constant and intermittent loud noises, and slippery and uneven surfaces.

Put a LIFT in Your Career! Hyster-Yale Group, Inc. (HYG), a world-class manufacturer of industrial lift trucks, has an outstanding opportunity for an exceptional and talented Electrical Engineer at our facility located in Greenville, NC.As an Electrical Engineer, you will work on the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, provide product design documentation through the creation of detail drawings, engineering lists and Engineering Change Notices (ECN) and integrate manufacturing input into the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, and may participate in the support of manufacturing activities such as Pilot or 1st Production.As an Electrical Engineer you will also create product design documentation – such as CAE (computer aided engineering), 3-d models, detail drawings, engineering lists, reports, test plans and software coding – to support release of Change Orders describing component design revisions. You will translate truck-level and system-level requirements to component requirements and plan and support development testing to ensure design robustness to requirements. The Engineer IV will interface with component suppliers and internal customers (Platform, Manufacturing, Marketing, Service, etc.) to understand detailed product requirements and develop concepts for system design as well as supervise other engineers/technicians.Key AccountabilitiesDesign and develop components as required for lift truck vehiclesDesign and develop assemblies as required for lift truck vehicles and order prototype partsDesign and develop wire harnessThe Engineer IV will also, evaluate component design and assembly, build prototype vehicles, design and evaluate systems and plan and execute prototype test activitiesProvide design specification documentation as required to manufacture the product such as detail drawings, engineering list structure and ECN writingProvide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productProvide product/process specification documents, detailed drawings/software development, test engineering reports, sales and product information data and test plansDevelop product around the most efficient and cost-effective manufacturing processes, and provide on-site Engineering support during critical Manufacturing activities such as Pilot and 1st Production; integrate Manufacturing/Purchasing input basic designThe Engineer IV will also provide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productThe Engineer IV will also provide leadership and guidance to individuals and project teams to ensure project deliverables are metHR administration and local project supervisionThe Engineer IV will also provide design/test input to project proposals, research for future product projects and develop design and evaluation concepts which enable program and project decisionsAdditionally, the Engineer IV will devise plans for component strategy creation that take advantage of unapparent opportunities given technology advances aligned with corporate visionMinimum Qualifications:B.S., Engineering discipline, requiredOne-Five years industry experience. All skill levels will be considered.Beginner-Master level knowledge/skill in drawing practices, CAD, design layouts, engineering analysisBasic specialized knowledge/skill in vehicle/automotive technology, manufacturing technology, design/test experience, test practices and proceduresBasic specialized knowledge/skill in industry regulationsBasic knowledge in scheduling and supervisionProficient demonstration of the core competenciesPreferred Skills:NX and Zuken experienceWho we are: HYG designs, engineers, manufactures, sells and services a comprehensive line of lift trucks and aftermarket parts marketed globally under the Hyster and Yale brand names. We are one of the global leaders in the Material Handling industry and have been building relationships and partnering with our customers, suppliers, dealers and employees for over 90 years.What we offer: Hyster-Yale Group offers competitive pay, tuition reimbursement, supportive work environment, hybrid work option, and opportunities for growth and development. A full benefits package: paid time off; medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, employer-sponsored profit sharing and 401(k).#LI-OP#LI-ONSITEJob Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Dental insuranceLife insuranceTuition reimbursementVision insuranceWork Location: In person

Job Locations US-CA-Santa Rosa           Job Number             2023-13873              Category             R&D              Job Type             Regular              Open to Remote             No              Travel             <10%              Full Time / Part Time             Full Time (F)       Overview      Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Learn more about what we do.       Our powerful, award-winning culture embraces a bold vision of where technology can take us and a passion for tackling challenging problems with industry-first solutions. Diversity, equity & inclusion are integral parts of our culture and drivers of innovation at Keysight. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers.    ResponsibilitiesAbout the Team:      Our team is very competent, highly motivated, friendly, and eager to help you succeed. The team has a mix of new and experienced developers with a broad range of skills. Key responsibilities include:     Developing analog and digital circuits Leading component selection Schematic entry PCB/PCA design Signal integrity analysis Electrical characterization and debug System EMC design and debug This work will involve the support of your project team, working collaboratively to deliver innovative and market-leading products and solutions to Keysight customers. verification and debug of digital and analog circuits Knowledge of circuit theory, transmission line theory, and high-speed signal design Printed circuit board design experience including experience with high-speed signal integrity Experience with CAD/CAE design tools Experience with signal integrity analysis process through simulation Good analytical problem-solving skills Ability to work design Hands-on experience in using spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, signal generators, etc. to validate analog designs Experience in working with production test engineers to produce test plans and design for testability details Solid experience with bias, opamps, switched-cap circuits, LDOs, low power oscillators, PLLs, VGAs, feedback and compensation techniques, DC-DC converters Desired Qualifications: In depth knowledge and analytical understanding of mixed-signal design techniques Experience with designing for EMC and debugging related issue Understanding of data converter architectures and design trade-offs Good knowledge of high precision techniques in presence of device mismatch Experience in chip integration working with Digital Design and Physical Design teams Basic understanding of FPGA design and programming Experience in ASIC design experience in different application fields is a plus Experience in C/Matlab/VerilogA modeling Strong device physics knowledge as it applies to analog IC design Experience in working with production test engineers to produce test plans and design for testability details Experience in Vector Network Analyzer CAE Engineer - Finite Elemental Analysis: Product Design Engineer - LG Chem - Ravenna, OH

column7: We connect science to life for a better future.      LG Chem endeavors to become a 'Global Top 5 Chemical Company' with a balanced business portfolio that has a competitive advantage across the globe, including business divisions in petrochemicals, advanced materials, life sciences, and a subsidiary specializing in batteries.     LG Chem contributes to industrial development with various petrochemical products of world-class quality. In the petrochemicals business, the company has built a vertically integrated system from the basic raw materials (the upstream) such as ethylene and propylene to the downstream products such as PE, ABS, Acrylic Acid and synthetic rubber. The petrochemicals business is LG Chem's core business area with world-class productivity and cost competitiveness. The company has advanced its business structure by focusing on high-value added products such as Nano-carbon tube, strengthening its competitiveness in the global market consistently.     LG Chem is growing and we have an immediate opening for a Product Design Engineer to be part of the expansion in 2024. In this role the Product Design Engineer, will have a mechanical engineering background such as Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace / Automotive / Naval Architecture and Ocean Engineering, Precision Engineering and Design or others and will work directly with our client in the Automotive, Home Appliance or Consumer product industries.      ABAQUS experience is highly desired and this position is based in Ravenna, OH.     Responsibilities include:     Research and develop advanced product design process and technology such as design optimization, plastic assembly design, Computer Aided Engineering, advance material testing and numerical analysis (ex. American Battery Solutions has a full-time opening for a Systems Engineer in Springboro, Ohio. Job Summary: The Systems Engineer will be responsible for leading cross-disciplinary aspects of the design and development of high-voltage automotive battery packs. The Battery Systems Engineer will be responsible for ensuring specific battery pack requirements are understood and driving all activity related to the battery system. This will require the Systems Engineer to interface with manufacturing, mechanical design, thermal design, electrical design, harness design, and software team members. Responsibilities: Drives Systems engineering activities on customer projects which could include system testing, requirement development, and problem-solving activities. Support all prototype system builds, DV and PV builds along with production builds. Supports the development of the customer compliance matrix of customer requirements to an agreed baseline. Supports the development of system-level DFMEA and integrates it with requirements and verification plans. Supports the development of system requirements, architecture, and system concept sizing. Maintains changes to requirements, their impact analysis, and helps track scope creep. Maintains system requirements throughout the product life cycle. Identifies and drives cross-functional interface evaluations and any constraints. Strongly supports other key functional engineering groups with their tasks (ME, EE, SW, BMS). Supports functional safety, security, and reliability engineering analysis. Listens to the voice of the customer and translates it into system requirements. Helps support decomposition of DFMEA into sub-system DFMEA, and PFMEA. Helps develop system inspection requirements for end of line testing, from quality control plan. Be the expert at the manufacturing plant for all systems related issues that need resolved. Adhere to federal and state regulations. Adhere to all company policies, processes, and procedures. Performs other duties as requested, directed, or assigned. Predictable and reliable attendance. Position Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Systems Engineering. Master’s degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Systems Engineering preferred. Minimum of three (3) years engineering experience in an engineering discipline on electronic components or EV projects. Experience in systems engineering discipline on battery packs or battery management system projects preferred. Broad engineering knowledge in Mechanical, Electrical, Software, and Industrial Engineering with a strong focus in at least one discipline. Product experience with Li-Ion batteries, battery pack design, electric vehicles, power systems, alternative energy systems, electronic control units (ECUs), battery management systems (BMS), MEMS, and sensors. Experience in tools for requirement engineering management (ex. Jama), CAD/CAE; (ex. SolidWorks); design of experiments and statistical analysis of data (ex: Minitab), system modeling (ex: MATLAB, Simulink/Simscape), and diagnostic communication tools and protocols; (ex. Vector CANoe; CAN; LIN; GPI/O). Functional safety and cybersecurity experience. Vehicle architecture includes Automotive, Aerospace, Rail, Controls, and other Motive fields. Basic understanding of architecture modeling and requirements management tools. Experience with Microsoft office tools (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint). Experience generating DFMEA, PFMEA, DFM/DFA, and DVP&R. Experience using a formal requirement management tool. Hands-on experience with high and low voltage power and communication systems. Basic lab/shop skills (multimeter, power tools, etc.). Ability to travel up to 20% domestically and internationally. Key Competencies: Focuses on Quality: Drives work results with a quality focus on actions and results. Decision Making & Analysis: Makes sound decisions based upon a mixture of data-driven analysis, expertise, experience, and judgment; collects relevant information, seeking input from others, and identifies connections and/or root causes of problems. Delivers Results: Achievement-oriented, feeling a sense of urgency to reach goals on time, if not before. Teamwork: Works cooperatively with others to accomplish team goals and organizational objectives. Customer Focus: Anticipates and takes action to meet customer needs. Establishes and maintains a productive and effective working relationship with customers, both internal and external, and gains their trust and respect. Communications: Exchanges thoughts, feelings, and information effectively. Takes Calculated Risks: Takes calculated risks to achieve goals. Finds a balance between analysis and action. When fails, accepts it, learns from it, and moves on to the next challenge. Takes Initiative: Exhibits strong drive for results and success; conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure; persists despite obstacles and opposition. Physical Requirements / Working Conditions: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment. Ability to adjust focus, especially due to concentration on a computer screen. May need to lift and carry up to 30 pounds and/or position the body to reach items on the floor/below knee level or reach overhead. The person in this position needs to occasionally move about in industrial environments and on uneven terrain. Works in a temperature-controlled office environment, with occasional work in outdoor weather conditions, and in industrial environments. The noise level in the work environment can be moderately loud. Eaton’s IS AER FMC division is currently seeking a Lead Aerospace Engineer - NPD. This position is based at our Los Angeles, CA facility. The expected annual salary range for this role is $88499.97 - $129799.96 a year. Please note the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations. From commercial fleets to mission-ready military aircraft, Eaton is preparing for the future of air travel with innovative products and services designed to improve aircraft availability with increased efficiency and performance. Within our Aerospace Fluid and Motion Control Division, the Lead Aerospace Engineer - NPD will design and optimize Hydraulic actuation devices for Aerospace applications with Computer-Aided-Engineering techniques (CAE). This role focuses on developing designs that meet customers’ expectations and any applicable industry standards by collaborating with global engineering teams. Eaton’s comprehensive portfolio of components consistently sets the industry standard for engineering excellence, resulting in superior systems design and integration capability. These products power hundreds of military and commercial aircraft platforms with a focus on improved reliability, weight reduction and fuel efficiency. What you’ll do: Primary responsibility is to provide technical design, analysis, and guidance for new product development and product improvements. Has the decision-making authority on behalf of Mechanical Engineering for system and component design and the responsibilities for guiding and directing applicable IPT technical decisions and accomplishment of objectives. Engineer works with one or more IPT to design, analyze, and implement product designs and design improvements in all phases of a product design lifecycle Lead and participate in efforts to solve problems with product design, inspection, manufacturing, and test encountered by vendors, company operations personnel, and customers. Plan, organize, control, and lead multiple simultaneous projects. Establish and oversee accomplishment of multiple project objectives. Create, update, and interpret project schedules and communicates changes and status to Engineering Leadership and IPT(s). Support targets and milestones for project budgets and schedules. Participate in resolving program change of scope issues with Project Engineering and Program Management. Serve as primary technical contact for multiple cross-functional teams and liaison between Engineering and internal and external customers. Interacts directly with internal and external customers through formal technical presentations and informal discussions. Create, develop, and guide the creation of design standards, technical documents, including Engineering drawings (following ASME Y14.5, ASME Y14.34 standards), test procedures, test reports, and design review material. Present product design and substantiating data and analysis, design findings and recommendations to customers and management. Provide technical leadership, mentoring, and coaching to co-workers. Provide direction to other engineers on project teams. Ensure standardization of design of products and adherence to engineering processes across multiple projects. Supports continuous improvement by offering input to standard processes and procedures. Proactively collaborate with peers and managers to determine key goals, objectives, and corresponding metrics. Review and amend these actions as appropriate. Focus on the timely achievement of these goals and objectives. Interpret engineering documents. Coordinate creation and update of engineering documents. Participate and lead studies and improvement for cost reduction and first-time yield. Lead and participate in cross-functional Root Cause and Corrective Action (RCCA) investigations. Provide engineering input and technical expertise and sound engineering judgment for failure investigation and for customer-returned hardware. Qualifications: Required (Basic) Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in engineering from an accredited institution required. Minimum five (5) years of Mechanical and Project Engineering including design experience utilizing 3D CAD software in the aerospace, hydraulic, or vehicle industry environment OR Master's degree from an accredited institution and a minimum of two (2) years of experience in the aerospace, hydraulic, or vehicle industry Minimum of two (2) years’ experience implementing hydraulic product design and testing in a plant environment. Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship both now and in the future. This position requires use of information or access to hardware which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee. No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidates that currently reside within 50 miles of the Los Angeles, CA facility will be considered. Active Duty Military Service member candidates are exempt from the geographical area limitation. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in mechanical or aerospace Engineering from an accredited institution Master’s degree in mechanical or aerospace Engineering from an Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) accredited institution. Experience in the Aerospace Industry. Experience with Pro/Engineer, Enovia PLM, or similar 3D design and lifecycle management software tools. Experience with designing hydraulic, pneumatic, or electromechanical products using Advanced manufacturing techniques and transitioning to a production environment. Ability to apply of Geometrical Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) principles and perform tolerance stack-up analyses. Ability to perform basic structural and/or performance analysis. Working knowledge of Design for Six Sigma (DFSS), Design for Manufacturability (dfM), Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA), Design of Experiments (DOE), and Root Cause and Corrective Action (RCCA) principles. Summary The Hardware Quality Engineer I is a self-motivated individual who works closely with customers and project management to comply with quality and contract requirements. Performs day-to-day activities from project/product conception to implementation, deployment and support. The position has significant interaction across all functional departments and geographical locations. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Ensures products meet all applicable external requirements (i.e. customer, ISO 9001, CMMI) Supports project management, customers, suppliers and CAE USA staff to identify product quality issues Interprets technical drawings including characteristics such as views, title blocks, dimensioning, tolerances, symbols, etc. in relation to product characteristics and fitness for use Evaluates software and hardware configuration control and change management Collects and presents quality metrics for projects in support of organizational objectives Performs review of contracts, statements of work and deliverable documents Creates and revises quality plans, processes, procedures and work instructions as directed Applies quality tools, methods and abstract concepts to quality problems Applies proper quality requirements during product procurement Supports estimation/proposal pursuits, internal/external audits, supplier evaluations, Internal Inspection, customer property and disposition of defective material Trains staff in quality matters as directed Qualifications and Education Requirements 3-5 years relatable experience in Quality Engineering education/experience in Quality Engineering Competent in Microsoft Office software applications Due to U.S. Government contract requirements, only U.S. citizens are eligible for this role. Shall not divulge any information, or afford access, to other employees not having a need-to-know. Shall not divulge information outside company without management approval. Lead Engineer, Die Cast – Directs the maintenance and improvement of product quality and productivity. Provides technical assistance to Ryobi Die Casting (RDC) and customers as needed. Addresses any die casting product issues in house and at the customer’s request. Establishes and achieves MBO goals for assigned products. Develops plans for achieving MBO goals as well as to analyze current condition. Attends monthly meetings to discuss MBO results and progress. Writes End-Of-Run Die Maintenance Request for the responsible products. Develops trust and reliable partnerships with customers as needed. Conducts die refurbishment and ordering schedule. Involved in creation of PFMEA, control plan, and process flow. Guides and directs Process Techs, as needed. Assists in the process of quality training of new RDC personnel. Able to assist in writing of 8-D reports, in visiting customer plants, and in the developing of quality training methods and practices, all as needed. Integrates complex information from a variety of sources, detects trends, associations, and cause-effect relationships. Performs other related duties as assigned. Requirements - Master’s or foreign degree equivalent in engineering and two years of experience in the job offered or engineering experience in the die cast industry. Employer also accepts Bachelor’s or foreign degree equivalent in engineering and four years of experience in the job offered or engineering experience in the die cast industry. Special skills - Experience in die cast and CAE analysis, budget management, process development, expense reporting, new product launches, Toyota Production System (TPS) and must have Six Sigma Green Belt Certificate. Occasional domestic and international travel required. Worksite location: 800 W. Mausoleum Rd., Shelbyville, IN 46176. Apply by mail or online to: https://www.ryobidiecasting.com/careers HR Ryobi Die Casting (USA), Inc. 800 W. Mausoleum Rd. Shelbyville, IN 46176

Put a LIFT in Your Career! Hyster-Yale Group, Inc. (HYG), a world-class manufacturer of industrial lift trucks, has an outstanding opportunity for an exceptional and talented Electrical Engineer at our facility located in Greenville, NC.As an Electrical Engineer, you will work on the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, provide product design documentation through the creation of detail drawings, engineering lists and Engineering Change Notices (ECN) and integrate manufacturing input into the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, and may participate in the support of manufacturing activities such as Pilot or 1st Production.As an Electrical Engineer you will also create product design documentation – such as CAE (computer aided engineering), 3-d models, detail drawings, engineering lists, reports, test plans and software coding – to support release of Change Orders describing component design revisions. You will translate truck-level and system-level requirements to component requirements and plan and support development testing to ensure design robustness to requirements. The Engineer IV will interface with component suppliers and internal customers (Platform, Manufacturing, Marketing, Service, etc.) to understand detailed product requirements and develop concepts for system design as well as supervise other engineers/technicians.Key AccountabilitiesDesign and develop components as required for lift truck vehiclesDesign and develop assemblies as required for lift truck vehicles and order prototype partsDesign and develop wire harnessThe Engineer IV will also, evaluate component design and assembly, build prototype vehicles, design and evaluate systems and plan and execute prototype test activitiesProvide design specification documentation as required to manufacture the product such as detail drawings, engineering list structure and ECN writingProvide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productProvide product/process specification documents, detailed drawings/software development, test engineering reports, sales and product information data and test plansDevelop product around the most efficient and cost-effective manufacturing processes, and provide on-site Engineering support during critical Manufacturing activities such as Pilot and 1st Production; integrate Manufacturing/Purchasing input basic designThe Engineer IV will also provide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productThe Engineer IV will also provide leadership and guidance to individuals and project teams to ensure project deliverables are metHR administration and local project supervisionThe Engineer IV will also provide design/test input to project proposals, research for future product projects and develop design and evaluation concepts which enable program and project decisionsAdditionally, the Engineer IV will devise plans for component strategy creation that take advantage of unapparent opportunities given technology advances aligned with corporate visionMinimum Qualifications:B.S., Engineering discipline, requiredOne-Five years industry experience. All skill levels will be considered.Beginner-Master level knowledge/skill in drawing practices, CAD, design layouts, engineering analysisBasic specialized knowledge/skill in vehicle/automotive technology, manufacturing technology, design/test experience, test practices and proceduresBasic specialized knowledge/skill in industry regulationsBasic knowledge in scheduling and supervisionProficient demonstration of the core competenciesPreferred Skills:NX and Zuken experienceWho we are: HYG designs, engineers, manufactures, sells and services a comprehensive line of lift trucks and aftermarket parts marketed globally under the Hyster and Yale brand names. We are one of the global leaders in the Material Handling industry and have been building relationships and partnering with our customers, suppliers, dealers and employees for over 90 years.What we offer: Hyster-Yale Group offers competitive pay, tuition reimbursement, supportive work environment, hybrid work option, and opportunities for growth and development. Finish assigned engineering projects in accordance with customer specifications and within schedule and budget limitations, coordinating activities of engineering team, contractors, and vendors. Lead brainstorming activities for specific needs. Perform other duties as assigned. Knowledge of lean manufacturing techniques. Proficient in Microsoft Office, Access, Excel, Power Point and AutoCAD. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Uses team management skills to lead the design group during the conceptual phase of product development. Conduct project meetings and prepare reports to communicate the status of the project within and beyond the project team. Who We Are! Aetos Systems, Inc. was founded in early 2007 to provide a unique work experience. Employees are the foundation of our business. Our leaders work hard every day to empower and support our employees in the development of their careers, giving back to their community and providing their expertise and innovations to our customers - solving real world business problems. Our culture focuses on our people - our strongest asset - ensuring they have an environment to provide best-in-class service and solutions to our customers. We always strive to do the right thing. Have you imagined working for a dynamic small business where you are heard, highly regarded and able to do what you love all in one package? This is your opportunity! Join now! Check out our website via www.aetossystems.com Security Clearance: Must be able to obtain Department of Defense Secret Security Clearance Job Summary: We are looking for Electrical Engineers who want to work in a multi-disciplinary team that plays a key role in supporting national defense through ground testing of air and space systems. While these positions have some office work involved, the majority of the engineer’s time is spent in the field or plant area working with our skilled craft workforce. This work involves practical application of engineering principles of electrical equipment sizing, troubleshooting, circuit protection and arc flash analysis of low and medium voltage equipment. These principles are applied through the use of engineering tools including generating risk assessments, work instructions, and other engineering documentation in support of testing. These positions may require some amount of shift work to support testing as test load demands.  As part of a multi-disciplinary team, you will be involved in multiple entities of engineering including controls, instrumentation, design, facility data analysis, and modeling/simulating engineers to ensure reliable operation and ability to meet future test needs.  They perform as part of a cadre of mechanical and electrical engineers; whose job is to oversee installation, operation, sustainment, and troubleshooting of major equipment and systems such as large motors, compressors, electrical switchgear, over-current protection, transformers, PLCs, relays, and/or solid-state variable frequency systems that are needed to reliably provide test conditions to the test facilities. You will enjoy this job if you:Have interest or experience with large electric motors.Enjoy a fast-paced work environment.Are good at communicating with people.Requirements Basic Qualifications:B.S. degree in electrical engineering from an accredited university and a minimum of three to seven years of relevant and applicable experience.Current United States Citizenship is required. Preferred Qualifications:A minimum of 2 years of developmental experience such as practical work experience in relevant types of engineering such as systems startup, field engineering, or plant operations/maintenance in large industrial plants, utilities, process plants, or other engineering/construction firms.Educational concentration and/or work experience in low, medium, or high voltage power distribution.Educational and/or work experience in dealing with electrical systems or electrical components of mechanical systems.Technical knowledge of engineering systems, engineering calculations, applications of engineering methods and construction methods and materials, and application of computer aided engineering (CAE)/computer aided design (CAD) tools to engineering problems.Working knowledge of major industry or regulatory standards and design criteria pertinent to the electrical engineering discipline.Passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam.Strong communication skills (including verbal and written)Active Department of Defense Secret Security ClearanceBenefits What we offer:Competitive salariesEducation and professional development assistanceMultiple healthcare benefit packages & 24/7 virtual on-demand doctors’ visits401KDave Ramsey’s SmartDollar Financial Wellness programCivic Leave – time off to support your favorite charity or community.Paid time off for personal leave and holidays
