column7: Description:   The development department of Aludyne makes a decisive contribution to the product and design development of chassis components and is in close contact with the global Aludyne development locations. (US/France/Germany) Your tasks in detail: Design development:Responsible for design development and fault diagnosis from prototype to production phase (DFM, DFMEA)Direct technical contact for our customers. Participates in the APQP process with Program ManagerPlanning of bench tests and validation by DVP&RConducts design reviews, extensive communication with manufacturing team, program managers, sales team, quality team and test labs worldwideChange management process (creation and tracking of ECN/ECR) CAE and 2D/3D drawingsPlanning of simulation needs (for structure and casting processes)Supports the CAE group in creating FEA modelsCoordination of production process with Aludyne manufacturing facilitiesIdentifies critical dimensions (GD&T) Cooperation with suppliersDefinition of component specifications for suppliers Requirements:   Qualifications: Professional experience: 1-5 years in the field of vehicle development Degree: Successfully completed master's degree in mechanical engineering, automotive engineering or a comparable technical degree IT skills: Safe handling of MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook), Catia V5, UG, Hyperworks (Hypermesh, Hyperview), nCode (Fatigue), Abaqus, Minitab. Language skills: Confident German and English skills, both spoken and written Personal skills: Structured and goal-oriented way of working, analytical way of thinking, ability to work in a team, commitment, communication skills. Miscellaneous: Interest in the automotive industry (especially chassis), knowledge of metallurgy and material behavior of metal parts, GD&T experience and knowledge of statistics, knowledge of the current national and international vehicle market desirable. Knowledge or experience in relevant manufacturing processes, especially the casting process (HPDC, LPDC) is an advantage.

Description:  At Orbit Advanced Technologies, Inc., (OATI), a division of MVG, we strive to deliver the most advanced antenna and RCS measurement facilities to the U.S. aerospace and defense industry. OATI is seeking driven individuals who excel in fast-paced environments, moving novel concepts from inception to commissioning. We welcome candidates who will bring commitment and motivation into our tight-knit team, helping us shape the future. Tight-knit team to shape the future. The Sr. Mechanical Engineer will be responsible for the mechanical design and development of cutting-edge technologies for the visualization of electromagnetic waves. Enhancing the speed and accuracy of wireless connectivity testing and the performance and reliability of anechoic and EMC technologies, our systems are integral to meeting the testing challenges of a fully connected world. Requirements:  Requirements:BS in Mechanical Engineering and five years of work experience5+ years of Mechanical design, drawings, building Bill of Materials, etc.Vision to design from white space.Design for manufacturability, specification, testing, and integrationProvides mechanical engineering support and technical advice to staff, vendors, and customers.Proficient in the use of Solid Works and AUTOCAD.CAE software tools for stress and thermal analyses

What you’ll do: Position Overview: Eaton’s Power Connection business has a cooperative employment opportunity for students pursuing a degree in engineering.      The objective of this program is to develop your technical skills in engineering through a practical experience, and assist in your personal development of leadership competencies through training, networking and coaching. During the program you will provide engineering services to support the operations of our dynamic and exciting Eaton Power Connections business through an assignment in one of the following departments, based upon your interest and business need: Test Engineering, Product Engineering, or Manufacturing Engineering.      Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours.     In this co-op program your assignment may include:Supporting Product Engineers in development of new product designsPerforming failure root cause analysis and problem solving within a team to identify and isolate product issues and recommend solutionsDeveloping detailed engineering materials including technical reports to provide product documentationCommunicating plans, status, and results to senior engineers and leadershipCollaborating with suppliers, internal laboratories and test facilities to ensure the successful completion of product development and validation testingWorking in a team environment to identify process improvements, product cost reductions, and reliability improvementsCollecting and analyze manufacturing data and implement process improvements that advance safety, product quality, and operating efficiencies Qualifications: Required (Basic) Qualifications:Actively enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program in engineering at an accredited institutionMust have a combined GPA of 2.5 or higher (please do not round)Legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship on a continual permanent basis.Relocation is not provided for this role, the candidate must be located within 50 miles of Southfield, MI or Carol Stream, IL Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in EngineeringExperience in automotive industry Position Criteria:Actively enrolled in a Bachelor of Engineering from an accredited institution.Engineering knowledge and experience in product development from concept to product launch and product post launch engineering maintenanceDemonstrated problem solving and failure analysis skillsGD&T knowledgeKnowledge of typical C.A.E. software (Creo/Solidworks, MATLAB, MASTA/Romax, etc.)Self-motivated and possessing a drive for resultsWilling and able to work 2-4 years in the co-op program We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.  Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.Your Impact: What if you could join one of the industry’s leading providers of comprehensive aviation services? Be a part of our growth and help us reinvent tomorrow. Drawing on more than 50 years of airport experience, we support our clients at every phase of project development – from planning through design and construction to facilities management. Our engineers, architects, and planners are experts at delivering projects in highly complex and dynamic operating environments. Backed by decades of solid experience on large and small airport projects, our Jacobs aviation team has served county, municipal, regional, and international airports; air carriers; and military installations. Our global aviation experience extends to working at more than 400 airports worldwide, including 26 of the Top 30 airports in the United States and the 3 largest airports in North Carolina. We offer expertise across all core engineering, construction management, architecture, and specialty aviation disciplines. We are seeking individuals to join a dynamic and experienced team.  Position Summary  In this role, the Civil Engineering project manager will lead civil/structural engineering tasks, provide excellent client service, manage quality, and perform in a team environment. This role supports our growing southeastern U.S. aviation practice. Such projects include, and are not limited to airfield improvements, land/site development, and other transportation tasks. The professional will:  Focus on the aviation market at major airports in the CarolinasManage and lead the ongoing progress of a project, including the coordination of the project with the client, subconsultants, and other outside agencies as needed.Conceptualize the initial civil design approach for major phases of land/site development, airfield improvements, related projects, and have overall responsibility for the civil engineering work.Plan and conduct work requiring evaluation, selection and substantial adaptation/ modification of standard techniques, procedures, and criteria.Use advanced techniques to modify and extend civil engineering theories, precepts and practices.Resolve a variety of complex problems, (i.e. conflicting design requirements, unsuitability of conventional materials, difficult coordination requirements) and develop resilient solutions.Build client business opportunities and support project proposal teams.Supervise the design tasks and drive the ongoing progress of a project, including the coordination of the project with the client, City, State, and County officials, and other outside agencies as needed.Lead, coordinate and review the work of less experienced engineers and/or technical support personnel assigned to the project.Participate in contract bidding and administration; observe project action on site. Here’s What You’ll Need: The ideal candidate should possess the following knowledge and skills:  Four-year degree in Civil Engineering (BSCE or equivalent)Ability to obtain Professional Engineering (PE) certification in North Carolina (or ability to gain reciprocity) within 6 monthsMinimum of 6 years’ experience as a designer for aviation projects, airfield civil engineering experience preferredExperience working with AutoCAD Civil 3D, Bluebeam and CAE tools and work products is requiredExperience with the development of reports, plans and specifications using FAA, UFC, or ICAO criteria is preferred At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $15 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 60,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

The Electrical Engineer will perform IPT Lead support functions for Reverse Engineering, Science and Technology for Obsolescence, Repair and Evaluation (RESTORE) Laboratory. This position to support the sustainment of DOD Airspace and C4I systems while institutionalizing new technologies. This includes using Computer Aided Design/Engineering (CAD/CAE) to develop Installation Requirements Drawings (IRDs), Installation Design Package (IDP) and Technical Data Packages (TDPs).Required to work directly with the Government customer to assess materials, develop components, assess, interpret, and approve drawing requirements for multiple engineering tasks over a broad range of technology scope.Use Computer Aided Design/Engineering (CAD/CAE) to develop Installation Requirements Drawings (IRDs), Installation Design Package (IDP) and Technical Data Packages (TDPs).The position will include the creation of 3D CAD models of existing systems derived from laser scanned measurement data.Use a variety of traditional metrology/measurement devices as well as being willing to learn the use of advanced tools such as laser scanning, photogrammetry and other laser measurement devices which are currently in use.  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:  B.S. in Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience10-12 years of experience working with engineering drawings.Ability to provide interpretation and preparation of 3D engineering drawings. Creating, editing, or proofing, US Government Engineering documentation and applicable standards to include 2D Drawings, 3D drawings, exploded diagrams, assembly diagrams, is highly desired.Knowledge of engineering specifications (ASME Y14.100-2004, ASME Y14.5M-2004, MIL-STD-810G, MIL-STD-130)Knowledge of following standards: NAVWAR M-4750.5B (IRD), SSCPAC Instruction TD 417 (TDP Development) and COMSPAWAR M-4720.1 (Shore Installation Process Handbook – IDP Development).Experience in Building Information Modeling (BIM) in programs such as Autodesk Revit is desired.U.S. Citizenship status requiredActive DoD Secret Security Clearance or higher desire; or able to gain required clearance

Kearfott Corporation, a global avionics motion control and navigation supplier, is a leader in the design and manufacture of precision motion control products and inertial control components. Our systems control military and commercial aircraft, military land vehicles, missiles, marine applications, satellites, and space instruments. We are looking for talented individuals who want to be part of a world class work force. Join Kearfott and become part of a company that is recognized for technical expertise and respected world-wide as a ‘full service’ provider. For more information visit our website at www.kearfott.com The Mechanical Engineering Manager I is responsible for leading the team responsible for the design and development of electromechanical actuators for use in the aerospace and defense markets. This position requires extensive understanding of the behavior of mechanical systems as well as the interaction with BLDC prime movers. The successful candidate is responsible for leading a group of 6-10 mechanical engineers with various skill sets and experience levels. This includes project planning, and resource assignment, and budgeting. The mechanical engineering team is responsible for reviewing and interpreting customer requirements, and assessing the level of effort required to fulfill them. The team will engage with customers and internal leads and Subject Matter Experts (SME) for R&D, customer requirements development, proposals, design and development, initial prototype to production transition, and production support. This position is also responsible for assisting in the development and establishment of the product line road map as well as defining the research and development priorities that will ensure technology leadership within the market segments targeted for future growth. Essential Functions Product Life Cycle Engineering In addition to leadership responsibilities, the position is expected to be an individual contributor for development programs and proposal activities including:Development of new concepts and proposal solutions.Understanding of manufacturing and design trade-offs (practical implementation of designs).Development and validation of performance models.Geartrain Design and Stress Analysis based on industry standard practices.Spur and Planetary geartrain design experience preferred. Support cost proposal activity including:Manufacturing and design cost assessment.Participate as a member of a cross-functional project team focused on development of customer funded projects as well as IR&D projects.Creates 3D CAD models of design concepts, and develops detailed 2D drawings while working with designers.Perform and coordinate design analysis using ANSYS, Matlab, and other CAE tools. Business Development SupportTravel as required to support market development and customer needsSupport and advance relationships with our customer’s engineering teams Engineering LeadershipDirect priorities of components team with input from the Director of Design Engineering.Ability to lead 6-10 direct reportsMentorship of less experienced team members Required Skills Customer centric attitudeExcellent oral and written communication skillsExcellent presentation skills and presentation preparation (design reviews, marketing presentations, etc.)Motion controls understanding or experience is a plus.Extensive understanding of the dynamic behavior of electromechanical systems.Experience with regulations, certification standards, and design assurance and systems standards such FAR 25, ARP4754, DO-254, DO-178C, MIL-STD-882E is a plus.Ability to lead effectively in a cross functional team environmentDrives for results - action orientedContinuously improves in all aspects Required Experience 5+ years required in an aerospace motion control engineering and manufacturing environment.B.S., Mechanical Engineering required, M.S. is preferred.New product development experience required.Previous Engineering leadership experience preferred3-D CAD experience, SolidWorks preferred.Solid understanding of aerospace and defense markets and requirements preferred.Must be legally authorized to work in the US. Equal Opportunity Employer We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

Job Brief This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home.Crane Aerospace & Electronics is seeking a dynamic Systems Engineer in Burbank, CA to join our high performing Landing Solutions Engineering Team. Support or lead the planning, modeling, simulation, specifications and integration of components that reside in a system comprised of electronic hardware, microcontrollers, embedded software or sensors. Help define the system architecture definition for landing systems with focus on brake control and monitoring systems in a structured environment to meet customer needs.Participate in the certification compliance activities of essential and critical level control systems for aircraft applications. Execute projects in accordance with schedules and budgets. Coordinate activities with others assigned within the Integrated Product Team. Working knowledge of requirements management tools (e.g. DOORS)Must demonstrate proficiency with verbal and written English for technical reports, presentations, analyses, or other communications at the appropriate level. As a US Department of Defense contractor, we are bound by the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). Preferred Qualifications :Familiarity with modeling and simulation (ie. Simulink, SysML) a plus Experience leading system development activities following industry recognized processes (e.g. ARP4754A).Ability to interact with customers, provide superior technical, cost effective and schedule efficient solutions to complex engineering issues.Ability to lead systems team or cross functional engineering team on complex development programs.Ability to create and present systems material at Preliminary and Critical Design Reviews.Understanding and practical experience of DO-178C and DO-160.Aerospace industry development experience. We're ALTEN Technology USA, an engineering company that provides solutions for engineering, technology, and product development projects. For decades, we've been helping our clients develop products that are changing the world, whether that's by shaping the future of space exploration, saving lives with medical devices that set a new standard of care, or creating the fully autonomous electric taxi of tomorrow. Our team of more than 600 people works across industries including aerospace, medical devices and life sciences, unmanned systems and robotics, automotive OEM and tier 1 suppliers, commercial vehicle, electric vehicles, rail, and more. Our offices across the US have different industry focuses and engage with our clients in different ways, ranging from working on-site at client facilities to performing product development at our delivery centers.ALTEN Group, our parent company, has been a leader in engineering and information technology for more than 30 years. ALTEN Group operates in 30 countries across Europe, North America, Asia, Africa and the Middle East and employs more than 36,000 people, 88% of whom are engineers. The company covers the whole development cycle and offers a choice of service levels, from technology consulting to complete project outsourcing.When you join ALTEN Technology USA, you join a group of people passionate about collaborating to solve some of the world's most technical engineering challenges. Our success is tied to taking care of our employees by building relationships and providing opportunities for mentorship and career growth. We offer comprehensive benefits for all full-time employees, including medical, dental, and vision insurance; a 401(k) plan with employer matching; paid time off (PTO); paid parental leave; and mentorship to help you take your career to the next level. You don't have to take our word for it that we are a great place to work—we were named on the 2023 Top Workplaces list thanks to feedback from our proud employees.Job Description: BS Degree or higher in ME. Minimum of 6+ years of industry experience in using and developing CAE methods. This role will be responsible to create and validate CAE methods and processes related to Optimization of 1D/3D CAE models, Automation of CAE workflows, and robustness (stochastic) processes. Expectations are proficiency with CAE software such as iSight and modeFRONTIER along with experience with various CAE software such as Abaqus, Nastran, StarCCM+, GT-Suite, SimPack, AmeSim, Hypermesh and Ansa are preferred. Also proficient with programming language software such as Matlab, Python, and VBA. Related advanced degree may be substituted for 2 years of experience.

Put a LIFT in Your Career! Hyster-Yale Group, Inc. (HYG), a world-class manufacturer of industrial lift trucks, has an outstanding opportunity for an exceptional and talented Electrical Engineer at our facility located in Greenville, NC.As an Electrical Engineer, you will work on the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, provide product design documentation through the creation of detail drawings, engineering lists and Engineering Change Notices (ECN) and integrate manufacturing input into the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, and may participate in the support of manufacturing activities such as Pilot or 1st Production.As an Electrical Engineer you will also create product design documentation – such as CAE (computer aided engineering), 3-d models, detail drawings, engineering lists, reports, test plans and software coding – to support release of Change Orders describing component design revisions. You will translate truck-level and system-level requirements to component requirements and plan and support development testing to ensure design robustness to requirements. The Engineer IV will interface with component suppliers and internal customers (Platform, Manufacturing, Marketing, Service, etc.) to understand detailed product requirements and develop concepts for system design as well as supervise other engineers/technicians.Key AccountabilitiesDesign and develop components as required for lift truck vehiclesDesign and develop assemblies as required for lift truck vehicles and order prototype partsDesign and develop wire harnessThe Engineer IV will also, evaluate component design and assembly, build prototype vehicles, design and evaluate systems and plan and execute prototype test activitiesProvide design specification documentation as required to manufacture the product such as detail drawings, engineering list structure and ECN writingProvide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productProvide product/process specification documents, detailed drawings/software development, test engineering reports, sales and product information data and test plansDevelop product around the most efficient and cost-effective manufacturing processes, and provide on-site Engineering support during critical Manufacturing activities such as Pilot and 1st Production; integrate Manufacturing/Purchasing input basic designThe Engineer IV will also provide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productThe Engineer IV will also provide leadership and guidance to individuals and project teams to ensure project deliverables are metHR administration and local project supervisionThe Engineer IV will also provide design/test input to project proposals, research for future product projects and develop design and evaluation concepts which enable program and project decisionsAdditionally, the Engineer IV will devise plans for component strategy creation that take advantage of unapparent opportunities given technology advances aligned with corporate visionMinimum Qualifications:B.S., Engineering discipline, requiredOne-Five years industry experience. All skill levels will be considered.Beginner-Master level knowledge/skill in drawing practices, CAD, design layouts, engineering analysisBasic specialized knowledge/skill in vehicle/automotive technology, manufacturing technology, design/test experience, test practices and proceduresBasic specialized knowledge/skill in industry regulationsBasic knowledge in scheduling and supervisionProficient demonstration of the core competenciesPreferred Skills:NX and Zuken experienceWho we are: HYG designs, engineers, manufactures, sells and services a comprehensive line of lift trucks and aftermarket parts marketed globally under the Hyster and Yale brand names. We are one of the global leaders in the Material Handling industry and have been building relationships and partnering with our customers, suppliers, dealers and employees for over 90 years.What we offer: Hyster-Yale Group offers competitive pay, tuition reimbursement, supportive work environment, hybrid work option, and opportunities for growth and development. A full benefits package: paid time off; medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, employer-sponsored profit sharing and 401(k).#LI-OP#LI-ONSITEJob Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Dental insuranceLife insuranceTuition reimbursementVision insuranceWork Location: In person

Country: United States of America  Location: CANHQ: CCS HQ - Syracuse, NY 6304 Thompson Rd, Syracuse, NY, 13221 USA     Carrier is the leading global provider of healthy, safe and sustainable building and cold chain solutions with a world-class, diverse workforce with business segments covering HVAC, refrigeration, and fire and security. We make modern life possible by delivering safer, smarter and more sustainable services that make a difference to people and our planet while revolutionizing industry trends. This is why we come to work every day. Join us and we can make a difference together.   About The Role: Our Disruptive Climate Solutions team is evolving to maintain Carrier’s leadership in the market through investments in advanced research, technologies and methods that will shape the future of our products and services. As part of this transformation, we are hiring and empowering an experienced Senior Design Engineer to help us innovate and pursue sustainable solutions for our customers. Key Responsibilities: Develops, designs, and validates novel HVAC systems. Identifies solutions to improve system and component-level performance. Uses design software packages to develop models and drawings of new concepts and products. Designs and implements common procedures and standard work across the organization to optimize efficiency and quality. Develops data and makes layouts, sketches, and notes necessary to present design proposal. Maintains existing engineering records and designs. Assesses design issues or risks. Supervises the manufacturing process of all designs. Reviews completed layouts and drawings to ensure clarity, completeness, conformity to standards, procedures, specifications, and accuracy of calculations and dimensioning. Communicates with the other engineering personnel to coordinate the interrelated design and ensure project completion. Designs and reviews layouts of components calculates stack-up of detail components, and performs major cost studies consisting of new details and/or marked prints and all supporting documentation, when necessary, to facilitate operations and ensure that established objectives and budgets are achieved. Resolves design problems of difficult-to-complex scope to ensure project completion. Designs new products and processes, and improves and maintains existing products to help create better products or processes and ensure that the current and future needs of the business are met. Provides technical leadership and when required, assists in training less experienced engineers to help them diagnose and solve problems and build capabilities. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Systems Engineering, Electrical engineering or a similar engineering/engineering technology field with 4+ years of experience with material or mechanical system design, testing, modeling, and simulation OR Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Systems Engineering, Electrical engineering or a similar engineering/engineering technology field with 2+ years of experience with material or mechanical system design, testing, modeling, and simulation Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree in Mechanical Engineering, Systems Engineering, Electrical engineering or a similar engineering/engineering technology field Knowledge of HVAC&R systems and cycle analysis Knowledge of Materials Proficient in PTC Creo or similar CAD software Proficiency in CAE tools for design evaluations Demonstrated expertise in prototype validation through testing and model-based simulation Excellent understanding of measurement uncertainty and design of experiments #LI-onsite RSRCAR Pay Range: $71,500 - $125,500 Annually  Carrier is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. column7: Essential Duties: Support of magnet wire manufacturing business using mechanical and related engineering skills and experience. Primary objective will be development of engineered solutions to fulfill equipment and process development objectives that will successfully industrialize new and improved methods to fulfill customer requirements. Typical scope of work will include sourcing and/or modifications of existing equipment, commercially available equipment, and development of new and proprietary equipment. Position requires ability to convert concepts into key deliverables to meet specific project objectives and fulfill production needs. Typical project work will include work package scope development, detailed equipment design and/or component specification, equipment and component quoting, vendor management, schedule management, installation design, installation execution, commissioning, and post commissioning support. This role will have interaction with and receive inputs from other technical groups in order to develop full vision of deliverables required to fulfill customer needs. This is an exciting and unique opportunity to have a broad ownership of project work packages which spans conceptualization, design, realization, hands-on execution with full cradle-to-grave ownership of project work packages. This opportunity spans a diverse range of equipment types including but not limited to; conductor forming processes, annealing processes, process heating, packaging, test equipment, and support systems. Minimum Qualifications: BS in mechanical engineering with three (3) to five (5) years design experience in machinery design, continuous improvement, and operational/functional analysis. Possess an understanding of the following areas; machine design, part and assembly fabrication methods, machine assembly, rotating equipment design, and GT&D. Successful candidate will have background in one or more of the following areas; machinery development, modification or improvement, troubleshooting, installation and commissioning. Candidate will be knowledgeable in machining, assembly, mechanics of materials and materials analysis. Must be proficient at 2D and 3D CAD, MS Project and other MS applications. Travel for this position is 20% on average with some heavier travel periods per project needs. Preferred Qualifications: MSME degree or other related advanced degree. Six Sigma Green or Black Belt. Project management certification or relevant training. Experience in finite element analysis, CAE analysis tools, machine modeling and characterization. Experience related to wire drawing equipment design or similar metal forming processes. 5+ years engineering experience in an industrial environment with a strong background in facilities and manufacturing. Experience in machine repair and refurbishing. Proven track record in estimating, preparing, and managing project budgets. Experience managing contractors and vendors.

We are global, we are impacting the lives of millions every day, we are making a difference!At Amcor we are inspired to change the packaging industry and are taking on the aspirational challenge to make all our products recyclable or reusable by 2025. Through our products and global footprint, we are in a unique position to truly make a difference in the packaging space. Our products impact the lives of millions of people across the globe every day from food, beverage, pharmaceutical, medical, home- and personal-care, and other essential products. Amcor is a thriving S&P 500 organisation listed both on the NYSE (AMCR) and ASX (AMC) with US$13 billion in sales. We have a proud history dating back to the 1860’s and come a long way from a single paper mill based in Melbourne to becoming the global leading packaging company. Today, Amcor is an international organisation empowering its 50,000 employees in over 40 countries and across 250 sites.Will you be next to join our journey towards a more sustainable future? At Amcor we are always looking for talented and passionate individuals who are motivated to make a difference. Working at Amcor means you will have a unique opportunity to be a part of an organisation that is committed to providing sustainable packaging solutions. To find out more about our commitment to sustainability and about Amcor, visit www.amcor.com.Job DescriptionPosition Overview:The Advanced Engineering Department at the Amcor Rigid Packaging R&D center develops packaging designs for a wide range of customers across a broad spectrum of industries. Pursuing the concept of completely virtual prototyping, they employ the latest engineering tools in both CAD and CAE to create, virtually test, and refine complex designs. This industry leading capability is backed by custom engineering tools and systems that allow this dedicated team to fine tune packaging to meet performance needs while protecting the environment with the lightest weight containers available.In this position the Design engineer will support the activities mainly in container design (CAD) but also the creation and maintenance of VBA coding. The candidate will become proficient in and employ a wide range of virtual engineering tools to deliver the optimal designs within time constraints. The candidate is also expected to drive and assist the effort in coding, developing, and streamlining engineering design scripts. In this position, the Designer will receive regular guidance and supervision by manager/senior engineers but is expected to carry out the job duties independently. Specific tasks and limited scope projects will be assigned routinely with clearly defined deliverables and constrains.Essential Responsibilities and Qualifications:Education: Bachelor's Degree in Engineering discipline in Mechanical, Structural, or AerospaceRecommend 5-10 years’ experience with a bachelor's degreeExperience with 3D CAD required, CATIA and CAE software -Abacus a plusVBA coding experience required, VBA coding for CATIA a plusInterest in statistical analysis and experience in automation software a plusCATIA admin or related software administration experience a plusWorking knowledge of Windchill PLM a plusExposure to finite element analysis and structural designExcellent documentation, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skillsSelf-learning and on-job-learning; can quickly become independent under limited supervision.A quick learner, who can work with complex modeling techniques.Strong analytical skillsMotivation to learn and take challenges.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills English and Spanish a plusAbility to work within a team-based environment.A continuous improvement and innovative mindsetInitiative to meet project milestones and deadlines.Competencies:Amcor Leadership Framework CompetenciesCore Competencies:Customer FocusLearning on the FlyDrive for Results3-5 Applicable ALF Competencies:Priority SettingManaging Vision & PurposeFunctional/Technical SkillsRelationships:Manager Advanced EngineeringMaterial ScientistProduct EngineerProcess EngineerQuality EngineerADA Requirements:Physical RequirementsNormal VisionDistant VisionNear VisionHearing/ ListeningSittingTalking/SpeakingHand/Finger DexterityWalkingStandingStoopingPushing/PullingBendingKneelingClimbingLifting (amount 50+ pounds)Carrying (amount 50+ pounds)Driving- ForkliftLifting (amount < 50 pounds)Carrying (amount < 50 pounds)Driving – Automobile/truck/vanWork Environment: Office Environment + Hybrid FlexibilityThe information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties, responsibilities, skills and/or abilities.#LI-Hybrid#LI-AB2IND123Our ExpectationsWe expect our people to be guided by The Amcor Way and demonstrate our Values every day to enable the business to win. We are winning when:Our people are engaged and developing as part of a high-performing Amcor teamOur customers grow and prosper from Amcor’s quality, service, and innovationOur investors benefit from Amcor’s consistent growth and superior returnsThe environment is better off because of Amcor’s leadership and productsEqual Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans/Sexual Orientation/Gender IdentityAmcor is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.If you would like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please click on the links "EEO is the and "EEO is the Law" Poster Supplement. Job Brief This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home.Crane Aerospace & Electronics has a unique and exciting career opportunity for a Systems Engineer II / III at our Burbank, CA location. Job Summary: This is a Senior Systems Engineer position that will perform engineering duties in researching, planning, designing, and developing products for use in the Aerospace marketplace. The Senior Systems Engineer works within a collaborative Integrated Product Team (IPT) environment managing requirements, defining architectures, performing integration testing and analysis. Crane Landing Systems has been the brake control system industry leader since introducing the first antiskid brake control system in 1947. This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home. Some conditions apply which will be discussed during the interview process. Full policy to be provided after hire. Essential Functions:Collaborate effectively with technical staff and cross functional groups to develop or test safety critical embedded software and systems. Perform analysis of requirements, design and code to assure compliance to standards and guidelines.Prepare technical documentation necessary to satisfy customer and program requirements.Contribute to all Systems Engineering aspects (architecture and components) from initial product research, architecture definition, requirements definition, systems verification, management and flow down to functional engineering groups. Support or lead the planning, modeling, simulation, specifications and integration of components that reside in a system comprised of electronic hardware, microcontrollers, embedded software or sensors. Act as a focal for hardware and software, mechanical systems, qualification, safety and reliability.Maintain hardware and software configurations during development, integration, flight test and certification. Help define the system architecture definition for landing systems with focus on brake control and monitoring systems in a structured environment to meet customer needs.Participate in the certification compliance activities of essential and critical level control systems for aircraft applications. Execute projects in accordance with schedules and budgets. Coordinate activities with others assigned within the Integrated Product Team. Minimum Qualifications :Experience: 3 to 5+ years of relevant work experience required.Knowledge: Understand Systems Engineering principles, including interpreting and writing requirements, system architectures and designs.     Experience of system development following industry recognized processes (e.g. ARP4754)Knowledge of requirements management, validation and verification.Skills/Abilities: Proficient with MS Office including Word, Excel and Outlook.     Working knowledge of requirements management tools (e.g. DOORS)Must demonstrate proficiency with verbal and written English for technical reports, presentations, analyses, or other communications at the appropriate level. Education/Certification: Must have a Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical, Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering (or equivalent) from a four-year college or university.Eligibility Requirement: This position requires access to controlled data or information and therefore only US persons will be considered. As a US Department of Defense contractor, we are bound by the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). Preferred Qualifications:Familiarity with modeling and simulation (ie. Simulink, SysML) a plus Experience leading system development activities following industry recognized processes (e.g. ARP4754A).Ability to interact with customers, provide superior technical, cost effective and schedule efficient solutions to complex engineering issues.Ability to lead systems team or cross functional engineering team on complex development programs.Ability to create and present systems material at Preliminary and Critical Design Reviews.Understanding and practical experience of DO-178C and DO-160.Aerospace industry development experience. Advanced degree in Systems Engineering, Modeling/Simulation, Controls, Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering About Crane: Crane Aerospace & Electronics supplies critical systems and components to the aerospace and defense markets. You’ll find Crane Aerospace & Electronics in some of the toughest environments: from engines to landing gear; from satellites to medical implants and from missiles to unmanned aerial systems (UAS). We are committed to operational excellence and world class processes. We employ Lean manufacturing techniques to optimize manufacturing efficiency and accuracy on all product lines. Our products are known for their technical strength, proven reliability and overall value. Several factors contribute to actual salary, including experience in a similar role or performing comparable job responsibilities, skills, training, and other qualifications. Compensation packages also include comprehensive benefits, 401K contribution and match, Paid Time Off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement and more. Systems Engineer II - $99,528 to $117,894 Systems Engineer III - $120,972 to $144,435 Some roles may be eligible for participation in performance-based bonus programs. You can see a list of our benefits at https://www.craneae.com/company/careers or visit our website at www.CraneAE.com for more information on our company and great opportunities. In our efforts to maintain a safe and drug-free workplace, Crane Aerospace & Electronics requires that candidates complete a satisfactory background check. FAA sensitive positions require employees to participate in a random drug test pool. Our continuous casting process is renowned for its high productivity and energy efficiency. We pride ourselves on our robust machine design and in-house manufacturing and assembly capabilities. The materials produced by our machines are used in many applications such as aluminum automotive body components, aluminum foil, lead-acid automotive batteries, and copper wire and cables.What we offer to you· Hazelett offers 24 plans through its medical coverage and for most of the plans, Hazelett pays 100% of the premiums.· Hazelett pays 100% of Dental Premiums for one of the best plans in the state.· Life, AD&D, Short-Term Disability Insurance.· Matching 401k after 90 days. Fully vested once you start contributing!· 8 Company Holidays.· 4 weeks of paid time off.· Use of our company beach. Degree in Electrical Engineering Technology. B.S. Degree preferred.· PLC programming experience.· Experience with electrical design engineering or industrial automation preferred.· Experience reading and designing electrical and mechanical schematics/drawings.· Knowledge of electro-mechanical machinery components, electrical assembly processes and techniques, and design engineering and industrial standards is essential.· Must be able to effectively prioritize, organize, and handle multiple projects.· Excellent oral and written communication skills.· Proficient in Microsoft Office Products including Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams, and PowerPoint.· Experience with CAD and CAE including the preparation of electrical engineering documentation.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftWork Location: In person

ENGINEER SYSTEMS 3 Location:   Newport News, Virginia, United States  Date: Nov 23, 2023  Req ID: 34552   Team: E92 E&D DIGITAL ENTERPRISE   Entity: Newport News Shipbuilding  US Citizenship Required for this Position: Yes   Full-Time  Shift: 1st   Relocation: Relocation assistance will be available   Virtual/Telework Opportunity: Yes - Occasional or hybrid telework available   Travel Requirement: Yes, 10%-25% of the time   Clearance Required: Yes- Final Clearance Required to Start Meet HII's Newport News Shipbuilding With more than 25,000 employees - including third-, fourth- and even fifth-generation shipbuilders - HII's Newport News Shipbuilding (NNS) division is the largest industrial employer in Virginia. We're the sole designer, builder and refueler of U.S. Navy nuclear aircraft carriers and one of two providers of U.S. Navy nuclear submarines. Our diverse and innovative team of professionals ranges from skilled trades to project managers, engineers and software developers to solution architects, technical subject matter experts, and system users. Anchored in our rich, 135-year history, we collaborate together at the forefront of technology, manufacturing, and integration of the most powerful and survivable naval ships in the world. Want to be part of the team? Apply today! We look forward to meeting you. The Role The Systems Engineer defines the requirements to design, develop, build, and maintain the tools, processes and data architecture of a Model Based Enterprise. Analyzes capabilities of existing and proposed systems, and develops technical, structural, and organizational specifications. Leads internal and external stakeholders through determining conditions and designing fully functional and secure digital solutions. Develops long-range objectives and strategic plans for digital engineering innovations, and effectively communicates documented data and results to necessary stakeholders. Generates and presents business case analyses to executive leadership to pursue digital enterprise opportunities. Enables digital transformation efforts by conducting research, driving new technical approaches and processes, as well as developing and managing testing of functionality.  Performs technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems. Analyses are performed at all levels of total system product to include: concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance and disposal. Ensures the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints. Performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications. Must Have Bachelor's Degree and 5 years of relevant exempt experience;   Master's Degree and 3 years of relevant professional experience;   Ph.D. and 0 years of experience.  Newport News Shipbuilding requires a Bachelor's Degree in engineering from an ABET accredited program. Job Description: The RF/Wireless Passive Component Design Engineer is an experienced professional with the capability to perform circuit design of passive waveguide and connectorized RF/microwave components. Able to synthesize and develop new passive components using CAE analysis tools and has hands-on bench troubleshoot and test skills. Effectively communicates with contacts inside and outside of own department, customers, and suppliers. Responsible for recommending enhancements to systems and processes. Possesses practical project management skills and will work to achieve technical performance while meeting schedule and cost operational targets for specific programs and projects with moderate impact on departmental results. Essential Functions: Design, develop, test and support production of passive waveguide and connectorized microwave circuits. Perform EM and linear simulations of microwave circuits, multi-layer boards, RF transitions and waveguide cavities. Perform RF/microwave component level system analysis. Develop specifications for microwave components and subassemblies. Generate test and data reports. Design for ease of manufacturing. Estimate and track project schedules and labor for engineering developments. Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or Electro physics and a minimum of 4 years prior relevant experience or a Graduate Degree and a minimum of 2 years prior related experience. A minimum of 2 years designing and simulating microwave passive circuits. RF/Microwave passive components include couplers, power dividers, attenuators, and terminations. Experienced user of microwave test equipment; including network analyzers, spectrum analyzers, power meters and signal generators. Use of linear circuit and EM structure CAE tools for design and analysis. Ability to gain Secret Level Security Clearance. Preferred Additional Skills: Design experience with active RF/microwave components. Components include, but are not limited to, low noise amplifiers, oscillators, synthesizers, and PIN diode circuits. Knowledge/application of filter synthesis and design. System analysis experience comprising both cascade and spur analysis. Ability to manage projects and interface effectively with other functional areas. Experience designing products for manufacturability. Proficient use of Keysight ADS, Keysight RFPro, Ansys HFSS simulation tools. Use of CAD tools such as AutoDesk Inventor and AutoCAD. Design/test experience of circuits operating through 26GHz is favored, with operation up through 40GHz further preferred. Experience with both chip and wire hybrid and PCB surface mount manufacturing methods. Hands-on experience testing and aligning fine pitch circuits under a microscope. What We Do  FOX Factory designs, engineers, manufactures and markets performance-defining products and systems for customers worldwide. Our premium brand, performance-defining products and systems are used primarily on bicycles, side-by-side vehicles, on-road vehicles with and without off-road capabilities, off-road vehicles and trucks, all-terrain vehicles, snowmobiles, specialty vehicles and applications, motorcycles, and commercial trucks. Some of our products are specifically designed for and marketed to a variety of leading cycling and powered vehicle original equipment manufacturers ("OEMs"), while others are distributed to consumers through a global dealer and distribution network. Fox Factory Holding Corp. is the holding company of FOX Factory, Inc. and is publicly traded (FOXF) on Nasdaq.   Why you should join us    Not only do we provide competitive wages, you will also have access to great benefits and employee    discounts. But more importantly, it’s a fun environment where we truly enjoy working as a team and    bringing great products to our customers!    If this sounds like something you would love to do, and a place you want to be a part of, get in touch    with us by submitting your application. We look forward to hearing from you!    Position Summary:    Apply shock building expertise to generate industry leading prototype products for our customers. Will be required to work in a fast-paced environment with numerous internal and external teams to meet deadlines.    Position Responsibilities:  Follows directions to modify or create CAD models and detail drawings. Use computer-assisted drafting (CAD) equipment and software. Assists with the drafting of final drawings. Uses mathematical formulas for calculations frequently. May utilize CAD/CAM/CAE or other mini or PC technology. Perform assembly tear downs for quick root cause analysis. Collect and aggregate component data into various software packages Perform basic data analysis guided by engineering team needs. Maintain measurement equipment for proper function, calibrations and necessary service or upgrades. Works in a safe manner in accordance with Fox policies. Specific Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required:  Ability to read and interpret complex drawings Excellent multi-tasker and handles pressure well Strong mathematical skills Knowledge of tools and their uses Quick learner Knowledge of applied GD&T (ASME Y14.5-2018) is a plus Working knowledge of Creo 6 or higher is a plus Experience machining and welding is a plus   Competencies:  Customer Mindset: Exceptional customer experience is primary focus while performing job duties. Quality is a top priority. Adaptability & Innovation: Proactively and willingly adapts to changing business needs and conditions and presents creative and fresh ideas on how to solve problems, gain efficiencies and improve quality. Relationship Building: Builds constructive working relationships characterized by a high level of inclusion, cooperation and mutual respect. Accountability: Takes personal responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work and strives to exceed requirements. $120,000 - 150,000 a year Location: Hauppauge Narda MITEQ is dedicated to recruiting and developing diverse, high-performing talent who are passionate about what they do. Our employees are unified in a shared dedication to our customers’ mission and quest for professional growth. Narda MITEQ provides an inclusive, engaging environment designed to empower employees and promote work-life success. Fundamental to our culture is an unwavering focus on values, dedication to our communities, and commitment to excellence in everything we do. The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all essential functions, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. Management retains the discretion to add or change the duties at any time. Job Description: The Senior RF/Wireless Integrated Microwave Assembly (IMA) Engineer is an experienced professional with proficient capability to perform RF/microwave circuit design and system cascade analysis. This individual shall possess practical knowledge of project management. She/he must be able to synthesize and develop new active and passive components using CAE analysis tools, and have hands on bench development and test skills. The person shall effectively communicate with contacts inside and outside of own department, customers, and suppliers. She/he will recommend enhancements to systems and processes. The individual will work to achieve technical performance while meeting schedule and cost operational targets for specific programs and projects with moderate impact on departmental results. Essential Functions: Design, develop, test and support production of active and passive microwave circuits and multi-function modules. Perform EM and linear simulations of microwave housings, transitions, and passive circuits. Perform linear and non-linear circuit simulations of microwave active circuits. Perform RF and microwave subassembly system analysis. Develop specifications for microwave components and subassemblies. Generate test and data reports. Design for ease of manufacturing. Estimate and track project schedules and labor for engineering developments. Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or Electrophysics and a minimum of 6 years of prior relevant experience or a Graduate Degree and a minimum of 4 years of prior related experience. A minimum of 3 years of microwave active circuit design and simulation experience in at least one, but preferably more, active component area. RF/Microwave active component areas include, but are not limited to, the following: oscillators, synthesizers, PIN diode circuits, low noise amplifiers, integrated microwave assemblies. Use and understanding of microwave test equipment including network analyzers, spectrum analyzers, power meters, and noise figure meters. Use of linear, non-linear, and structure simulation CAE tools for design analysis. Ability to gain Secret Level Security Clearance. Preferred Additional Skills: Design experience with low noise amplifier design and the design of passive components including coupling networks, power dividers, attenuators, isolators and detectors. Knowledge/application of filter synthesis and design. System analysis experience comprising both cascade and spur analysis. Ability to manage projects and interface effectively with other functional areas. Experience designing products for Manufacturing. Proficient use of Keysight ADS, Keysight RFPro CAE tools. Use of CAD tools such as AutoDesk Inventor and AutoCAD. Design/test experience of circuits operating through26GHz essential, with operation through 67GHz preferred. Experience designing with both chip and wire hybrid and PCB surface mount components. Hands-on experience testing and aligning fine pitch circuits under a microscope. Please be aware many of our positions require the ability to obtain a security clearance. Security clearances may only be granted to U.S. citizens. In addition, applicants who accept a conditional offer of employment may be subject to government security investigation(s) and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. About Us:  WHY WERNER? BECAUSE WE ARE THE PRO'S CHOICE! You will find our market leading products and brands on trucks and job sites all over the world.    Focusing on end users' needs drives our success. Our entire product development process—from research to engineering to manufacturing to commercialization—creates products that ensure ease of use, productivity, durability and safety for the end user. On jobsites across America and the world, WernerCo brands are most preferred.  Overview:   Carry out product design and development assignments of a routine to moderately complex nature with some latitude in the use of initiative and independent judgment under moderate supervision. Prepares sketches and completes detail and layout drawings from verbal or written instructions on product. Participate on cross functional teams, working with Project Engineers, Industrial Design, and Product Marketing to refine product requirements and deliver designs that balance cost, performance, and reliability. Prepares layout, detail, and assembly drawings independently and with support from internal designer resources. Various calculations such as strength of materials, simple forces and stresses, and weights, may be required. Responsibilities:  Design products to specifications and schedules for new products, cost improvements, and other business objectives. Develops Computer Aided Design (CAD) models of parts and assemblies and uses Computer Aided Engineering (CAE) software to optimize them for performance, quality and manufacturing. Use various tools to develop concepts for review/discussion with other departments, specifically marketing, project engineers and manufacturing. Partners with project engineers and industrial designers to ensure safety, product performance and aesthetic intent are met. Works with internal and external suppliers to refine the product design and optimize it for manufacturing. Participate in the creation and validation of prototypes to prove out design concepts, design changes, etc. Understands and applies federal, industry and internal standards and ensures products meet safety, compliance and performance requirements. Recommend and drive design improvements for cost, manufacturability and/or quality improvements on legacy products as needed. Develop layouts for medium scale programs to assist in the development of new products and/or sustaining engineering activities. This would include several concept options to full development of a solid model that represent ideas of the project team. Supports validation plan development, costing and capital expenditure activities and adjusts designs to meet program targets. Supports delivery of designs in accordance to WernerCo product development processes and milestones. Designers will take direction primarily from sr. engineers, managers or directors. Understand and follow Quality Management System. Qualifications:   Experience & Education BSME or similar Three to five years of designing components, assemblies and/or products utilizing CAD (AutoCAD 2D and SolidWorks 3D preferred) and product design fundamentals. Ability to finish design concepts with dimensional and GD&T features. Knowledge of consumer product development process including injection molding, forming, and/or extrusion, preferred Working knowledge of FEA or other CAE skill preferred Computer Skills – Intermediate PC software knowledge, specifically MS Excel and Word. Key Competencies Team Player - Must be comfortable working with other people in an open environment. Hands On Ability - Able to work with tools, comfortable in testing/prototype lab environment. Good interpersonal skills Good communication skills - verbal and written Problem analysis and problem-solving Attention to detail and accuracy Travel Requirements Willingness to travel as required to domestic and international engineering centers, manufacturing sites. Work Location: Hybrid remote in Itasca, IL  #LI-Hybrid EEO Statement:        WernerCo is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion. WernerCo is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. All qualified applicants to WernerCo are considered for employment without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status or any other protected characteristic. WernerCo will not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind based on these characteristics.

Job Summary The Senior Mechanical Engineer is responsible for the design, development and execution of core battery mechanical system components and assemblies. The individual will be responsible for defining, documenting, and designing battery pack and battery module mechanical and thermal components and assemblies, and overseeing validation of those components and assemblies. An effective candidate is comfortable applying technical knowledge to innovative designs, driving resolution of challenges, and taking ownership of new product development activities. ResponsibilitiesApply technical knowledge to the on-time delivery of work products through the product development life cycle for each project.Own the design & development of efficient designs for components & sub-assemblies.Work in concert with manufacturing engineers in the development of processes & tools supporting manufacture and assembly.Component definition, sizing, selection, and design of battery module & pack mechanical and thermal components (e.g., battery structure, enclosures, injection molded plastics, cooling plates, mechanical joining methods).Work closely with Systems Engineers and CAE Engineers to prove out design concepts prior to pack prototype builds.Act as a mentor and advisor to Design Release Engineers (DREs) on the team.Key contributor to mechanical system DFMEAs/PFMEAs, DVP&Rs and Product & Process design reviews.Lead supplier evaluation and development for responsible commodities, in collaboration with purchasing.Support prototype system builds by ensuring parts are on time and that issues are resolved in a timely manner.Other duties as assigned.Predictable and reliable attendance. Position QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Mechanical/Aerospace/Chemical Engineering or equivalent degree with relevant experience.Minimum of five (5) years of experience in high voltage (>350V) electrification product design or product development.Proficient in root cause analysis and resolution.Proficient in understanding CAE models, including deciphering boundary conditions, assumptions, and model limitations.Adept in data processing and statistical analysis.Effective communicator, capable of concisely presenting highly technical test data to internal and external customers, as well as effectively communicating with suppliers.Experienced with the design, handling, and manufacture of high voltage lithium-ion battery systems.Educated on common automotive & industry standards.Familiar with the product design process.Self-motivated problem solver; pays attention to the details.Challenges the status quo and strives for continuous improvement.Abides by safety standards and protocols. Key CompetenciesDecision Making & Analysis: Makes sound decisions based upon a mixture of data-driven analysis, expertise, experience, and judgment; collects relevant information, seeking input from others, and identifies connections and/or root causes of problems.Takes Initiative: Exhibits strong drive for results and success; conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure; persists despite obstacles and opposition.Continual Improvement: Displays a consistent orientation toward producing the highest quality products or services, while keeping a focus on sustainability. Constantly looking for incremental improvements in work processes and results.Delivers Results: Achievement oriented, feeling a sense of urgency to reach goals on time, if not before.Mission, Vision, Values, and Strategic Priorities Focused: Understands and actively supports the organization’s mission, vision, values, and strategic priorities.

Put a LIFT in Your Career! Hyster-Yale Group, Inc. (HYG), a world-class manufacturer of industrial lift trucks, has an outstanding opportunity for an exceptional and talented Electrical Engineer at our facility located in Greenville, NC.As an Electrical Engineer, you will work on the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, provide product design documentation through the creation of detail drawings, engineering lists and Engineering Change Notices (ECN) and integrate manufacturing input into the design of components, assemblies, or vehicle systems, and may participate in the support of manufacturing activities such as Pilot or 1st Production.As an Electrical Engineer you will also create product design documentation – such as CAE (computer aided engineering), 3-d models, detail drawings, engineering lists, reports, test plans and software coding – to support release of Change Orders describing component design revisions. You will translate truck-level and system-level requirements to component requirements and plan and support development testing to ensure design robustness to requirements. The Engineer IV will interface with component suppliers and internal customers (Platform, Manufacturing, Marketing, Service, etc.) to understand detailed product requirements and develop concepts for system design as well as supervise other engineers/technicians.Key AccountabilitiesDesign and develop components as required for lift truck vehiclesDesign and develop assemblies as required for lift truck vehicles and order prototype partsDesign and develop wire harnessThe Engineer IV will also, evaluate component design and assembly, build prototype vehicles, design and evaluate systems and plan and execute prototype test activitiesProvide design specification documentation as required to manufacture the product such as detail drawings, engineering list structure and ECN writingProvide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productProvide product/process specification documents, detailed drawings/software development, test engineering reports, sales and product information data and test plansDevelop product around the most efficient and cost-effective manufacturing processes, and provide on-site Engineering support during critical Manufacturing activities such as Pilot and 1st Production; integrate Manufacturing/Purchasing input basic designThe Engineer IV will also provide design and evaluation documentation as required to market, manufacture and service the productThe Engineer IV will also provide leadership and guidance to individuals and project teams to ensure project deliverables are metHR administration and local project supervisionThe Engineer IV will also provide design/test input to project proposals, research for future product projects and develop design and evaluation concepts which enable program and project decisionsAdditionally, the Engineer IV will devise plans for component strategy creation that take advantage of unapparent opportunities given technology advances aligned with corporate visionMinimum Qualifications:B.S., Engineering discipline, requiredOne-Five years industry experience. All skill levels will be considered.Beginner-Master level knowledge/skill in drawing practices, CAD, design layouts, engineering analysisBasic specialized knowledge/skill in vehicle/automotive technology, manufacturing technology, design/test experience, test practices and proceduresBasic specialized knowledge/skill in industry regulationsBasic knowledge in scheduling and supervisionProficient demonstration of the core competenciesPreferred Skills:NX and Zuken experienceWho we are: HYG designs, engineers, manufactures, sells and services a comprehensive line of lift trucks and aftermarket parts marketed globally under the Hyster and Yale brand names. We are one of the global leaders in the Material Handling industry and have been building relationships and partnering with our customers, suppliers, dealers and employees for over 90 years.What we offer: Hyster-Yale Group offers competitive pay, tuition reimbursement, supportive work environment, hybrid work option, and opportunities for growth and development. A full benefits package: paid time off; medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, employer-sponsored profit sharing and 401(k).#LI-OP#LI-ONSITEJob Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Dental insuranceLife insuranceTuition reimbursementVision insuranceWork Location: In person
