DescriptionHuman Resources Job Posting POSTING NO.: 101849 JOB TITLE: Field Equipment Engineer DEPT/DIV: M of E LOCATION: Manhattan - Midtown Full/Part Time: Full Application Deadline: Until Filled Compensation Grade F Established rate: $112,904.19 Opening: MTA Metro-North Railroad is a dynamic organization, operating out of the jewel of New York City, Grand Central Terminal. We provide service to over 86.5 million customers, traveling in and out of New York and Connecticut. A subsidiary of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, Metro-North Railroad is one of the busiest commuter railroad in the nation. MTA Metro-North Railroad strives to provide a safe and reliable commute, excellent customer service and rewarding opportunities to its employees. Position Objective Provide various engineering services to support the safe and reliable operation of the Metro-North Railroad rolling stock fleet. Engineering services include: Electrical, Mechanical, Manufacturing, Industrial, and Materials Engineering, advanced analytic services for Reliability Centered Maintenance, Reliability Availability and Maintainability, and Enterprise Asset Management, Quality functions, Technical Support, and Maintenance Planning. RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop equipment modifications. Review and process Equipment Change Requests (ECRs), design the equipment modifications, and write the instructions for implementation of such modifications. Develop Equipment Maintenance Instructions (EMIs), Equipment Overhaul Instructions (EOIs), and Maintenance Service Bulletin MSB) to create a standard of good maintenance and safety practice and to convey emergency repair information. Participate and provide engineering expertise in preparation of technical specifications and procurement of new fleet and overhaul of existing fleet and system. Support Revenue Service Operations proactively utilizing Wayside Monitoring and Diagnostic System (WMDS), Chief Logs, and IMS/AMS data management systems to minimize operational risk and identify trends. Retrieve and review downloads such as Real Time Data Monitoring (RTDM) and Event Recorder (ER) for train incidents and failure investigations. Provide technical evaluations detailing cause and corrective actions. Provide oversight and guidance to shop personnel for failure investigations, troubleshooting and repairs of all rolling stock. Utilize engineering principles in component failure analysis and provide detailed findings and technical bases for cause and resolution. Effectively contribute to the functions of all MofE departments, other Metro-North Railroad departments, other MTA agencies to support the rolling stock fleet reliability and operations efficiency. The Field Equipment Engineer coordinates directly with the Senior Field Equipment Engineer, Deputy Directors, and Director – Equipment Engineering, the Deputy Director – Quality Assurance, Maintenance Production staff of the M of E Department, as the projects assigned encompass the entire passenger railcar/locomotive fleet for the Railroad. The Field Equipment Engineer coordinates with MNR Capital Engineering and Consulting Engineers for information on the design and maintenance of new and rebuilt railcars and locomotives. The Field Equipment Engineer works closely with the Maintenance Production Staff and Shop Operational workforce on recommendations for improvement of cars and/or systems and subsystems. The Field Equipment Engineer coordinates with other passenger railroads to identify similar problems encountered and corrective actions taken. The Field Equipment Engineer interacts with other Operating Departments (Transportation, Power, etc.) when problems related to both departments requiring joint review and solution. Required Qualifications Must demonstrate a technical knowledge of either electrical or mechanical equipment systems to include, but not limited to, controls, power and pneumatic, microprocessor-based, high voltage, low voltage, system interfaces, and mechanical systems. Must be capable of interpreting existing electrical schematics and vendor supplied wiring, piping, diagrams necessary for troubleshooting rolling stock systems, subsystems and component-level. Strong problem solving and analytical skills to diagnose fleet problems and provide acceptable recommendations to maintenance supervision or workforce. Ability to understand regulatory rules and guidelines including FRA and APTA. Good interpersonal, organizational and both oral and written communication skills will all levels of MNR personnel. Working knowledge of test and diagnostic equipment. Experience in configuring replacement components and system assemblies for fit, form and function applications. Ability to determine appropriate functional requirements for equipment systems with regards to design and maintenance, based on reliability and risk analysis. Familiarity with FRA regulations, APTA standards as well as other industry related engineering standards. Strong written and oral communication skills. Strong technical writing skills for development of correspondence, reports, procedures and technical Instructions. Knowledge of standard safety practices rules and regulations in a railroad environment. Knowledge in the review and development of drawings, specifications and technical reports. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and/or comparable applications. CAD/CAE and Auto CAD experience or demonstrated equivalent. Position may be required to work various shifts and locations as assigned to support a 24-hour day/, 7 days a week operation. Will be on call and respond to emergencies as required. Must have valid driver's license. Required Education/Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or related technical field. Minimum of three (3) years of experience in an engineering environment and/or equipment manufacturer working on passenger railcars and/or locomotives or related mass transportation equipment or completion of the Metro-North Railroad Associate Engineer Program. Preferred Education/Experience Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering and/or Professional Engineering License. Other Information This is a safety sensitive position and subject to toxicology testing. As an employee of Metro-North Railroad you may be required to complete a New York State financial disclosure statement, if you earn more than $108,638.00 or if you hold a position designated as a policy maker. Employees driving company vehicles must complete defensive driver training once every three years for current MNR drivers; or within 180 days of hire or transfer for an employee entering an authorized driving position. Selection Criteria: Due to the competitive nature of the selection process, not all qualified candidates who meet the minimum requirements for the position are guaranteed an interview. To be selected for a position, one must meet the following criteria: (1) satisfy the minimum requirements listed in the job posting, (2) if applicable, successfully pass a written and practical exam, (3) satisfy a background investigation (including but not limited to, employment, education, and criminal history), and (4) pass a verbal interview. Metro-North may also require the applicant to undergo a physical ability test, and, if the Company extends a conditional offer, may require him or her to undergo a medical examination, which may include toxicological testing. Failure to pass any step within the hiring process will result in the disqualification of your application. Additional Criteria for Current Employees: Current Metro-North employees must be in active service to be eligible for consideration. Agreement Employees applying for a position outside of their present craft are required to have worked in your current union for at least one (1) year preceding the Application Deadline to be eligible to apply for a posted position, and have completed the agreed upon formal training commitment, including on-the-job training or lock-in requirement, if applicable (for example: Signal Trainee, Foreman-In-Training, etc.). If you are transferring to another craft, you may be required to forfeit your seniority in your present union. Non-agreement employees must have worked in your current position for a minimum of one (1) year preceding the Application Deadline. Along with a background investigation (including but not limited to, employment, education, and criminal history), employees are also subject to an internal investigation, which includes an evaluation not limited to discipline records and performance assessments. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package. If interested, please apply online at www.mta.info HOW TO APPLY: ALL APPLICANTS MUST APPLY ONLINE TO BE CONSIDERED. METRO-NORTH NO LONGER ACCEPTS HARD COPIES OF RESUMES. Qualified applicants can submit an online application by clicking on the 'APPLY NOW' button from either the CAREERS page or from the JOB DESCRIPTION page.  If you have previously applied on line for other positions, enter your User Name and Password. If it is your first registration, click on the CLICK HERE TO REGISTER hyperlink and enter a User Name and Password; then click on the REGISTER button. When applying for positions, please ensure that you attach a resume during the application process and that you receive a confirmation e-mail that your application was accepted. If you do not receive an email confirmation, your application may not have been received and will not be able to be considered after the deadline date. If you encounter problems, please call the BSC Customer Management Center at (646) 376-0123 Monday through Friday (except MTA-HQ holidays), 8:30am - 5:00pm. EMPLOYEES WHO DO NOT APPLY ON LINE VIA THE INTRANET MAY BE DISQUALIFIED FOR FURTHER CONSIDERATION FOR THIS POSITION. MTA and its subsidiary and affiliated agencies are Equal Opportunity Employers, including with respect to veteran status and individuals with disabilities. The MTA encourages qualified applicants from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and abilities, including military service members, to apply. MTA is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

CAE ENGINEER Location: US        Date: Nov 3, 2023                    CAE Engineer                        JOB SUMMARY                       CAE Engineer will be responsible to design chassis parts which meets all the requirements of different OEMs.             As part of this he will work very closely with Design Engineering team members.                        DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES                       To process a chassis component from pre-concept to production which typically includes the following key tasks:             1. Generate CAE models from concept designs, identifying problems and solutions and delivering detailed results             2. Build CAE models quickly meeting quality guidelines.             3. Liaise with customers’ Engineers to understand CAE requirements and deliverables.             4. Perform CAE analysis as per customer requirements             5. Work concurrently with CAD Design Engineer to develop appropriate structural solutions to meet performance requirements             6. Understand package restrictions from customers and ensure CAE proposals are production and manufacturing feasible             7. Arrange and lead CAE reviews.             8. Identify any training requirements and follow up.             9. The CAE Design Analyst will be expected to travel as required to support customer and company objectives. Approx. 90% of time will be spent on CAE in the office.                        EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE                       1. Minimum of four year engineering degree (major in Mechanical engineering) with CAE experience, though a Master’s degree is preferred.             2. 3-5 years’ experience in automotive CAE engineering design (preferably in chassis components)             3. Proficient in building quality CAE models quickly using Hypermesh or Ansa             4. Experienced with usage of Abaqus and Nastran             5. Experience with Optistruct, Design Life Fatigue analysis, Hypermorph is a plus.                       KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES                       1. Good communication skills to interact at all levels across the business including customers and suppliers             2. Strong team-working skills, decision-making, and ability to provide direction as appropriate.             3. Strong ability to mesh models primarily for Durability with emphasis on quality and timing             4. Ability to perform nonlinear and linear CAE analysis, including debugging convergence and other issues with Abaqus.             5. The ability to guide in generating design concepts that are fit for purpose, directionally correct and support the company’s overall objectives and strategy             6. Ability to understand, interpret and act upon results from analysis to optimize component designs             7. Knowledge of Microsoft software such as Excel, PowerPoint and Word             8. An understanding of stamping, tooling and welding processes would be a benefit. Strong ability to mesh models primarily for Durability with emphasis on quality and timing             4. Ability to perform nonlinear and linear CAE analysis, including debugging convergence and other issues with Abaqus.             5. The ability to guide in generating design concepts that are fit for purpose, directionally correct and support the company’s overall objectives and strategy             6. Ability to understand, interpret and act upon results from analysis to optimize component designs             7. Knowledge of Microsoft software such as Excel, PowerPoint and Word             8. An understanding of stamping, tooling and welding processes would be a benefit.           We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and seek to hire the best candidate regardless of age, beliefs, disability, ethnicity, gender or sexual orientation.About us We are a multi-technology company present in over 20 countries and our team of over 40,000 is made up of 90 different nationalities. They are the driving force of our company, which designs, develops and produces parts for over 900 models of the leading vehicle manufacturers, and enable us to be one of the top suppliers worldwide.Do you have what it takes to build the future of mobility with us?You will be joining a leading international group in the automotive sector with a clear commitment to innovation, a trail-blazer in Industry 4.0 and engaged with ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) criteria.This is an opening to build a career in a global environment with many opportunities to grow both professionally and personally by participating and leading innovative and international projects.You will find a supportive and friendly environment where the emphasis is on team work, continuous improvement, trust, a dynamic spirit and thinking outside the box, and a passion for a job well done.You will be working with highly qualified professionals as Gestamp is committed to the ongoing training of our teams.Join the Gestamp team!

PRODUCT DESIGN ENGINEER Location: US        Date: Nov 3, 2023                    Product Design Engineer - Auburn Hills R&D                        JOB SUMMARY                       Product Design Engineer will be responsible to design chassis parts which meets all the requirements of different OEMs.             As part of this he will work very closely with other team members including CAE, forming and process.                        DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES                       To process a chassis component from pre-concept to production which typically includes the following key tasks:             1. The Product Design Engineer will be expected to travel as required to support customer and company objectives. Approx. 80% of time will be spent on CAD in the office             2. Generate concept designs, identifying problems and solutions and delivering detailed designs             3. Ensure component designs are production feasible, using Design for Manufacture/Assembly             4. Support prototype build, product testing, product design timing plans and ongoing production needs             5. Liaise with customers’ Engineers to achieve design requirements             6. Obtain and control package information from customers             7. Produce three dimensional solid models to support customer requirements             8. Produce two dimensional Engineering drawings for prototype/production use with capable dimensional tolerances/GDT             9. Work concurrently with CAE Design Analyst to develop appropriate structural solutions to meet performance requirements             10. Arrange and lead design / feasibility reviews and ensure all released designs have formal manufacturing feasibility approval             11. Support DFMEA, VA/VE, QFD and GDT team reviews             12. Ensure departmental project compliance with ISO/TS16949             13. Identify any training requirements and follow up.                       EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE                       1. Minimum of two year degree with experience though a four-year college degree is preferred with a major in engineering.             2. 3-5 years’ experience automotive engineering design (preferably in chassis components)             3. Proficient in CATIA V5. Solid and surface modelling             4. Knowledge of Siemens NX (UG) and TeamCenter is an added plus             5. Experience with DFMEA                        KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES                       1. An understanding of stamping, tooling and welding processes would be a benefit.             2. An understanding of CAD requirements and highly skilled in CATIA V5.             3. Understanding of drafting standards and geometric dimensioning and tolerancing.             4. Good communication skills to interact at all levels across the business including customers and suppliers             5. The ability to generate design concepts that are fit for purpose, directionally correct and support the company’s overall objectives and strategy             6. Ability to understand, interpret and act upon results from design analysis to optimize component designs             7. Knowledge of Microsoft software such as Excel, PowerPoint and Word             8. Strong team-working skills, decision-making, and ability to provide direction as appropriate. Description:  Work in a fast-paced team environment while seeing ideas come to life. The Mechanical Engineer is responsible for engineering related tasks for Continuous Improvement support at Freeman Boatworks with an emphasis on evaluation, analysis, coordination, and implementation from lamination to water test. This will include the use of Computer Aided Engineering (CAE) tools to generate 3D surface models for large and small fiberglass parts, solid modeling for components and systems as well as 2D documentation. Roles and Responsibilities Generate 3D surface models for fiberglass parts included but not limited to decks, liners, and small parts to be utilized for 5-axis milling and tooling design. Support manufacturing and customer service on issues resolution Generate, review, and approve engineering change notices (ECNs) as required. Provide accurate material and component specification for the sourcing of new and replacement components. Utilize warranty data to identify issues related to mechanical systems for mitigation purposes. Design, engineer, and validate complex hinges and mechanisms for supplier fabrication using 3D models and 2D specification drawings. Work with suppliers on the development of new systems and components to ensure continuous improvement in the quality and value of our boats systems. Ensure that designs have been fully validated and that they meet necessary system specifications and performance requirements. Support the development of fabrication/assembly fixtures and tools. Coordinate efforts as necessary between Product Development and Engineering, Operations, Purchasing, Quality and suppliers. Create, organize and update CAD part drawings and manufacturing documentation; review drawings for accuracy and compliance to set engineering standards and gather as-built information to ensure accuracy. Contribute and Lead problem solving activities and cost reduction tasks. Support & Lead engineering continuous improvement initiatives. Create preliminary concept models with 2D & 3D representations utilizing Solid Works 3D modeling tools. Requirements:   Education/Training Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, Naval Architecture, Marine Engineering, or related discipline Experience and Skills Good understanding of composite construction, design, and processes. Strong Computer Aided Design skills (Rhinoceros, Siemens NX, SolidWorks, Catia, Creo or Pro-E) Knowledge of GD&T print documentation Lean Six Sigma certification or experience is a plus. Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Must interface well with other employee’s and departments throughout Freeman Boatworks as well as outside vendors and customers. Must have good written and verbal skills necessary to communicate effectively with all levels of management. Excellent organizational and time management skills. Able to handle multiple projects efficiently and effectively. Strong attention to detail. Strong accurate analytical problem-solving skills Ability to independently analyze risk, make recommendations to the appropriate authority and when solicited make decisions. Bring something new to our team so that we can learn as much from you as you will from us While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts; high, precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; and toxic or caustic chemicals. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

We're ALTEN Technology USA, an engineering company that provides solutions for engineering, technology, and product development projects. For decades, we've been helping our clients develop products that are changing the world, whether that's by shaping the future of space exploration, saving lives with medical devices that set a new standard of care, or creating the fully autonomous electric taxi of tomorrow. Our team of more than 600 people works across industries including aerospace, medical devices and life sciences, unmanned systems and robotics, automotive OEM and tier 1 suppliers, commercial vehicle, electric vehicles, rail, and more. Our offices across the US have different industry focuses and engage with our clients in different ways, ranging from working on-site at client facilities to performing product development at our delivery centers.ALTEN Group, our parent company, has been a leader in engineering and information technology for more than 30 years. ALTEN Group operates in 30 countries across Europe, North America, Asia, Africa and the Middle East and employs more than 36,000 people, 88% of whom are engineers. The company covers the whole development cycle and offers a choice of service levels, from technology consulting to complete project outsourcing.When you join ALTEN Technology USA, you join a group of people passionate about collaborating to solve some of the world's most technical engineering challenges. Our success is tied to taking care of our employees by building relationships and providing opportunities for mentorship and career growth. We offer comprehensive benefits for all full-time employees, including medical, dental, and vision insurance; a 401(k) plan with employer matching; paid time off (PTO); paid parental leave; and mentorship to help you take your career to the next level. You don't have to take our word for it that we are a great place to work—we were named on the 2023 Top Workplaces list thanks to feedback from our proud employees.Job Description: BS Degree or higher in ME. Minimum of 6+ years of industry experience in using and developing CAE methods. This role will be responsible to create and validate CAE methods and processes related to Optimization of 1D/3D CAE models, Automation of CAE workflows, and robustness (stochastic) processes. Expectations are proficiency with CAE software such as iSight and modeFRONTIER along with experience with various CAE software such as Abaqus, Nastran, StarCCM+, GT-Suite, SimPack, AmeSim, Hypermesh and Ansa are preferred. Also proficient with programming language software such as Matlab, Python, and VBA. Related advanced degree may be substituted for 2 years of experience.

CAE Engineer - Finite Elemental Analysis: FEA Engineer (Rochester, NY or Toronto, Canada)
column7: At SimuTech Group, we truly believe that we are driving innovation and changing the world through the power of engineering simulation. Our growing team of energetic, tech savvy professionals work hard every day to inspire our clients to push the boundaries of innovation and deliver transformational products. If you are motivated and driven by a culture where excellent work ethic and passion are rewarded, then a career with SimuTech Group may be for you! Looking for your next career move? Help today’s engineers build tomorrow’s products by providing solutions and guidance with the power of simulation. We are looking for a Mechanical Engineer with 1 to 3 years of experience to join our world-class FEA Support and Consulting team! This position will be based out of our office in Rochester, NY or Toronto, Canada. The right candidate will become a key member of our technical staff; working and learning in an exciting and challenging technical environment. Success of the Mechanical Engineer will be measured not only by helping to grow SimuTech’s FEA business, but also by continued development of your own technical skills by solving challenging problems in a wide variety of industries. Each member of our staff is a FEA expert who also maintains expertise in one or more specialized fields. Many of our engineers hold advanced degrees with extensive experience in the engineering consulting business. We maintain a high level of professionalism in a friendly, cooperative, flexible environment. let Essential Job Functions/Accountabilities: The Mechanical Engineer will use software such as ANSYS Mechanical and Mechanical APDL to provide: 1. Technical Support - Provide Support to end users of ANSYS by phone, e-mail, or in person. 2. Pre-sales Support - Work with our account managers to determine the customer's software needs, answer customer technical questions during the sales process and provide software demos/presentations on a variety of subjects. 3. Consulting Work with customers to determine their analysis requirements and expectations. Develop quotes/proposals by determining scopes, costs and schedules Perform all aspects of analysis (Meshing, Load Cases, Solving, Post Processing, Conclusions) Work with customers to propose alternative design ideas Write analysis reports and other technical documents requested by the customer 4. Technical Training - Teach ANSYS classes at client sites, on-line, and in SimuTech offices across the U.S. and Canada Desired Skills/Experience: Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria: Must be permanently authorized to work in the US or Canada Professional appearance and presentation required. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Must be able to work well in a group and independently. Excellent English-based communication skills, technical writing and verbal skills required. Documented industry experience with enterprise level finite element analysis tools Ansys (preferred). Abacus, Nastran, Altair, etc: ANSYS Ability to communicate with customers on a technical pre-sales basis to help drive software and services sales Creativity Superb problem-solving and analytical skills Solid theoretical background in structural mechanics and numerical methods backed up by real-world, production-level experience Documented experience (as evidenced by industry experience and/or publications in reputable journals) in at least one of these areas:                         Structural linear and non-linear static implicit analysis methods (non-linear materials including plasticity and hyper elasticity as well as contact and large strain/large deformation) Implicit dynamics including linear (modal, harmonic, response spectrum, random vibration) and thermal analysis including both steady-state and time domain transient. Explicit dynamics modeling experience (crash impact, metal forming simulations, etc.) using LS-Dyna, Autodyn, or Abaqus Explicit Familiarity with grid generation and meshing techniques (Ansys CAE, Femap, Hypermesh) Personable attitude with an ability to work well with clients and other staff Bachelor's degree in engineering required; master's degree considered a plus Helpful Qualifications/Non-requirements: ANSYS programming skills, including GUI customization in J-script and Python Explicit dynamics modeling experience (crash impact, metal forming simulations, etc.) using LS-Dyna, Autodyn, or Abaqus Explicit Ability to use 3-D CAD to modify parts and assemblies (SpaceClaim Direct Modeler, DM, Solidworks, ProE or Siemens NX preferred) Practical ANSYS experience manipulating and/or modeling complex 3-D assemblies Academic background or work experience in fluid mechanics and CFD Experience with optimization and DOE methods LF/Maxwell experience Concrete modeling experience a plus. Benefits: Medical insurance 100% paid for by employer (no employee out-of-pocket costs required for the premiums, deductibles, and copays) Dental insurance premiums 100% paid for by employer Vision insurance premiums 100% paid for by employer Short Term Disability Long Term Disability 401k Plan with employer match Limited Flexible Spending Account Life Insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Referral program Tuition reimbursement Bonus plan Salary Range: $60,000 - $90,000 (depends on education and experience) ABOUT THE COMPANY: We have a 35+ year relationship with ANSYS and we are their largest Elite Channel Partner in North America. We provide world-class ANSYS engineering simulation software as well as support, training, consulting and physical testing services. We are headquartered in Rochester, NY with additional offices in Cleveland, Seattle, Montreal, and Toronto. We also have remote sales and engineering personnel throughout North America. SimuTech Group employs over 140 people with nearly half being engineers; most holding Master's or PhD degrees. SimuTech Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

About Us:  WHY WERNER? BECAUSE WE ARE THE PRO'S CHOICE! You will find our market leading products and brands on trucks and job sites all over the world.    Focusing on end users' needs drives our success. Our entire product development process—from research to engineering to manufacturing to commercialization—creates products that ensure ease of use, productivity, durability and safety for the end user. On jobsites across America and the world, WernerCo brands are most preferred.  Overview:   Carry out product design and development assignments of a routine to moderately complex nature with some latitude in the use of initiative and independent judgment under moderate supervision. Prepares sketches and completes detail and layout drawings from verbal or written instructions on product. Participate on cross functional teams, working with Project Engineers, Industrial Design, and Product Marketing to refine product requirements and deliver designs that balance cost, performance, and reliability. Prepares layout, detail, and assembly drawings independently and with support from internal designer resources. Various calculations such as strength of materials, simple forces and stresses, and weights, may be required. Responsibilities:  Design products to specifications and schedules for new products, cost improvements, and other business objectives. Develops Computer Aided Design (CAD) models of parts and assemblies and uses Computer Aided Engineering (CAE) software to optimize them for performance, quality and manufacturing. Use various tools to develop concepts for review/discussion with other departments, specifically marketing, project engineers and manufacturing. Partners with project engineers and industrial designers to ensure safety, product performance and aesthetic intent are met. Works with internal and external suppliers to refine the product design and optimize it for manufacturing. Participate in the creation and validation of prototypes to prove out design concepts, design changes, etc. Understands and applies federal, industry and internal standards and ensures products meet safety, compliance and performance requirements. Recommend and drive design improvements for cost, manufacturability and/or quality improvements on legacy products as needed. Develop layouts for medium scale programs to assist in the development of new products and/or sustaining engineering activities. This would include several concept options to full development of a solid model that represent ideas of the project team. Supports validation plan development, costing and capital expenditure activities and adjusts designs to meet program targets. Supports delivery of designs in accordance to WernerCo product development processes and milestones. Designers will take direction primarily from sr. engineers, managers or directors. Understand and follow Quality Management System. Qualifications:   Experience & Education BSME or similar Three to five years of designing components, assemblies and/or products utilizing CAD (AutoCAD 2D and SolidWorks 3D preferred) and product design fundamentals. Ability to finish design concepts with dimensional and GD&T features. Knowledge of consumer product development process including injection molding, forming, and/or extrusion, preferred Working knowledge of FEA or other CAE skill preferred Computer Skills – Intermediate PC software knowledge, specifically MS Excel and Word. Key Competencies Team Player - Must be comfortable working with other people in an open environment. Hands On Ability - Able to work with tools, comfortable in testing/prototype lab environment. Good interpersonal skills Good communication skills - verbal and written Problem analysis and problem-solving Attention to detail and accuracy Travel Requirements Willingness to travel as required to domestic and international engineering centers, manufacturing sites. Work Location: Hybrid remote in Itasca, IL  #LI-Hybrid EEO Statement:        WernerCo is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion. WernerCo is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. All qualified applicants to WernerCo are considered for employment without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status or any other protected characteristic. WernerCo will not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind based on these characteristics.

Founded in 1918, Kearfott Corporation, a global Aerospace and Defense supplier for over 100 years, is a leader in the design and manufacture of precision motion control products and inertial navigation components. Kearfott has a very long history of innovation and excellence, and is the go-to brand for many of our global clients. Kearfott is trusted, respected and plays a vital role in the success of America’s aerospace and defense industries. With over a century of expertise & experience, Kearfott is dedicated to providing quality, reliability, and cutting-edge technology to customers worldwide to meet their sea, land, air, and space navigation and guidance requirements. Kearfott offers a comprehensive benefits package including a 401K, and Tuition Reimbursement. We offer a 9/80 schedule with every other Friday off. We are looking for talented individuals who want to be part of a world-class work force. Join Kearfott and become part of a company that is recognized for technical expertise and respected world-wide as a ‘full service’ provider. For more information, visit our website at www.kearfott.com Position Description This role is an internal contributor to the wound components team. The team’s focus is the design and development of Motors, Resolvers, LVDTs and RVDTs for use in the aerospace and defense markets. Level 2 Engineers are responsible for contributing to the design and development of Motors, Resolvers, RVDTs, and LVDTs for use in the aerospace and defense markets. This position will gain an extensive understanding of the electromagnetic behavior and optimization of these devices, an educational background in these devices is a benefit. Taking cues from more senior team members, you will be responsible for assisting in the development of position sensors and motors for both customer funded projects and internal projects. This work includes 3D modeling, drawing creation, tolerance stack-ups, structural analysis, electro-magnetic analysis, and report and presentation creation. Essential FunctionsDevelopment of new design concepts for customer applications using 3D modeling software such as SolidWorksAid in the development of performance models using analytical tools such as ANSYS, MATLAB, MathCAD, or JMAGValidation of performance models through test and data analysisCost estimation for new designsDevelopment of design proposals (technical writing)Support production activities as needed Technical aptitude and understanding of:3D modeling software such as SolidWorksStatistical data analysisOther CAE tools, such as MATLAB or ANSYSTolerance stackup analysis and GD&TUnderstanding of manufacturing and design trade-offs (practical implementation of designs), design to cost, design for manufacturability Required Skills Critical CompetenciesCustomer centric attitudeExcellent oral and written communication skillsExcellent presentation skills and presentation preparation (design reviews, marketing presentations, etc.)Ability to lead effectively in a cross functional team environmentAbility to effectively communicate, in writing and verbally, across functional areasDrives for results; action orientedContinuously improves in all aspects Required Experience Education & ExperienceMinimum of 2 years’ engineering experience working in a manufacturing environment, preferably in the aerospace industryBS in Physics, Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics or EquivalentMust be legally authorized to work in the US, visa sponsorship not available. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Job Brief This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home.Crane Aerospace & Electronics has a unique and exciting career opportunity for a Systems Engineer II / III at our Burbank, CA location. Job Summary: This is a Senior Systems Engineer position that will perform engineering duties in researching, planning, designing, and developing products for use in the Aerospace marketplace. The Senior Systems Engineer works within a collaborative Integrated Product Team (IPT) environment managing requirements, defining architectures, performing integration testing and analysis. Crane Landing Systems has been the brake control system industry leader since introducing the first antiskid brake control system in 1947. This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home. Some conditions apply which will be discussed during the interview process. Full policy to be provided after hire. Essential Functions:Collaborate effectively with technical staff and cross functional groups to develop or test safety critical embedded software and systems. Perform analysis of requirements, design and code to assure compliance to standards and guidelines.Prepare technical documentation necessary to satisfy customer and program requirements.Contribute to all Systems Engineering aspects (architecture and components) from initial product research, architecture definition, requirements definition, systems verification, management and flow down to functional engineering groups. Support or lead the planning, modeling, simulation, specifications and integration of components that reside in a system comprised of electronic hardware, microcontrollers, embedded software or sensors. Act as a focal for hardware and software, mechanical systems, qualification, safety and reliability.Maintain hardware and software configurations during development, integration, flight test and certification. Help define the system architecture definition for landing systems with focus on brake control and monitoring systems in a structured environment to meet customer needs.Participate in the certification compliance activities of essential and critical level control systems for aircraft applications. Execute projects in accordance with schedules and budgets. Coordinate activities with others assigned within the Integrated Product Team. Minimum Qualifications :Experience: 3 to 5+ years of relevant work experience required.Knowledge: Understand Systems Engineering principles, including interpreting and writing requirements, system architectures and designs.     Experience of system development following industry recognized processes (e.g. ARP4754)Knowledge of requirements management, validation and verification.Skills/Abilities: Proficient with MS Office including Word, Excel and Outlook.     Working knowledge of requirements management tools (e.g. DOORS)Must demonstrate proficiency with verbal and written English for technical reports, presentations, analyses, or other communications at the appropriate level. Education/Certification: Must have a Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical, Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering (or equivalent) from a four-year college or university.Eligibility Requirement: This position requires access to controlled data or information and therefore only US persons will be considered. As a US Department of Defense contractor, we are bound by the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). Preferred Qualifications:Familiarity with modeling and simulation (ie. Simulink, SysML) a plus Experience leading system development activities following industry recognized processes (e.g. ARP4754A).Ability to interact with customers, provide superior technical, cost effective and schedule efficient solutions to complex engineering issues.Ability to lead systems team or cross functional engineering team on complex development programs.Ability to create and present systems material at Preliminary and Critical Design Reviews.Understanding and practical experience of DO-178C and DO-160.Aerospace industry development experience. Advanced degree in Systems Engineering, Modeling/Simulation, Controls, Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering About Crane: Crane Aerospace & Electronics supplies critical systems and components to the aerospace and defense markets. You’ll find Crane Aerospace & Electronics in some of the toughest environments: from engines to landing gear; from satellites to medical implants and from missiles to unmanned aerial systems (UAS). We are committed to operational excellence and world class processes. We employ Lean manufacturing techniques to optimize manufacturing efficiency and accuracy on all product lines. Our products are known for their technical strength, proven reliability and overall value. Several factors contribute to actual salary, including experience in a similar role or performing comparable job responsibilities, skills, training, and other qualifications. Compensation packages also include comprehensive benefits, 401K contribution and match, Paid Time Off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement and more. Systems Engineer II - $99,528 to $117,894 Systems Engineer III - $120,972 to $144,435 Some roles may be eligible for participation in performance-based bonus programs. You can see a list of our benefits at https://www.craneae.com/company/careers or visit our website at www.CraneAE.com for more information on our company and great opportunities. In our efforts to maintain a safe and drug-free workplace, Crane Aerospace & Electronics requires that candidates complete a satisfactory background check. FAA sensitive positions require employees to participate in a random drug test pool. This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work being performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Crane Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, genetic information, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law. #LI-MD1 #CAE

ENGINEER SYSTEMS 3 Location:   Newport News, Virginia, United States  Date: Nov 23, 2023  Req ID: 34552   Team: E92 E&D DIGITAL ENTERPRISE   Entity: Newport News Shipbuilding  US Citizenship Required for this Position: Yes   Full-Time  Shift: 1st   Relocation: Relocation assistance will be available   Virtual/Telework Opportunity: Yes - Occasional or hybrid telework available   Travel Requirement: Yes, 10%-25% of the time   Clearance Required: Yes- Final Clearance Required to Start Meet HII's Newport News Shipbuilding With more than 25,000 employees - including third-, fourth- and even fifth-generation shipbuilders - HII's Newport News Shipbuilding (NNS) division is the largest industrial employer in Virginia. We're the sole designer, builder and refueler of U.S. Navy nuclear aircraft carriers and one of two providers of U.S. Navy nuclear submarines. Our diverse and innovative team of professionals ranges from skilled trades to project managers, engineers and software developers to solution architects, technical subject matter experts, and system users. Anchored in our rich, 135-year history, we collaborate together at the forefront of technology, manufacturing, and integration of the most powerful and survivable naval ships in the world. Want to be part of the team? Apply today! We look forward to meeting you. The Role The Systems Engineer defines the requirements to design, develop, build, and maintain the tools, processes and data architecture of a Model Based Enterprise. Analyzes capabilities of existing and proposed systems, and develops technical, structural, and organizational specifications. Leads internal and external stakeholders through determining conditions and designing fully functional and secure digital solutions. Develops long-range objectives and strategic plans for digital engineering innovations, and effectively communicates documented data and results to necessary stakeholders. Generates and presents business case analyses to executive leadership to pursue digital enterprise opportunities. Enables digital transformation efforts by conducting research, driving new technical approaches and processes, as well as developing and managing testing of functionality.  Performs technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems. Analyses are performed at all levels of total system product to include: concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance and disposal. Ensures the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints. Performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications. Must Have Bachelor's Degree and 5 years of relevant exempt experience;   Master's Degree and 3 years of relevant professional experience;   Ph.D. and 0 years of experience.  Newport News Shipbuilding requires a Bachelor's Degree in engineering from an ABET accredited program. Nice to HaveA deep knowledge of design processes and toolsA knowledge of shipbuilding, including manufacturing, production, and sustain parts of the value streamStrong technical skills, particularly in the area of submarine and carrier design and constructionStrong management skills, able to work in ambiguity and with autonomyExperience and skill in communicating to various stakeholders including upper managementSkilled in computers including CAD/CAE/CAMExperience and knowledge of the Integrated Digital Shipbuilding (iDS) programWorking knowledge of Siemens solutions including Teamcenter and NXSecret Clearance Why HII We build the world's most powerful, survivable naval ships and defense technology solutions that safeguard our seas, sky, land, space and cyber. Recognized as one of America's top large company employers, we are a values and ethics driven organization that puts people's safety and well-being first. Working at HII is more than a job - it's an opportunity to build a future. Job Brief This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home.Crane Aerospace & Electronics has a unique and exciting career opportunity for a Systems Engineer II / III at our Burbank, CA location. Job Summary: This is a Senior Systems Engineer position that will perform engineering duties in researching, planning, designing, and developing products for use in the Aerospace marketplace. The Senior Systems Engineer works within a collaborative Integrated Product Team (IPT) environment managing requirements, defining architectures, performing integration testing and analysis. Crane Landing Systems has been the brake control system industry leader since introducing the first antiskid brake control system in 1947. This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home. Some conditions apply which will be discussed during the interview process. Full policy to be provided after hire. Essential Functions:Collaborate effectively with technical staff and cross functional groups to develop or test safety critical embedded software and systems. Perform analysis of requirements, design and code to assure compliance to standards and guidelines.Prepare technical documentation necessary to satisfy customer and program requirements.Contribute to all Systems Engineering aspects (architecture and components) from initial product research, architecture definition, requirements definition, systems verification, management and flow down to functional engineering groups. Support or lead the planning, modeling, simulation, specifications and integration of components that reside in a system comprised of electronic hardware, microcontrollers, embedded software or sensors. Act as a focal for hardware and software, mechanical systems, qualification, safety and reliability.Maintain hardware and software configurations during development, integration, flight test and certification. Help define the system architecture definition for landing systems with focus on brake control and monitoring systems in a structured environment to meet customer needs.Participate in the certification compliance activities of essential and critical level control systems for aircraft applications. Execute projects in accordance with schedules and budgets. Coordinate activities with others assigned within the Integrated Product Team. Minimum Qualifications :Experience: 3 to 5+ years of relevant work experience required.Knowledge: Understand Systems Engineering principles, including interpreting and writing requirements, system architectures and designs.     Experience of system development following industry recognized processes (e.g. ARP4754)Knowledge of requirements management, validation and verification.Skills/Abilities: Proficient with MS Office including Word, Excel and Outlook.     Working knowledge of requirements management tools (e.g. DOORS)Must demonstrate proficiency with verbal and written English for technical reports, presentations, analyses, or other communications at the appropriate level. Education/Certification: Must have a Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical, Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering (or equivalent) from a four-year college or university.Eligibility Requirement: This position requires access to controlled data or information and therefore only US persons will be considered. As a US Department of Defense contractor, we are bound by the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). Preferred Qualifications:Familiarity with modeling and simulation (ie. Simulink, SysML) a plus Experience leading system development activities following industry recognized processes (e.g. ARP4754A).Ability to interact with customers, provide superior technical, cost effective and schedule efficient solutions to complex engineering issues.Ability to lead systems team or cross functional engineering team on complex development programs.Ability to create and present systems material at Preliminary and Critical Design Reviews.Understanding and practical experience of DO-178C and DO-160.Aerospace industry development experience. Advanced degree in Systems Engineering, Modeling/Simulation, Controls, Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering About Crane: Crane Aerospace & Electronics supplies critical systems and components to the aerospace and defense markets. You’ll find Crane Aerospace & Electronics in some of the toughest environments: from engines to landing gear; from satellites to medical implants and from missiles to unmanned aerial systems (UAS). We are committed to operational excellence and world class processes. We employ Lean manufacturing techniques to optimize manufacturing efficiency and accuracy on all product lines. Our products are known for their technical strength, proven reliability and overall value. Several factors contribute to actual salary, including experience in a similar role or performing comparable job responsibilities, skills, training, and other qualifications. Compensation packages also include comprehensive benefits, 401K contribution and match, Paid Time Off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement and more. Systems Engineer II - $99,528 to $117,894 Systems Engineer III - $120,972 to $144,435 Some roles may be eligible for participation in performance-based bonus programs. You can see a list of our benefits at https://www.craneae.com/company/careers or visit our website at www.CraneAE.com for more information on our company and great opportunities. In our efforts to maintain a safe and drug-free workplace, Crane Aerospace & Electronics requires that candidates complete a satisfactory background check. FAA sensitive positions require employees to participate in a random drug test pool. This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work being performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Job Summary The Senior Mechanical Engineer is responsible for the design, development and execution of core battery mechanical system components and assemblies. The individual will be responsible for defining, documenting, and designing battery pack and battery module mechanical and thermal components and assemblies, and overseeing validation of those components and assemblies. An effective candidate is comfortable applying technical knowledge to innovative designs, driving resolution of challenges, and taking ownership of new product development activities. ResponsibilitiesApply technical knowledge to the on-time delivery of work products through the product development life cycle for each project.Own the design & development of efficient designs for components & sub-assemblies.Work in concert with manufacturing engineers in the development of processes & tools supporting manufacture and assembly.Component definition, sizing, selection, and design of battery module & pack mechanical and thermal components (e.g., battery structure, enclosures, injection molded plastics, cooling plates, mechanical joining methods).Work closely with Systems Engineers and CAE Engineers to prove out design concepts prior to pack prototype builds.Act as a mentor and advisor to Design Release Engineers (DREs) on the team.Key contributor to mechanical system DFMEAs/PFMEAs, DVP&Rs and Product & Process design reviews.Lead supplier evaluation and development for responsible commodities, in collaboration with purchasing.Support prototype system builds by ensuring parts are on time and that issues are resolved in a timely manner.Other duties as assigned.Predictable and reliable attendance. Position QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Mechanical/Aerospace/Chemical Engineering or equivalent degree with relevant experience.Minimum of five (5) years of experience in high voltage (>350V) electrification product design or product development.Proficient in root cause analysis and resolution.Proficient in understanding CAE models, including deciphering boundary conditions, assumptions, and model limitations.Adept in data processing and statistical analysis.Effective communicator, capable of concisely presenting highly technical test data to internal and external customers, as well as effectively communicating with suppliers.Experienced with the design, handling, and manufacture of high voltage lithium-ion battery systems.Educated on common automotive & industry standards.Familiar with the product design process.Self-motivated problem solver; pays attention to the details.Challenges the status quo and strives for continuous improvement.Abides by safety standards and protocols. Key CompetenciesDecision Making & Analysis: Makes sound decisions based upon a mixture of data-driven analysis, expertise, experience, and judgment; collects relevant information, seeking input from others, and identifies connections and/or root causes of problems.Takes Initiative: Exhibits strong drive for results and success; conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure; persists despite obstacles and opposition.Continual Improvement: Displays a consistent orientation toward producing the highest quality products or services, while keeping a focus on sustainability. Constantly looking for incremental improvements in work processes and results.Delivers Results: Achievement oriented, feeling a sense of urgency to reach goals on time, if not before.Mission, Vision, Values, and Strategic Priorities Focused: Understands and actively supports the organization’s mission, vision, values, and strategic priorities.

DescriptionHuman Resources Job Posting POSTING NO.: 101849 JOB TITLE: Field Equipment Engineer DEPT/DIV: M of E LOCATION: Manhattan - Midtown Full/Part Time: Full Application Deadline: Until Filled Compensation Grade F Established rate: $112,904.19 Opening: MTA Metro-North Railroad is a dynamic organization, operating out of the jewel of New York City, Grand Central Terminal. We provide service to over 86.5 million customers, traveling in and out of New York and Connecticut. A subsidiary of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, Metro-North Railroad is one of the busiest commuter railroad in the nation. MTA Metro-North Railroad strives to provide a safe and reliable commute, excellent customer service and rewarding opportunities to its employees. Position Objective Provide various engineering services to support the safe and reliable operation of the Metro-North Railroad rolling stock fleet. Engineering services include: Electrical, Mechanical, Manufacturing, Industrial, and Materials Engineering, advanced analytic services for Reliability Centered Maintenance, Reliability Availability and Maintainability, and Enterprise Asset Management, Quality functions, Technical Support, and Maintenance Planning. RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop equipment modifications. Review and process Equipment Change Requests (ECRs), design the equipment modifications, and write the instructions for implementation of such modifications. Develop Equipment Maintenance Instructions (EMIs), Equipment Overhaul Instructions (EOIs), and Maintenance Service Bulletin MSB) to create a standard of good maintenance and safety practice and to convey emergency repair information. Participate and provide engineering expertise in preparation of technical specifications and procurement of new fleet and overhaul of existing fleet and system. Support Revenue Service Operations proactively utilizing Wayside Monitoring and Diagnostic System (WMDS), Chief Logs, and IMS/AMS data management systems to minimize operational risk and identify trends. Retrieve and review downloads such as Real Time Data Monitoring (RTDM) and Event Recorder (ER) for train incidents and failure investigations. Provide technical evaluations detailing cause and corrective actions. Provide oversight and guidance to shop personnel for failure investigations, troubleshooting and repairs of all rolling stock. Utilize engineering principles in component failure analysis and provide detailed findings and technical bases for cause and resolution. Effectively contribute to the functions of all MofE departments, other Metro-North Railroad departments, other MTA agencies to support the rolling stock fleet reliability and operations efficiency. The Field Equipment Engineer coordinates directly with the Senior Field Equipment Engineer, Deputy Directors, and Director – Equipment Engineering, the Deputy Director – Quality Assurance, Maintenance Production staff of the M of E Department, as the projects assigned encompass the entire passenger railcar/locomotive fleet for the Railroad. The Field Equipment Engineer coordinates with MNR Capital Engineering and Consulting Engineers for information on the design and maintenance of new and rebuilt railcars and locomotives. The Field Equipment Engineer works closely with the Maintenance Production Staff and Shop Operational workforce on recommendations for improvement of cars and/or systems and subsystems. The Field Equipment Engineer coordinates with other passenger railroads to identify similar problems encountered and corrective actions taken. The Field Equipment Engineer interacts with other Operating Departments (Transportation, Power, etc.) when problems related to both departments requiring joint review and solution. Required Qualifications Must demonstrate a technical knowledge of either electrical or mechanical equipment systems to include, but not limited to, controls, power and pneumatic, microprocessor-based, high voltage, low voltage, system interfaces, and mechanical systems. Must be capable of interpreting existing electrical schematics and vendor supplied wiring, piping, diagrams necessary for troubleshooting rolling stock systems, subsystems and component-level. Strong problem solving and analytical skills to diagnose fleet problems and provide acceptable recommendations to maintenance supervision or workforce. Ability to understand regulatory rules and guidelines including FRA and APTA. Good interpersonal, organizational and both oral and written communication skills will all levels of MNR personnel. Working knowledge of test and diagnostic equipment. Experience in configuring replacement components and system assemblies for fit, form and function applications. Ability to determine appropriate functional requirements for equipment systems with regards to design and maintenance, based on reliability and risk analysis. Familiarity with FRA regulations, APTA standards as well as other industry related engineering standards. Strong written and oral communication skills. Strong technical writing skills for development of correspondence, reports, procedures and technical Instructions. Knowledge of standard safety practices rules and regulations in a railroad environment. Knowledge in the review and development of drawings, specifications and technical reports. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and/or comparable applications. CAD/CAE and Auto CAD experience or demonstrated equivalent. Position may be required to work various shifts and locations as assigned to support a 24-hour day/, 7 days a week operation. Will be on call and respond to emergencies as required. Must have valid driver's license. Required Education/Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or related technical field. Minimum of three (3) years of experience in an engineering environment and/or equipment manufacturer working on passenger railcars and/or locomotives or related mass transportation equipment or completion of the Metro-North Railroad Associate Engineer Program. Preferred Education/Experience Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering and/or Professional Engineering License. Other Information This is a safety sensitive position and subject to toxicology testing. As an employee of Metro-North Railroad you may be required to complete a New York State financial disclosure statement, if you earn more than $108,638.00 or if you hold a position designated as a policy maker. Employees driving company vehicles must complete defensive driver training once every three years for current MNR drivers; or within 180 days of hire or transfer for an employee entering an authorized driving position. Selection Criteria: Due to the competitive nature of the selection process, not all qualified candidates who meet the minimum requirements for the position are guaranteed an interview. To be selected for a position, one must meet the following criteria: (1) satisfy the minimum requirements listed in the job posting, (2) if applicable, successfully pass a written and practical exam, (3) satisfy a background investigation (including but not limited to, employment, education, and criminal history), and (4) pass a verbal interview. Metro-North may also require the applicant to undergo a physical ability test, and, if the Company extends a conditional offer, may require him or her to undergo a medical examination, which may include toxicological testing. Failure to pass any step within the hiring process will result in the disqualification of your application. Additional Criteria for Current Employees: Current Metro-North employees must be in active service to be eligible for consideration. Agreement Employees applying for a position outside of their present craft are required to have worked in your current union for at least one (1) year preceding the Application Deadline to be eligible to apply for a posted position, and have completed the agreed upon formal training commitment, including on-the-job training or lock-in requirement, if applicable (for example: Signal Trainee, Foreman-In-Training, etc.). If you are transferring to another craft, you may be required to forfeit your seniority in your present union. Non-agreement employees must have worked in your current position for a minimum of one (1) year preceding the Application Deadline. Along with a background investigation (including but not limited to, employment, education, and criminal history), employees are also subject to an internal investigation, which includes an evaluation not limited to discipline records and performance assessments. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package. If interested, please apply online at www.mta.info HOW TO APPLY: ALL APPLICANTS MUST APPLY ONLINE TO BE CONSIDERED. METRO-NORTH NO LONGER ACCEPTS HARD COPIES OF RESUMES. Qualified applicants can submit an online application by clicking on the 'APPLY NOW' button from either the CAREERS page or from the JOB DESCRIPTION page.  If you have previously applied on line for other positions, enter your User Name and Password. If it is your first registration, click on the CLICK HERE TO REGISTER hyperlink and enter a User Name and Password; then click on the REGISTER button. When applying for positions, please ensure that you attach a resume during the application process and that you receive a confirmation e-mail that your application was accepted. If you do not receive an email confirmation, your application may not have been received and will not be able to be considered after the deadline date. If you encounter problems, please call the BSC Customer Management Center at (646) 376-0123 Monday through Friday (except MTA-HQ holidays), 8:30am - 5:00pm. EMPLOYEES WHO DO NOT APPLY ON LINE VIA THE INTRANET MAY BE DISQUALIFIED FOR FURTHER CONSIDERATION FOR THIS POSITION. MTA and its subsidiary and affiliated agencies are Equal Opportunity Employers, including with respect to veteran status and individuals with disabilities. The MTA encourages qualified applicants from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and abilities, including military service members, to apply. MTA is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

CAE ENGINEER Location: US        Date: Nov 3, 2023                    CAE Engineer                        JOB SUMMARY                       CAE Engineer will be responsible to design chassis parts which meets all the requirements of different OEMs.             As part of this he will work very closely with Design Engineering team members.                        DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES                       To process a chassis component from pre-concept to production which typically includes the following key tasks:             1. Generate CAE models from concept designs, identifying problems and solutions and delivering detailed results             2. Build CAE models quickly meeting quality guidelines.             3. Liaise with customers’ Engineers to understand CAE requirements and deliverables.             4. Perform CAE analysis as per customer requirements             5. Work concurrently with CAD Design Engineer to develop appropriate structural solutions to meet performance requirements             6. Understand package restrictions from customers and ensure CAE proposals are production and manufacturing feasible             7. Arrange and lead CAE reviews.             8. Identify any training requirements and follow up.             9. The CAE Design Analyst will be expected to travel as required to support customer and company objectives. Approx. 90% of time will be spent on CAE in the office.                        EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE                       1. Minimum of four year engineering degree (major in Mechanical engineering) with CAE experience, though a Master’s degree is preferred.             2. 3-5 years’ experience in automotive CAE engineering design (preferably in chassis components)             3. Proficient in building quality CAE models quickly using Hypermesh or Ansa             4. Experienced with usage of Abaqus and Nastran             5. Experience with Optistruct, Design Life Fatigue analysis, Hypermorph is a plus.                       KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES                       1. Good communication skills to interact at all levels across the business including customers and suppliers             2. Strong team-working skills, decision-making, and ability to provide direction as appropriate.             3. Strong ability to mesh models primarily for Durability with emphasis on quality and timing             4. Ability to perform nonlinear and linear CAE analysis, including debugging convergence and other issues with Abaqus.             5. The ability to guide in generating design concepts that are fit for purpose, directionally correct and support the company’s overall objectives and strategy             6. Ability to understand, interpret and act upon results from analysis to optimize component designs             7. Knowledge of Microsoft software such as Excel, PowerPoint and Word             8. An understanding of stamping, tooling and welding processes would be a benefit. Proficient in CATIA V5. Solid and surface modelling             4. Knowledge of Siemens NX (UG) and TeamCenter is an added plus             5. Experience with DFMEA                        KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES                       1. An understanding of stamping, tooling and welding processes would be a benefit.             2. An understanding of CAD requirements and highly skilled in CATIA V5.             3. Understanding of drafting standards and geometric dimensioning and tolerancing.             4. Good communication skills to interact at all levels across the business including customers and suppliers             5.
